Required Documents

Required Documents
Resume showing relevant experience.
Veterans' documentation, if requesting consideration under any Veterans' hiring eligibilities (veterans’ preference and Veterans Recruitment Appointment).
If seeking eligibility based on any other special hiring authority (e.g. disabled veteran, Schedule A, special hiring programs).
ICTAP Eligibles: Must submit a copy of the appropriate documentation such as a reduction-in-force (RIF) separation notice, a SF-50 reflecting your RIF separation, or a notice of proposed removal for declining a direct reassign or transfer of function to another commuting area. You MUST also submit documentation to reflect your current (or last) performance rating of record of at least "fully successful" (Level III) or equivalent, along with your application/resume package.
If this position requires proof of higher education, you must submit a copy of your transcript(unofficial transcript) or a list of courses that includes the following information: name of accredited institution, grades earned, completion dates, and quarter and semester hours earned. Education completed in foreign colleges or universities may be used to meet the requirements. Please refer to http://www.opm.gov/qualifications/policy/ApplicationOfStds-04.asp for more information. Please be advised that an official transcript will be required if you are selected for the position.

If you are relying on your education to meet qualification requirements:
Education must be accredited by an accrediting institution recognized by the U.S. Department of Education in order for it to be credited towards qualifications. Therefore, provide only the attendance and/or degrees from schools accredited by accrediting institutions recognized by the U.S. Department of Education.
Failure to provide all of the required information as stated in this vacancy announcement may result in an ineligible rating or may affect the overall rating.
Benefits

Benefits
A career with the U.S. Government provides employees with a comprehensive benefits package. As a federal employee, you and your family will have access to a range of benefits that are designed to make your federal career very rewarding. Learn more about federal benefits.
Working for USAID offers comprehensive benefits including paid vacation, sick leave, holidays, life and health insurance, and the Federal Employees Retirement System. You can explore the benefits offered to most Federal employees at http://www.opm.gov/insure/health/. USAID's headquarters is in downtown Washington, D.C., at the Ronald Reagan Building and International Trade Center on 14th Street and Pennsylvania Avenue, N.W., on the Federal Triangle Metro Blue, Silver, and Orange Lines. The office is within walking distance of restaurants, shops, museums, and Washington Monument. A physical fitness facility and food court are on site. You will be eligible for telework in accordance with Agency policy.
Eligibility for benefits depends on the type of position you hold and whether your position is full-time, part-time, or intermittent. Contact the hiring agency for more information on the specific benefits offered.
Help
This job is open to
The public
U.S. citizens, nationals or those who owe allegiance to the U.S.
Clarification from the agency
All U.S. Citizens - No prior Federal experience required.

Basecamp Strategy is a fast-growing digital fundraising firm making a big impact in
politics. We’re digital storytellers who help to elect incredible people by raising our
clients as much money as possible online. Our core values as a company are doing good,
enjoying the experience, and growing our strength as an organization so that our
employees can live meaningful lives.


We’re hiring Editorial Fellows to join our team February 3rd.


Who we are:
We believe that people with good ideas CAN change the world when empowered
with the right tools and expertise.
We motivate donors with honesty and authenticity, and we don’t follow the
traditional playbook. We’re a team of specialists that’s here to challenge
assumptions and figure out what performs the best today, not what worked in 2014,
2016, 2018, or even 2020.
We are growing and evolving quickly as individuals and as a company. No one is
doing the same job they were doing six months ago, three months, or even a month
ago.
We want to bring new perspectives onto our team because we know that when
more voices are at the table, bigger, better, and bolder things happen. In both hiring
employees and recruiting clients, we approach every decision with a commitment to
increasing diversity and inclusion both within our team and within the Democratic
Party at large. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote regardless of
race, religion, color, national origin, sex, disability, sexual orientation, age, veteran
status, or higher-education status. Our Fellows and full-time employees are paid
according to transparent salary tiers.

Editorial Fellows will work alongside our Content and Digital teams, helping to ensure
that the voices of our candidates and clients are perfectly captured in every piece of
copy. This Fellowship is a great opportunity to build communications and fundraising
experience while supporting candidates, PACs, and organizations you believe in at every
level of our government.


WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING:
 Punching up email copy to make it more readable, impactful, and persuasive
Catching grammatical and production errors to ensure high-quality

fundraising emails
Fact-checking content and learning how to make decisions that maintain

ethics and integrity in digital fundraising
SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:
 A keen grasp of grammar and style conventions
A good eye for small errors; you’re detail-oriented and meticulous in your

work
A dedication to quality and integrity in digital fundraisingAn ability to assert your opinions while working flexibly with writers and

producers
The level-headedness to work quickly and calmly in fast-paced situationsA good eye for puns and wordplay; bringing a sense of fun, energy, and

human connection to a virtual workplace
A passion for progressive politics and a desire to truly make our country

better through your work
Final details:
The Fellowship will be run remotely, but our team remains a close-knit community. The
Fellowship lasts 3 months and includes a $1,500 / month stipend, as well as the home office
technology necessary to be successful.

Additional workplace features include: WOO! Fridays (“Work On Ourselves! Fridays” are
devoted to professional development and, for Fellows in particular, the exploration of other
departments); frequent virtual hangouts with food/drinks reimbursed; and participation in
various committees related to company values and culture.


If you enjoy a fast-paced environment, doing tremendously good work efficiently, thinking
outside the box, and figuring out how to go from great to incredibly great, you’ll love it
here.

To date, over 50% of Fellows have joined our team full-time after completing the
Fellowship, while another 25% joined 2020 campaigns or worked with us part-time as
freelancers while finishing their undergraduate degrees.

Even with the Presidential Election behind us, Fellows should expect an intensive,
fast-paced environment — and an incredibly rewarding experience.
Application process:
If you’re ready to dive right in and help us exceed our clients’ fundraising goals in 2021,
please send an email with a one-page resume and a statement of 100 words or fewer on
what previous experience has prepared you for the Editorial Fellowship role to
jobs@basecampstrategy.com.

Please use the subject line “[Firstname Lastname] - Basecamp Strategy Editorial
Fellowship.”


Please indicate in your application where you heard about this position and when you
would be available to start.

Company: Government of the District of Columbia
Text:
This position is located in the Office of State Superintendent of Education (OSSE), Office of Human Resources. The purpose of this position is to provide a wide range of technical, administrative, and strategic assistance to the Director Talent, OSSE Leadership Team and the State Superintendent. The incumbent will serve as advisor and project manager to the Director of Talent and Human Capital team.

Duties and Responsibilities
The incumbent works directly with the Talent and Human Capital Team on strategic planning and policy development for the OSSE. Appraises policy and operational situations and proposes directives, program organization techniques and policy recommendations to the Director of Talent, based on constant assessments of program operations. Utilizes program statistical data in conjunction with a thorough knowledge of departmental programs to achieve goals and objectives and develop presentations to assist stakeholders in formulating and implementing policy and procedural initiatives. Assists in providing structure, coordination, and oversight for strategic and operational planning for the OSSE Human Capital function and in the identification establishment and execution of priorities. Organizes task forces, which may involve outside experts or stakeholders, to address program and policy issues. Assignments are characterized by breath and intensity of effort and involve several phases being pursued concurrently or sequentially with the support of others within and outside of the OSSE. Collaborates with internal and external peers to drive work to completion on behalf of Talent and Human Capital efforts.

Additionally, the work includes various tasks involving different and unrelated processes and methods. Decisions, course of action and methodologies are based on knowledge and understanding of the priorities, commitments, and program goals of the OSSE and awareness of specific functions and assignments of staff of the OSSE. Work projects sometimes involve interpretation and application of standard practices to meet objectives. Lastly, OSSE is committed to our efforts for an inclusive workplace. The work will include furthering our internal diversity and inclusion work by researching industry related best practices and developing a process for executing and tracking organization-wide strategic goals and initiatives that have a measurable impact on our agency.
Qualifications and Experience
Specialized Experience: Experience that equipped the applicant with the particular knowledge, skills, and abilities to perform successfully the duties of the position, and that is typically in or related to the work of the position to be filled. To be creditable, specialized experience must have been equivalent to at least the next lower grade level in the normal line of progression for the occupation in the organization.
Master’s degree highly desired.
Licenses and Certifications
None
Working Conditions/Environment
Work is normally performed in an office environment. Occasionally, the incumbent may be required to visit various locations within the District of Columbia.
Other Significant Factors
Tour of Duty: Varies
Duration of Appointment: This is an Education Service (ES), “At-Will” Appointment. All positions and appointments in the Education Service serve at the pleasure of the appointing authority and may be terminated at any time with or without cause.
Promotion Potential: No known promotional potential
Plan, Series, Grade: CS-0301-14
Salary: $103,657 - $113,617; based on available funding
Collective Bargaining Unit (Non-Union): This position is not covered under a collecting bargaining agreement.
Position Designation: In accordance with Chapter 4 of the D.C. personnel regulations, Suitability, this position has been deemed Security-Sensitive. Accordingly, the incumbent will be subject to pre-employment checks (criminal background checks, consumer credit check, traffic record checks, and drug screenings, if applicable) as a condition of employment, and will be subject to periodic criminal background checks for the duration of your tenure.
Emergency Designation: This position has been designated as emergency and acceptance of this offer confirms you agree to adhere to the policies in sections 1271 and 1274 of DPM Chapter 12, regarding Emergency employees. As an emergency employee, you will be required to either report to work, stay at work, or telework (if directed to do so) during a declared emergency or during a period of non-emergency where your duties have been deemed as critical District government functions/operations. You may be required to perform other duties outside of your position description during a period of a declared emergency (such as manual labor, shelter services, etc.).
Residency Preference: Applicants claiming “Residency Preference” will be required to maintain residency in the District of Columbia for a minimum of seven (7) years. Failure to do so may result in forfeiture of employment.
EEO Statement: The District of Columbia Government is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status, personal appearance, sexual orientation, family responsibilities, matriculation, physical handicap, or political affiliation.

Text: Quasar is looking for a Leasing Manager to join our team. The Leasing Manager must be a quick-thinker, and an organized individual who is able to multitask. Within the past year, we have increased our asset management portfolio by over 300,000 SF and are continuing to grow. Analyze consumer preferences to determine the potential sales of a product or service. Analyze prices, methods of marketing and distribution. Tripleseat, a leading cloud, sales and catering management platform, is seeking a highly motivated, driven, and talented, Regional Sales Manager that has experience working the full sales funnel from lead generation to close. If you like to sell and have a passion for the hospitality industry then Tripleseat is the right place for you.

What you will do:

Meet and exceed the Tripleseat subscription revenue quota for the assigned territory and accounts.
Identify prospects in the assigned territory to achieve a qualified pipeline.
Build, own, and execute sales strategy.
Use formal professional selling practices and tools.
Update and maintain CRM database and provide accurate weekly reports reflecting territory and pipeline status
Travel within territory (when it is safe to do so)

What we are looking for:

Demonstrated success in achieving quota in software sales and/or SaaS sales.
3-5 years software sales experience is required.
Ability to establish and manage executive level customer relationships.
Ability to handle multiple complex sales cycles simultaneously.
Successful track record of working effectively in a remote work environment with extended team members.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills: writing, editing and presenting
Ability to present technical concepts in a clear manner to prospective customers
An effective team player that has the ability to work well across all company functions.
Sense of Humor

This a fully remote position and we are looking for eligible candidates located in the Washington, D.C. area.

Duties
Summary
This position is located in the NNSA Human Resources office. A successful candidate in this position will share fully in management of HR program elements and functions, providing leadership and expertise for the full implementation of human resources policies and practices and for delivering the full spectrum of HR services required to support the Field Offices, NNSA Albuquerque Complex, and NNSA Headquarters in the accomplishment of their missions across the NNSA complex.

Responsibilities
 As the Assistant Human Resources Officer (Deputy Director) you will:

Share fully in management of HR program elements and functions, providing leadership and expertise for the full implementation of human resources policies and practices and for delivering the full spectrum of Human Capital (HC) management services required to support the Field Offices, NNSA Albuquerque Complex, and NNSA Headquarters in the accomplishment of their missions across the NNSA complex.
Be responsible for directing the work of administrative and technical subordinate staff responsible for diverse but interrelated HC management functions, organized in 3 divisions and 1 Policy and Initiatives organization, located in Albuquerque, Germantown, and Washington DC.
Share fully in the Director’s responsibilities and authorities for supervision, coordination, and integration of numerous important projects, programs, and functions involving highly complex administrative, technical, and managerial work. Supervisory authority includes full responsibility for all personnel actions associated with the subordinate staff and for decisions concerning organizational structure and resource requirements.
Ensure compliance with legal and regulatory requirements by designing and conducting surveys and audits encompassing the entire NNSA organization, identifying compliance gaps, and instituting corrective measures.
Communicate effectively, verbally and in writing, in order to defend, explain, and promote program initiatives.

Travel Required
25% or less - To conduct HR business services across a geographically dispersed organization and for outreach and recruitment activities.
Supervisory status
Yes
Promotion Potential
04 - Position is at the full performance level of the NQ-04 pay band. Total adjusted salary is dependent on locality pay of either DC or Albuquerque, NM.
Job family (Series)
0201 Human Resources Management

Requirements

Requirements
Conditions of Employment
 REQUIREMENTS of Employment:

Compliance with Homeland Security Presidential Directive (HSPD-12) governing personal identity which will require that you provide two forms of identification.A one year probationary or supervisor probationary period may be required.
Must be able to obtain and maintain a Q clearance

Random drug testing
Males must abide by Selective Service registration requirements
This employer participates in the e-Verify program.
You must be a United States Citizen.
Qualifications
SPECIALIZED EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:

A qualified candidate’s online application and resume must demonstrate at least one year of specialized experience at or equivalent to the next lower NNSA pay band or GS grade level in the Federal service i.e., NQ-03 or GS-14. Specialized experience for this position is defined as: Substantial experience as a director or senior manager providing leadership and expertise for the full implementation of federal civilian human resources policies and practices and for delivering the full spectrum of Human Capital (HC) management services required to support a federal agency in the accomplishment of its missions and goals. Experience should include the following HR program areas: recruitment and staffing; position management, classification, compensation, performance management and employee relations; employee benefits; and manpower and organizational management. Developing and implementing plans that include HR goals, objectives, budget, resources, metrics and actions needed to execute the goals and outcomes of strategic plans. Your resume needs to address the required specialized experience.

Your application and resume should demonstrate that you possess the following knowledge, skills and abilities (KSAs). Do not provide a separate narrative written statement. Rather, you must describe in your application how your past work experience demonstrates that you possess the KSAs identified below. Cite specific examples of employment or experience contained in your resume and describe how this experience has prepared you to successfully perform the duties of this position. DO NOT write "see resume" in your application!

Knowledge and skill of federal laws, rules, and regulations; including OPM, Title 5 CFR, MSPB, EEOC, and Comptroller General decisions, pertaining to employment, management, compensation, development of a Federal workforce in order to determine the significance and impact of the regulations and apply them to the planning, administration, and evaluation of a Federal HR management program.
Skill in the application of program and administrative management principles and business administration practices with a specialized and extensive knowledge of the principles and techniques required to independently plan and carry out an innovative, comprehensive human capital management program.
Skill to provide technical and administrative direction to a large diversified group of administrative, technical and clerical staff members.

Skill to communicate effectively, verbally and in writing, in order to defend, explain, and promote program initiatives.

"Experience" refers to paid and unpaid experience. Examples of qualifying unpaid experience may include: volunteer work done through National Service programs (such as Peace Corps and AmeriCorps); as well as work for other community-based philanthropic and social organizations. Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills; and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.

Time-in-Grade: You must have completed 52 weeks in a position equivalent to the next lower pay band or grade in the federal service, i.e., NQ-03/NN-04 or GS-14.

CTAP/ICTAP candidates: To be considered "well qualified" you must meet all of the requirements as described in this section.

You must meet all qualifications and eligibility requirements within 30 days of the closing date of this announcement.
Education

There are no education requirements for this position, you must meet the one year of specialized experience as stated in this announcement.
Additional information
The U.S. Department of Energy fosters a diverse and inclusive workplace and is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

JobTitle: Enterprise Sales Executive – Government and Education - REMOTE
Text:
We have great people here and are looking for more. Come join us - you will love it!

Job Title: Enterprise Sales Executive – Government and Education - REMOTE
Vertical: Industrial, Government and Education
Job Type: Full Time / Exempt
Location: Work from anywhere - US
About the role:
As an Enterprise Sales Executive for our Government and Education Vertical, you’ll target and close major Government and Education clients. You’ll build and maintain your own pipeline of business prospects, qualify leads, handle negotiations and close contracts with Federal and SLED clients.
This is what you’ll do:
Build out Sterling’s growing Government & Education Vertical with broad responsibility for large, complex deals and client relationships
Utilize your extensive network of Federal, State and Local relationships, as well as deep experience in the government market to cultivate opportunities
Review and analyze market data to develop and implement your own business plan and utilize company resources to maximize results
Gain an understanding of our client/prospects’ organizational dynamics and business processes to uncover needs and key decision makers
Develop and deliver technical sales presentations, proposals, and solutions
Participate in regular structured sales & training programs to improve sales performance
Travel (once travel is safe again) up to 50% of the time
This Is The Job For You If You Are:
Knowledgeable about HHS, DHS, DOD, DOC, DOL , DOJ, among others
Collaborative in your approach to establishing overall solution strategies, themes and strengths that clearly differentiate service offerings
Adept at shaping requirements and building acquisition strategies towards sourcing opportunities, business development and capture efforts on multi-million-dollar opportunities
Well-versed with all aspects of capture management, from opportunity identification, proposal development, contract negotiation, and relationship/project management
This Is What We're Looking For:
8-10 years of business development experience with a proven track record in the Federal and/or SLED market
Superior client facing interaction skills including negotiation tactics and client presentations
Excellent time management skills and strong attention to detail
Ability to navigate within large multi-product organizations and close large deals
Background in identity solutions, fingerprinting programs, and/or digital identity, preferred but not required
Experience selling consulting, research services, and/or background screening services is ideal
Strong background in consultative and solution-based sales
Proficiency with tools like Salesforce, Outlook, Word, Excel, and Power Point
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written. Writing and email skills need to be particularly strong along with excellent organization skills
Follow us:

www.instagram.com/sterlingcheck

www.linkedin.com/company/sterlingcheck

www.facebook.com/SterlingCheck/


Equal Employment Opportunities at Sterling

Sterling is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, creed, national origin or ancestry, ethnicity, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or related conditions), gender identity and expression, age, disability, citizenship, sexual orientation, military service, genetic information, and any other characteristic protected by law. In addition, Sterling is committed to taking affirmative action to employ and to advance in employment individuals regardless of race, color, religion, creed, national origin or ancestry, ethnicity, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or related conditions), gender identity and expression, age, marital status, disability, citizenship, sexual orientation, military service and genetic information; and to base all employment decisions only on valid job requirements.
Disclaimer

This job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to the job.

Duties
Summary
A successful candidate in this position will serve as a Congressional Liaison as it relates to agency programs. These activities include monitoring and tracking actions at various stages in the appropriations process, bringing legislative issues that impact the Department to the attention of decision-makers, assisting the ExCo Team in coordinating and preparing senior executives for hearings and ensuring the flow of budget-related information.

Responsibilities
As a Congressional Liaison, you will serve as a liaison between the DOE and the appropriations staff as it relates to DOE programs. Primary duties include monitoring and tracking actions at the various stages in the appropriations process bringing legislative issues that impact the Department to the attention of decision-makers, assisting the ExCo Team with preparing senior executives for briefings, hearings, and ensuring the flow of budget-related information between the Department and the Appropriations Committees and Subcommittees.

Selectee(s) will:

Develop and implement policies and strategies that affect DOE programs and initiatives to protect and advance the Department's interests. Work in conjunction with DOE leadership to formulate, analyze and execute budget policies to support and defend the President's annual budget on Energy and National Security.
Monitor and report on the progress of appropriation bills, budget amendments, and supplemental funding, as these action progress through the Appropriations Committees and Congress.
Coordinate with senior executive staff on developing strategies for presenting program budgets to Congress, planning briefings and testimony for top Departmental Officials scheduled to appear before Congressional staff and committees. Ensure appropriate action is taken to conform to the desires and intent of Congress.
Develop and implement policies affecting the organization’s programs and initiatives and in developing strategies to protect and advance the Department’s interests. Work closely with Committee staff as major legislation and amendments are considered by Congress, and routinely monitor and track hearings, markups, and floor actions through to passage of legislation.

Travel Required
Occasional travel - Approximately 10% or less travel may be required to attend meetings, conferences and training.
Supervisory status
No
Promotion Potential
14
Job family (Series)
0301 Miscellaneous Administration And Program
Requirements

Requirements
Conditions of Employment

OTHER REQUIREMENTS:

You may be required to complete a one-year probationary period, if not previously completed in a competitive or other excepted service position.

If selected, you will be required to complete a Confidential Financial Disclosure, OGE-450 form upon entry into the position and annually thereafter.
Qualifications
SPECIALIZED EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS: Specialized Experience is experience that equipped an applicant with the knowledge, skills, and abilities (KSAs) needed to perform the work of the position to be filled. A qualified candidate's online application and resume must demonstrate at least one year of specialized experience equivalent to the GS-13 grade level in the Federal service. Specialized experience for this position is defined as:

Preparing and reviewing responses to inquiries (e.g., telephone calls, letters, or requests for capability or impact statements) on the budget by Members of Congress and Congressional staff.
Leading or managing strategic engagements with Congress for coordination, negotiation, and information exchange on complex funding and policy issues.
Interacting directly with Members of Congress and/or Congressional staff to communicate positions and views in support of mission, programs, budget, and legal authorities.
Developing guidance for senior officials to pursue in effecting Congressional support for major programs.
Your application and resume should demonstrate that you possess the following knowledge, skills and abilities (KSAs). Do not provide a separate narrative written statement. Rather, you must describe in your application how your past work experience demonstrates that you possess the KSAs identified below. Cite specific examples of employment or experience contained in your resume and describe how this experience has prepared you to successfully perform the duties of this position. DO NOT write "see resume" in your application.

Knowledge of a wide range of qualitative methods in analyzing and interpreting legislative actions, reports, and other evidence of Congressional intent, and relating those requirements to budget and program delivery.
Knowledge of the viewpoints of Members and the professional staffs of Congressional Committees on Department budget requests and programs, and the attitude of the individuals on issues of the organizational policy and budget execution.
Knowledge of the Federal budget process.
Knowledge of major policy themes and program emphases, which have to be stressed in testimony, briefings, and supporting budget documents.
Ability to effectively communicate orally and in writing to prepare written responses, and brief senior audiences.

"Experience" refers to paid and unpaid experience. Examples of qualifying unpaid experience may include: volunteer work done through National Service programs (such as Peace Corps and AmeriCorps); as well as work for other community-based philanthropic and social organizations. Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills; and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.

Time-in-Grade: Current Federal employees must meet time-in-grade requirements by the closing date of this announcement to receive consideration.

CTAP/ICTAP candidates: To be considered "well qualified" you must meet all of the requirements as described in this section.

You must meet all qualifications and eligibility requirements by the closing date of this announcement.

Education must be obtained from an accredited institution recognized by the U.S. Department of Education.

Foreign education must be reviewed by an organization recognized by the U.S. Department of Education. For special instructions pertaining to foreign education and a list of organizations that can evaluate foreign education, see the Department of Education website.

JobTitle: Federal Sales Manager, Civilian (Washington, DC) (Remote Available)
Text:
Position Description:

The Federal Sales Manager (FSM) will lead the sales process within an assigned territory within the Federal Civilian market (Departments of Justice, Labor, Education and Agriculture).

We are seeking an FSM who will continually ensure assigned territory growth and profitability by developing solid business relationships with new and existing clients for Okta. You will plan and execute strategies and sales tactics in the following areas: territory planning, strategic account management, executive relationship development, presentation and delivery, negotiating, closing and executing contracts.

The candidate will identify leads and opportunities, both directly and through the agency vendor ecosystem, to market Okta products and services that will meet potential client's needs. You will initiate contact meet with clients, with the objective to exceed quota, move prospects into implementation, and expand Okta presence across assigned client base. Candidate will lead sales campaigns, initiating customized proposals and communication for clients, and develop familiarity with potential clients to best meet their mission priorities. It is important that the candidate exercises leadership, demonstrate effective sales planning, and work in a positive and motivating way with internal counterparts and external clients.


Job Duties and Responsibilities:

Meet or exceed monthly, quarterly and yearly revenue targets
Develop and execute a comprehensive regional plan
Accelerate customer adoption
Continually Build and Grow a robust sales pipeline
Work with partners to extend reach
Work with Federal System Integrators to build Okta into Program offerings
Lead contract negotiations
Develop long-term strategic relationships with key accounts
Ensure customer happiness and success
Client Related Travel Expected


Required Skills:

10+ years Federal technology and cloud Sales experience
Experience selling SaaS software solutions
5+ years of experience focused on Civilian Accounts
Hunter mentality with solid Sales DNA
Strong verbal and written communications skills
Extensive customer network
BS/BA degree strongly preferred

Okta is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

 #LI-SD1

The Capital Area Food Bank in Washington DC seeks a mission-driven, detail oriented and analytically minded Service Insights Manager to help drive forward our Service Insights Initiative, our commitment to better serving the region by better understanding our clients. The Service Insights Initiative (SI) is supported by Link2Feed (l2F), a client intake data collection software that informs CAFB’s work providing food and related services to the community. The position will work/collaborate throughout the CAFB and with our community partners to ensure the L2F data system is not only implemented across our service area, but that the data being collected is analyzed to provide the insights needed to inform CAFB programs and resources. A main objective of this position is to steadily grow the number of organizations using Link2Feed throughout our network of food assistance organizations. This position will require skills in project management, public speaking, training, data analysis, systems management, and team leadership. The ideal applicant has experience working with diverse audiences and the ability to make technology accessible and helpful to inexperienced users. Additionally, this applicant will have excellent communication and project management skills as success in this role will require cross-departmental collaboration.

Essential Functions:
Training and Support:
Develop, update and maintain onboarding and training materials and program to implement Link2Feed (L2F) platform at CAFB food assistance partners
Conduct regularly scheduled trainings to ensure proper use of system by both new and previously onboarded partners
Summarize and share feedback from partners related to software and training materials and adjust as needed
Assist partner agencies with technology, process or system issues
Work with CAFB TEFAP coordinators to ensure federal regulations are being met by L2F system and associated processes
Manage part-time or full-time SI Trainers as they seek to implement L2F across the partner network

Project Management:
Collaborate with CAFB leadership team on Service Insights strategy related to implementation roll-out and budget planning
Lead SI Team to implement strategic plan by setting goals, collaborating with other departments, collecting feedback, managing the project and ensuring that milestones are met
Serve as main point of contact with vendor, Link2Feed; participate in meetings and submit monthly invoices
Engage internal food bank staff in the work of the SI Team, including regular data reviews and project updates
Consult on hardware purchases and other technology needs for optimal service insights set-up and usage at sites
Through partnership with Director of Analytics and third-party consultants, develop tool/solution to ensure comprehensive data collection from all marquee partner agencies that have their own data collection system/processes implemented.
Collaborate with and support CAFB internal program teams as they transition to the Link2Feed system

Systems Management & Data Analysis:
Serve as the food bank’s system administrator for Link2Feed system, responsible for system maintenance, user management, data quality assurance and reporting
Establish program key performance indicators to be regularly reported to CAFB leadership team
Work closely with Director of Analytics on integrating Link2Feed data into the CAFB’s organizational data collection efforts and impact reporting
Conduct a regular database review and data clean-up to ensure accurate and complete information is being entered; develop a data communications guideline and data review process
Regularly analyze Link2Feed data and share key reports and insights with CAFB staff
Performs other duties as assigned

Bachelor’s Degree (B.A. or B.S.) in related field
Ability to analyze and communicate complex information clearly and concisely to a broad and diverse audience
Excellent oral and written communication skills and strong interpersonal skills
Exhibits excellent public speaking skills
Proven track record of teaching adults of varying technical ability and ages new skills in technology
Valid driver’s license, able to navigate the DC metro area by car and/or metro; travel in underserved communities
Prior experience in variety of database systems
Great project management skills, with a high attention to detail
Professional, accountable, and results-oriented, with the ability to work independently
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills that enhance how people interact with data systems
Experience gathering and analyzing data, and using it to make decisions
Must be proficient at Microsoft Office

Other Skills/Abilities:
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks
Spanish language skills a plus
Ability to work professionally with a diverse constituent base
Present a professional appearance and demeanor
Knowledge of the Washington metro area preferred
Experience with federal nutrition programs preferred

Work Environment:
Normal business office, with frequent tight deadlines
Currently most office staff are in remote work based on COVID-19 safety protocol
This position’s main office will be the DC Office in NE, Washington, DC; however, working from the CAFB NOVA Branch in Lorton, Virginia will also be necessary as well as regularly visiting partner sites throughout the CAFB service area
Regular work hours are Monday through Friday from 8:30am to 5:00pm; hours flexible to support agency trainings/distributions, with weekends or extended hours for special events.

WHAT WE DO MATTERS:

Here at The Knot Worldwide, we believe in doing work that matters. In 16 countries around the world, our leading family of brands (The Knot, WeddingWire, Bodas, Hitched, The Bash, The Bump, and more) inspire, inform, and celebrate our communities as they move through life's milestones. Our couples and business partners depend on us. They're all in. So are we.

ABOUT THE ROLE AND OUR TEAM:

The primary responsibility of the Venue Account Executive is to hit monthly sales goals by engaging with wedding professionals in our Venue and Catering categories across a variety of regions. Using a consultative sales process, our Account Executives build rapport with business owners to advise them on best practices and how to stay ahead of technology and industry trends through The Knot and The Wedding Wire's advertising platforms. Our Account Executives are independent, highly-motivated, and can successfully achieve monthly sales goals. They excel in creating connections, building rapport with business owners and decision makers, and understanding their goals and needs.

The Venue Account Executive role requires sales experience and ability to manage a longer sales cycle and pipeline. The Venue New Business Program had phenomenal success in 2020, and we're looking for motivated, assertive, and confident team members to join our team for 2021! We prefer this role to reside in our DC, Austin or NYC offices; however we are open to remote candidates. (Note: This position is open to fully remote candidates and may be performed anywhere in the United States, except for in the state of Colorado.)

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Consistently meet and exceed monthly quotas as well as daily activity expectations
Successfully manage a sales pipeline from start to finish
Make a high volume of sales calls on a daily basis
Ability to manage a longer and diverse sales process and pipeline, including identifying decision makers
Build and maintain strong rapport over the phone with potential clients to uncover prospect needs and give a strong, crisp and on-point presentation over the phone
Be persistent - consistently follow up with potential clients to negotiate contracts and close agreements to maximize profits
Ability to organize work day and be proactive with time management
Track notes on all interactions and keep opportunities in your pipeline up to date in Salesforce

SUCCESSFUL ACCOUNT EXECUTIVE, VENUE CANDIDATES HAVE:

At least 2-3 years of sales experience, preferably in B2B sales or hospitality industry
Strong analytical skills to identify trends, understand challenges, propose solutions and evaluate results
Confidence and enthusiasm when presenting information to decision makers
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with strong ability to engage and persuade
Experience delivering client-focused solutions to customer needs
Excellent interpersonal, problem-solving, presentation, and organizational skills
Proven success in a fast-paced, constantly evolving and competitive team environment
Ability to work independently, as well as be a collaborative team member
Experience with Salesforce.com or another CRM system
Bachelor's degree preferred

At The Knot Worldwide, we believe you are more than a resume and invite you to go for it, take the leap of faith, and apply for this job if it sparks your passion to join TKWW and make a difference!

WHAT WE LOVE ABOUT YOU:

You Dream Big. You iterate and experiment to drive innovation.
You Love Our Users. You keep our global community at the center of everything you do.
You Respect All Voices. Inclusion strengthens us and powers your decisions.
You Hustle Every Day. You favor urgency and own your outcomes.
You Win Together. People are at the heart of our success and you play as a team.

WHAT YOU LOVE ABOUT US:

The Knot Worldwide offers a unique employee experience and we are deeply proud of our award-winning culture. From flexible vacation and generous parental leave benefits to promoting wellness and giving back to our community, we believe in happiness above all else—in and out of the office.

JobTitle: Associate Campaign Director, Multiracial Democracy Building
Text: Location: Remote (Washington, D.C. preferred)Reports to: Associate VP of StrategyArea:  Policy & AdvocacyPosition Type: 100% FTEOrganization OverviewHispanics in Philanthropy (HIP) is a transnational network of grantmakers committed to strengthening Latino communities across the Americas. HIP connects and convenes funders, nonprofits, researchers, and other leaders to identify emerging needs among Latinos as well as best practices for responsive and effective funding of social change. HIP pioneers new philanthropic models by leading collaborative initiatives and has provided grants and training to help build the capacity of more than 600 organizations and leaders.For nearly four decades, HIP has nurtured community strength and leadership to shift the balance of power to those historically discounted and disadvantaged, allowing them agency over their lives and the ability to be dynamic actors in the creation of their own impact narrative. When they are at decision-making tables, when they are represented in leadership positions, when there is equity in access to basic services, and when the means to thrive equitably sits in their hands -- this is when our community thrives. Along these lines, HIP will work to build a multiracial democracy campaign by investing in movement building, racial justice, policy advocacy, protection and expansion of safe civic space and discourse, voting and civic engagement. Through this lens, HIP’s existing work will be impacted, integrated, and amplified (i.e., gender equity, migration, small business investment, narrative change).Position SummaryThe Director will be responsible for building policy, grantmaking, and grantee and funder engagement strategies to identify HIP’s role and function in ensuring multiracial democracy building at every level of political life with Latinx communities in close alliance with other BIPOC communities. This role will require substantive civic engagement, movement building, grassroots organizing and policy analysis and recommendations. Collaborating closely with the Assoc. Director of Policy, as well as programs and communications staff, the Director will develop and implement advocacy and civic engagement strategies that further HIP’s campaign priorities. The Director will focus primarily on U.S. campaigns and provide support for our Mexico-based team to support the development of democracy building work in other Latin American locations as possible and resource-dependent.Core ResponsibilitiesBuild HIP’s strategy for the Multiracial Democracy Building campaign with a intersectoral lens across civic engagement, movement building, and racial justice;Drive Multiracial Democracy Building campaigns, in close collaboration with programmatic and communications teams, to increase resources to community groups and convene and inform relevant actors including funders and grantee partners;Lead centralized capacity building initiatives with grantees in coordination with consultants and field experts;Lead grantmaking efforts in support of campaign priorities;Monitor relative legislative and regulatory activity and produce high impact policy analysis and recommendations;Work with our communications teams to produce timely campaign statements, talking points, and other materials and messaging to advance HIP’s campaign’s agenda and inform key actors (ie funders and grantees) of campaign developments and pending issues;Provide editorial support and guidance to executive leadership;Develop and manage key partnerships in advancing civic engagement, movement building and advocacy strategies in priority issue areas, in close collaboration with the Associate Director of Policy and Advocacy; andRepresent HIP to external audiences, informing and educating the philanthropy sector, external and internal stakeholders about issues impacting Latinx communities.QualificationsSeven or more years of civic engagement, movement building, leadership development or related experience;Deep knowledge and demonstrated experience in analyzing policy and advocacy issues affecting Latinx communities;Expertise in one (or more) of HIP’s priority areas (ie migration, gender equity, racial and ethnic justice, LGBTQ communities, powerbuilding and civic engagement), and/or place based work (the southwest and southeast preferred);Proven track record of influencing policy outcomes and successfully building partnerships and coalitions with grassroots organizations, managing advocacy/ movement building campaigns;Ability to analyze and synthesize complex information, discern key issues of interest, and communicate clearly and concisely verbally and in writing;Exceptional writing and editing skills;Demonstrated experience successfully building relationships, coalitions and campaigns with diverse stakeholders while maintaining diplomacy;Demonstrated project management experience and success managing multiple projects at the same time;Ability to thrive in a highly collaborative environment while also possessing the ability to work well independently with minimal supervision;Strong organizational skills, detail oriented, and the ability to consistently meet deadlines;Skilled public speaker;Grant management and funder engagement experience;Commitment to HIP’s mission and values, including racial equity;Ability to work remotely with virtual teams across the U.S. and in Mexico City; andAbility to travel as needed.Desired QualificationsFluent in English and Spanish;Previous nonprofit experience; andFamiliarity with foundations and grantmaking institutions, intermediary philanthropy, and the role of philanthropy support organizations.CompensationHispanics in Philanthropy offers a competitive compensation package that includes a range of benefits for full-time employees including medical, dental, vision, 401K matching, commuter check benefits, discounts on services, as well as sick, vacation, and paid holiday time.Physical Demands and Work Environment: Daily use of computer and phone for regular communications with staff and team members. This position may be a remote position or based out of the Oakland office. Some travel will be required.How to Apply: Submit an application (https://forms.gle/djvcB5m3DRbiVjW3A) to be considered for this position. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis with preference to applications received by March 5th. Required materials include a cover letter, resume, and a writing sample. Incomplete applications will not be considered.Three references, at least two from a former supervisor, will be requested of those continuing through the interview process.Hispanics in Philanthropy is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.Job Type: Full-timeSchedule:Monday to FridayWork Remotely:Yes

Cloud Services Sales Executive
Location: Remote in the MA, RI, NH, ME, CT, VT Areas
Join us as a Cloud Services Sales Executive on our Virtustream East Region team in New England to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.
What you’ll achieve
As a Cloud Services Sales Executive, you will have the exciting opportunity to help drive the market share growth through new logo acquisition and shape the future of a rapidly growing organization.
This role is chartered to drive our Google Cloud Platform Services, Azure Managed Services, Security Services, and Virtustream Enterprise Cloud in commercial companies in the greater New England area.
Highly motivated, driven, self-starters who are passionate about the hunt and creating success wanted.
You will:
Drive market share growth by securing new logo revenue in a defined territory.
Demonstrable experience as a true Hunter in developing C-level relationships to drive market share growth from new logo capture
Demonstrate business acumen in presenting solutions on an ROI basis, strategies, successful penetration of new accounts, and building successful client relationships across an entire spectrum
Develop and execute against a comprehensive account/territory plan
Take the first step towards your dream career
Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:
Essential Requirements
Minimum of 7 years of professional Enterprise Managed Services Sales experience selling Managed Services, Consulting Services, or similar solutions tied to enterprise application management and hosting.
Knowledgeable in Cloud Computing, Professional and Managed Services, and/or IT Solutions practice area.
Highly developed selling, customer relations and negotiations skills with the ability to effectively communicate with C-level executives and line of business representatives
Ability to travel (when possible), in designated area up to 50% of the time
Experience selling Managed Services to the Healthcare industry
Desirable Requirements
SAP HANA experience is a plus
Experience selling Managed Services
Here’s our story; now tell us yours
Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.
What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life - while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.
We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today.
You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here.

Job ID: R081553

Overview:

GovernmentCIO is currently seeking a dynamic Release Manager to join our team supporting the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA), OIT Veterans Experience Services Portfolio and Data Access Services (DAS) Program Management Office (PMO). The candidate will be a member of the PMO team providing matrixed administrative and technical support services within a high profile and fast-paced environment using DevSecOps principles. The ideal candidate will have a thorough understanding of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) using agile software development methodologies (Scrum, SAFe, DevSecOps) and be proficient with Jira and VA mandated tools such as MS SharePoint and ServiceNow. The candidate must be adept at using technology to facilitate remote collaboration with geographically dispersed and cross-functional stakeholders in order to interface and communicate with the DAS development teams, test managers, operations staff and Senior Leadership.
Responsibilities:

The Release Manager is a position of trust that is responsible for implementing and managing the DAS software release processes for code through all phases of the SDLC, including:
Monitoring of DAS pre-Change Control Board (CCB) Intake items, analysis for clear and testable Acceptance Criteria, and validation of the details required for CCB decisions.
Function as checkpoint for DAS predevelopment milestones, including Security Compliance and Enterprise Architecture Design Patterns.
Review Test Scripts and Test Execution Records for completeness and traceability back to Business Requirements and Acceptance Criteria.
Ensure all Work Items contained in the Release Candidate Build has fulfilled the Release Qualifiers and all necessary documentation is complete.
Identify deployment risks based on test results, environmental issues, partner constraints, or other concerns.
Report on the Pre-Production Deployment, incorporating any findings as needed to prepare for a smooth Production deployment.
Host the Go/No-Go for VA Leadership and provide a formal release recommendation based on the cumulative findings from the Readiness Review.
The Release Manager will coordinate with the DAS Team and relevant stakeholders to complete all required phases of the release management process and assists with documenting the project in Jira, ServiceNow, and other VA mandated tools while supporting the PMO and VA Project Manager with other aspects of project management and reporting as required. The ideal candidate will have:
Tools Proficiency:
Proven experience with Agile/DevSecOps projects
Proficiency with Jira, including add-ons (i.e. X-ray, Confluence, Roadmap)
Proficiency with ServiceNow and other VA mandated tools
Experience with all phases of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)
Soft Skills:
Must be highly organized and self-motivating; maintaining high integrity and high confidence
Must be highly effective at communicating both vertically and horizontally with team members and senior staff regarding release management activities, risks, and opportunities
Must have strong investigative and analytical skills, critical thinking and be detail oriented
Must be flexible and efficient at multi-tasking in a high profile and fast-paced environment
Qualifications:

Required:
Bachelor's Degree in a technical discipline
10 years of work experience. 8 years of additional relevant experience may be substituted for education
Preferred:
Current VA access
Minimum 3 years Release Management experience
Requirements elaboration and/or Software Quality Assurance testing experience

Duties
Summary
This position is located in the Operations Unit, Technology and Integration Office (TIO) for the Department of Veterans Affairs' (VA) Office of Electronic Health Record Modernization (OEHRM), within the Office of the Deputy Secretary of VA (DEPSECVA) where the incumbent serves as Management Analyst. This position serves as Management and Program Analyst performing a variety of analytical, planning, evaluative and advisory functions concerning EHRM Operations.
Responsibilities
Management and Program Analysis

Provides oversight and project management of TIO program operations, monitors program effectiveness, and ensures that programs function efficiently, cost-effectively, and in compliance with appropriate regulations and laws. Plans, develops, implements, coordinates, monitors and evaluates workstream components to include ongoing review of scope and schedules, requirements and work products, e.g., deliverables or other products from staff and contractors. Reviews and interprets new and establish administrative directives, instructions, and regulations to determine their impact on the organization and its programs.

Studies and Surveys
Conducts studies, reviews, and surveys to assure operating programs are authorized and cost effective. Uses various techniques to develop costing methods and factors for estimating, validating, or projecting the cost of various TIO programs; to include cost-estimating relationships; collection of system specifications and
substantive cost data; selection of appropriate variables; and application of cost analysis learning
curves and relationships.

Advisory Services
Facilitates and/or leads multiple projects within OEHRM. Develops and recommends OEHRM operational requirements, processes, and guidelines for review and approval by senior management. Coordinates, reviews, and recommends and/or seeks approval of acquisition plans, advanced procurement plans. Independently develops milestone charts, procurement reports, and schedules. Reviews and approves the work of contract specialists and reviews the evaluations of contractor deliverables for the ability to perform the contract in cases involving large, highly complex procurements, programs, services where little or no contractual precedent exists. Develops and monitors multi-year budgets and plans for major projects and programs. Serves as an advisor to OEHRM management on program operations, business process, and technology integration.

Work Schedule: Monday-Friday 08:00am-4:30pm
Compressed/Flexible: Not Available
Telework: May be available with supervisor approval.
Virtual: This is not a virtual position.

Qualifications
To qualify for this position, applicants must meet all requirements by the closing date of this announcement, 02/15/2021.

Time-In-Grade Requirement: Applicants who are current Federal employees and have held a GS grade any time in the past 52 weeks must also meet time-in-grade requirements by the closing date of this announcement. For a GS-13 position you must have served 52 weeks at the GS-12. The grade may have been in any occupation, but must have been held in the Federal service. An SF-50 that shows your time-in-grade eligibility must be submitted with your application materials. If the most recent SF-50 has an effective date within the past year, it may not clearly demonstrate you possess one-year time-in-grade, as required by the announcement. In this instance, you must provide an additional SF-50 that clearly demonstrates one-year time-in-grade.

Note: Time-In-Grade requirements also apply to former Federal employees applying for reinstatement as well as current employees applying for Veterans Employment Opportunities Act of 1998 (VEOA) appointment.

The Selective Placement Factor for this position is: Experience technical and evaluative research on advisory functions pertaining to an electronic health records systems or medical related programs or systems.

You may qualify based on your experience as described below:
Specialized Experience: You must have one year of specialized experience equivalent to at least the next lower grade GS-12 in the normal line of progression for the occupation in the organization. Examples of specialized experience would typically include, but are not limited to: Experience in in technical and evaluative research on strategic planning to support program development; document, review and formulate findings and provide input and recommendations; implement, coordinate, monitor, and evaluate workstream components to include ongoing review of scope, schedule and requirements in work products; review and evaluate policies and procedures and provide input for changes and/or modification.
You will be rated on the following Competencies for this position:
Accountability
Administration and Management
Analysis and Problem Solving
Analytical Reasoning
Analytical Thinking

Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religions; spiritual; community; student; social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.

Note: A full year of work is considered to be 35-40 hours of work per week. Part-time experience will be credited on the basis of time actually spent in appropriate activities. Applicants wishing to receive credit for such experience must indicate clearly the nature of their duties and responsibilities in each position and the number of hours a week spent in such employment.

Physical Requirements: Work is primarily sedentary, but involves use of a government furnished computer so a degree of manual dexterity and visual acuity sufficient to utilize these tools are required. Some physical effort is required in that the incumbent lifts and carries reference books, working papers and similar items to and from meetings. A moderate amount of standing and walking is required in getting to and from meeting places away from the work site. The work does not require any special physical effort.

For more information on these qualification standards, please visit the United States Office of Personnel Management's website at https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/classification-qualifications/general-schedule-qualification-standards/.

VA supports the use of telework as a way to help attract and retain talented individuals in public service, increase worker productivity, and better prepare the agency to operate during emergencies. This position may be authorized for telework. Telework eligibility will be discussed during the interview process.

Receiving Service Credit or Earning Annual (Vacation) Leave: Federal Employees earn annual leave at a rate (4, 6 or 8 hours per pay period) which is based on the number of years they have served as a Federal employee. VA may offer newly-appointed Federal employee's credit for their job-related non-federal experience or active duty uniformed military service. This credited service can be used in determining the rate at which they earn annual leave. Such credit must be requested and approved prior to the appointment date and is not guaranteed.

Special Employment Consideration: VA encourages persons with disabilities to apply, including those eligible for hiring under 5 CFR 213.3102(u), Schedule A, Appointment of persons with disabilities [i.e., intellectual disabilities, severe physical disabilities, or psychiatric disabilities], and/or Disabled veterans with a compensable service-connected disability of 30% or more. Contact the Agency Contact for information on how to apply under this appointment authority via the Selective Placement Coordinator.

Zachary Piper Solutions is seeking a Cyber Security Analyst to join a team providing support services to the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs. This position is remote, and the Cyber Security Analyst will be responsible for ensuring a secure, compliant, effective, and efficient cloud architecture is implemented by the agency.
CANDIDATES MUST BE U.S. CITIZENS
Responsibilities of the Cyber Security Analyst include:Review current agency infrastructure, security documentation, and technical control implementations of agency authorized cloud environmentsConduct interviews with key personnelMaintain detailed design implementation recommendations to allow our customer to remain in compliance with federal regulations and industry best practicesIdentify opportunities to increase visibility and oversight into production system operations in the cloudSupport project teams with system design to enhance the effective and secure deployment of IT assets to cloud environments, including public, private, or hybrid cloud services that meet federal guidelines, regulations, and NIST Special Publication best practices
Qualifications for the Cyber Security Analyst include:Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field, OR 5+ years of progressive IT experience in networking or cyber securityMust be a clearable U.S. CitizenExperience with secure network communication techniques and protocolsKnowledge in identifying and recommending federally compliant cloud solutions for private clouds and IaaS or PaaS CSPsAt least one industry recognized certifications (AWS, Azure, CCSP, CISSP, etc.)
Compensation for the Cyber Security AnalystSalary Range: $70,000 - $85,000 **depending on experience**Full Benefits: PTO, Paid Holidays, United Healthcare, MetLife Dental, VSP Vision, 401k with ADPTS

JobTitle: Surgical Sales Specialist (Entry Level) - Washington, DC
Text:
Surgical Sales Specialist - Northeast US Region
Caldera Medical’s Mission - To Improve the Quality of Life for Women!
Message from the Hiring Manager :
As a Surgical Sales Specialist, you will act as an interim sales representative for vacant territories in the Northeast US Region. We are looking for an energetic, hungry sales professional who desires to develop a sales career and is looking to break into Caldera Medical and the competitive arena of medical device sales.
Duties and Responsibilities:

Act as an interim sales representative for vacant territories. Territories may be vacant for a variety of reasons, including resignations, promotions, terminations, maternity leave, etc.
Travel 80% in order to:
Maintain all existing revenue in given territory
Attend surgical cases in the operating room
Continue pipeline momentum created by the prior representative
Secure hospital approvals and surgeon support
For territories that do not have existing revenue, achieve initial sales targets

Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Bachelor’s degree
0-2 years experience in a sales, business, marketing, or related role
Demonstrated leadership and teamwork experience (i.e. athletics, extracurricular activities, etc)
Strong relationship orientation and strategic thinking skills
Strong oral and written communication skills
Demonstrated ability to effectively collaborate with internal colleagues
Ability to prioritize work and meet deadlines
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office software including Word and Outlook
A self-motivating, can-do attitude
Demonstrated flexibility and willingness to be coached and developed
Ability to travel 80% of the time
Who is Caldera Medical?
Caldera Medical is a growth stage medical device company dedicated to improving the quality of life for women! In 2018, Caldera was ranked one of Inc 5000’s fastest growing private companies in the United States and #38 fastest growing private company and #3 fastest growing Healthcare company in Los Angeles by the LA Business Journal. We develop and market differentiated surgical implants specifically for the treatment of Stress Urinary Incontinence and Pelvic Organ Prolapse. Our products are used by Urogynecologists, Gynecologists, and Urologists worldwide.
 “Our emphasis on collaborative problem-solving focuses team accountability towards developing solutions rather than fixating on individual obstacles. The result is a workplace teeming with positivity!”Ryan Neimy, Sr. R&D Engineer
Our Culture- Where Career and Passion come together!

A Culture of family and team… not a corporate goliath where you’re just another number
All employees get a seat at the table and have influence with management
We care about giving back to the community. Our team donates time to helping local charities throughout Southern California.
The Women’s Health Initiative is the heart of what we do, every day we put underprivileged women first.
Our goal is to treat 1 million women suffering from incontinence by 2025!

Competitive Compensation, Comprehensive Benefits, and more!

Medical and Dental Benefits – 75% paid for employee and family members
Vision Coverage
401(k) with 4% matching contributions after 90 days of employment
Basic Life and AD&D
Unlimited Vacation Policy
6 Weeks Paid Maternity Leave
10 paid holidays- including your birthday!
Being surrounded by amazing people!

Hear it from our very own! Learn more about Caldera on Glassdoor
Caldera Medical is an equal opportunity employer and considers all candidates for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship, age, disability, marital status, military or veteran's status (including protected veterans, as may be required by federal law), sexual orientation, gender identity or any other category protected by law.
This is a remote position.

JobTitle: Manager, Risk Management and Quality Assurance
Text:
About Us

Ready is an on-demand mobile health service that delivers non-emergency care directly to patients where and when they need it. To accomplish this, Ready sends a trained health professional, which we call a "Responder," to facilitate a telehealth visit between the patient and a licensed clinician.

With Ready, patients now have access to quality care in their homes, 16 hours a day, 365 days a year, and talented individuals are provided the opportunity to work with a rapidly growing, mission-driven company. We hope you will join us.

About the Role

The mission of Ready is to expand access to healthcare through superior quality service and to make obtaining care simple, as the Manager of Risk Management and Quality Assurance you are at the forefront of this. You will work collaboratively with all departments within the organization as well as relevant external stakeholders. You will help to ensure that Ready is providing safe, compliant, and high-value services to meet our patients' expectations.

What You'll Do

Broadly responsible for risk identification and mitigation through risk assessments.
Serve as immediate clinical escalation point to provide on-call guidance for clinical and field operations team.
Review, triage, investigate, and report on patient care events and patient complaints.
Organize, track, and trend data from risk events.
Analyze risk and quality data to suggest, drive, and monitor implementation of quality improvement measures.
Cross-department risk and quality audits.
Support the Risk Management and Quality Program in day-to-day management.
Assure that organization-wide performance improvement initiatives are focused and aligned to improve operational and program efficiencies and effectiveness.
Provide risk management, risk reduction, and quality assurance/improvement education.

What You'll Need

5+ years of experience as a Registered Nurse (or higher level), preferably in an acute care/urgent care or ED environment.
2+ years of experience in a Risk Management role with experience working in or with a quality department.
Experience with telehealth and/or in-home care is preferred.
Certifications:
CPHRM (Strongly Preferred)
CPHQ (Preferred)
Data-driven mindset with ability to leverage data to assess risk/quality gaps and execute action plans for improvement.
Strong technical skills and fluency with Microsoft Office, Google Suite, and Athena EHR. Comfortable creating spreadsheets, dashboards, and other data-aggregation metrics.
A quick learner, willing to work in a fast-paced start-up environment where processes change regularly.
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate and communicate efficiently across teams. Includes internal employee interviews and external interactions with patients and regulatory authorities.

Overview:

All who are selected to participate in CFR’s Blavatnik Internship Program and Robina Franklin Williams Internship Program receive training in the field of foreign policy and international affairs as well as skills training in writing, research, program planning, and much more.
The intern will gain exposure to policy research and think tanks, and develop research and writing skills in a professional context.
CFR internships are paid, require a 14 - 18 hour commitment, and are filled on a rolling basis.
Summer semester internship opportunities are on a fully remote/virtual basis.
The major responsibilities of this position will include (but are not limited to)::
Conducting research as requested by the research associate and/or fellow on a variety of topics including current U.S. foreign policy history and the interactions between Congress and the executive branch on matters of foreign policy
Track daily news reports that are relevant for the department
Assist with writing and editing content, including research memos and briefs, blog posts, book chapters, content for the foreign policy blog, and other publications, as needed
Qualifications:
Undergraduate student with concentration in International Relations, Political Science, History, or related field
All applicants should have completed the equivalent of four semesters of college coursework (not including AP classes in high school) by the time they begin an internship
Strong background in U.S. history is required
Strong research, writing, and editing skills
Excellent attention to detail and proofreading ability
Previous work experience in an office environment preferred, but not required
Proficiency in Microsoft Office
About CFR:

Founded in 1921, the Council on Foreign Relations (CFR) is a leading nonprofit membership organization, research center, and publisher, with headquarters in New York, an office in Washington, DC, and programs nationwide. It is dedicated to increasing America's understanding of the world and contributing ideas to U.S. foreign policy. CFR's 5,000+ members are leaders in international affairs and foreign policy. CFR also publishes Foreign Affairs, the preeminent magazine on global issues, and provides up-to-date information about the world and U.S. foreign policy on its award-winning website, CFR.org.
CFR’s Internship Program is made possible through the generous support of the Blavatnik Family Foundation, the Robina Foundation, CFR members, and the family and friends of Franklin Williams.
The Council on Foreign Relations is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Quality, diversity, and balance are the key objectives sought by the Council on Foreign Relations in the composition of its workforce.

Overview:

All who are selected to participate in CFR’s Blavatnik Internship Program and Robina Franklin Williams Internship Program receive training in the field of foreign policy and international affairs as well as skills training in writing, research, program planning, and much more.
The DC multimedia intern will have the opportunity to learn more about audio and video production, researching and writing, and international relations at large. This internship will serve as a stepping stone for a variety of opportunities in foreign policy, journalism, and media. They will gain skills in working cohesively in a team/office environment, bolstering their researching and writing skills, and learning more about media and production.
CFR internships are paid, require a 14 - 18 hour commitment, and are filled on a rolling basis.
Summer semester internship opportunities are on a fully remote/virtual basis.
The major responsibilities of this position will include (but are not limited to)::
Helping to support the digital team and gain valuable experience in researching, writing, and audio and visual production
Supporting the digital team by helping with research for CFR's podcasts and videos
Playing an integral role in the content that is published weekly by the visual team
Qualifications:
Undergraduate or graduate student with a concentration in international relations, political science, history, or journalism
All applicants should have completed the equivalent of four semesters of college coursework (not including AP classes in high school) by the time they begin an internship
Previous administrative, journalism, web, and multimedia experience is a plus
Basic interest in Adobe Creative Cloud
Additional language skills preferred, but not required
Keen eye for detail and eager to learn

Founded in 1921, the Council on Foreign Relations (CFR) is a leading nonprofit membership organization, research center, and publisher, with headquarters in New York, an office in Washington, DC, and programs nationwide.
