JobTitle: Change Management Consultant - Active Clearance Required
Text:
About Rockwood:
Rockwood Company, LLC, is a woman-owned small business change management consulting firm that delivers unrivaled value in the DC Metropolitan Area. Our consultants are solution innovators who specialize in bringing together the right people to devise and implement bold, yet practical solutions to complex problems. Rockwood stands side-by-side with our clients to take on the most critical challenges facing our nation. We offer first-class change management expertise and proven methods that empower clients to achieve meaningful outcomes. Our goal is to enable a more innovative, collaborative, and effective government capable of successfully executing today’s mission and anticipating tomorrow’s evolving challenges and opportunities. Rockwood offers true management consulting services that leave our clients’ organizations and people more capable.


We bring human-centered design approaches to ensure change is adopted and institutionalized. Our core service offerings include strategy development and implementation, stakeholder alignment, customer experience, workforce readiness, strategic communications, and program management.

Rockwood provides a team-oriented learning environment that pushes our consultants to grow. Our team members own their own success and partner with leadership to achieve their professional development goals.

About the Position:
Our Change Management Consultants participate work on a diverse portfolio of engagements, developing and implementing strategies to help clients achieve their missions while teaching them sustainable ways to effectively achieve outcomes. Specific responsibilities may include:
Manage and support client project tasks and/or manage small project teams to completion
Collect and analyze quantitative and qualitative data (through research, interviews, surveys, observation, etc.) to capture the current state of the client mission and recommend best practice alternatives for a future state
Build lasting relationships with clients while helping them dissect and solve problems
Identify and document key insights from client interactions and data collection to propose changes for organizational improvement
Write strategic plans that outline material gathered during research, stakeholder engagements, and facilitated alignment sessions
Design, develop, and/or present client deliverables, applying basic consulting principles and frameworks (may include creating the deliverable structure and approach, writing, editing, formatting, and enhancing with graphical or technical software)
Design creative visual communications that simplify complex concepts for targeted audiences
Lead and support stakeholder interviews and other stakeholder engagement activities
Support the design of project approaches and client strategy sessions
Provide project management support (to include managing resource-planning spreadsheets, working with senior-level consultants to refine project plans, performing quality control reviews on client deliverables, and drafting and submitting status reports to clients)
Provide event planning support for interactive conferences, strategy meetings, working group sessions or other events; this may include helping to design the event, coordinating event logistics, facilitating discussions, and capturing knowledge (live) during the event to ensure people who never attended understand the big takeaways


In addition to consulting work, Rockwood provides a unique experience where our team members also contribute to the growth of the business. For example, Rockwood Change Management Consultants may:
Support business development activities to help Rockwood win new work
Support development of Rockwood’s social media and marketing materials to improve the Rockwood brand
Develop and deliver Rockwood’s internal training classes to grow the Rockwood capabilities
Own one of Rockwood’s consulting methodologies and provide coaching and mentoring to the Rockwood team (as the resident Rockwood Subject Matter Expert)
Support recruitment activities to attract, evaluate, and bring onboard the best talent


What You Must Have to Be a Change Management Consultant:
Ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance (to be eligible, you must have U.S. citizenship)
Bachelor’s degree
5 – 10 years of relevant work experience
Innate ability to proactively and creatively problem-solve
Client/customer focus with outstanding organizational skills and attention-to-detail
Proficiency in word processing, Excel, presentation creation tools, and internet research tools
Willingness to commute to client locations in and around the DC Metro area; occasional travel outside of the DC area

What We Look for in Future Team Members:
Active listening and critical thinking skills to make connections and extract key takeaways from a discussion
Strong verbal and written communications skills to organize information into well-written clear messages and compelling documents
Ability to collaboratively brainstorm and work with clients and Rockwood team while also having the ability to work independently from a home office, client site, and Rockwood office as required


What We Prefer in Change Management Consultants:
Active DoD clearance
Additional consulting-related education/certifications
2+ years as an external management consultant


Our Unique Benefits:
Competitive medical, dental, and vision insurance plans
401(k) plan with 3% employer contribution (regardless of whether employee contributes)
Three weeks of paid vacation (one week is during your choice of either Thanksgiving, Christmas, or New Year's)
Six federal holidays and one floating bank holiday
Spot cash bonuses and additional vacation days throughout the year to consultants who go above and beyond their job and bring exceptional value to the company, the team, and clients
Annual “Above and Beyond” bonus based on positive impact on Rockwood Company
Cell phone stipend
Laptop, printer, office supplies, and other equipment to maximize effectiveness when working from a home office (when necessary)

JobTitle: Principal Change Management Consultant - Active Clearance Required
Text:
About Rockwood:
Rockwood Company, LLC, is a woman-owned small business change management consulting firm that delivers unrivaled value in the DC Metropolitan Area. Our consultants are solution innovators who specialize in bringing together the right people to devise and implement bold, yet practical solutions to complex problems. Rockwood stands side-by-side with our clients to take on the most critical challenges facing our nation. We offer first-class change management expertise and proven methods that empower clients to achieve meaningful outcomes. Our goal is to enable a more innovative, collaborative, and effective government capable of successfully executing today’s mission and anticipating tomorrow’s evolving challenges and opportunities. Rockwood offers true management consulting services that leave our clients’ organizations and people more capable.


We bring human-centered design approaches to ensure change is adopted and institutionalized. Our core service offerings include strategy development and implementation, stakeholder alignment, customer experience, workforce readiness, strategic communications, and program management.

Rockwood provides a team-oriented learning environment that pushes our consultants to grow. Our team members own their own success and partner with leadership to achieve their professional development goals.

About the Position:
Our Principal Change Management Consultants lead multiple consulting teams, design and execute large scale strategies, and act as a trusted advisor to our teams. Specific responsibilities may include:
Own exceptional delivery and client satisfaction on a diverse portfolio of client engagements (likely a set of projects with 3-8 people on each team) and manage large projects to completion. Guide project work by 1) using proven methodologies and frameworks (knowledge of multiple ways to analyze the current state, future opportunities, and strategies) and 2) simplifying complex scenarios for team members to increase their understanding of possibility and approach
Manage the production of complex client deliverables and ensure consistency of high-quality deliverables across projects (incorporating graphics, and other visual techniques to succinctly report out on data and analysis)
Design, facilitate, and manage large-scale client sessions in ambiguity, sometimes with little context or advanced notice
Actively coach clients in the moment, leveraging leadership principles (informal or formal leadership coaching expertise)
Serve as lead (manager) for business development proposals by coordinating the process, leading the theming, and contributing to the writing
Network and generate new client leads
Teach consulting frameworks to team members and oversee their application of these frameworks during client engagements and the creation of deliverables
Lead multiple business activities (in support of developing the Rockwood business)
Expand existing client relationships by identifying their needs and securing additional or new services
Leverage network of existing relationships to identify high-quality talent and partners
In addition to consulting work, Rockwood provides a unique experience where our team members also contribute to the growth of the business. For example, Principal Change Management Consultants may:
Support development of Rockwood’s social media and marketing materials to improve the Rockwood brand
Develop and deliver Rockwood’s internal training classes to grow the Rockwood capabilities
Own one of Rockwood’s consulting methodologies and provide coaching and mentoring to the Rockwood team (as the resident Rockwood Subject Matter Expert)
Support recruitment activities to attract, evaluate, and bring onboard the best talent


What You Must Have to Be a Principal Change Management Consultant:
Ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance (to be eligible, you must have U.S. citizenship)
Bachelor’s degree required
12+ years of relevant work experience and 10+ years as an external management consultant
At least one certification in any of the following: Organizational Development, Change Management, Leadership Coaching, Human Resources, or other related topic area
Strong project management skills with the ability to coordinate multiple engagements simultaneously and prioritize demands
Extensive experience leading change management projects; prior experience leading:
Strategy development,
Organizational design, and
Workforce readiness
Extensive experience developing team members into exceptional consultants, teaching basic consulting frameworks, working with consultants on the active development of skill sets, and providing continuous feedback
Strong analytical skills and innate ability to solve complex problems creatively
Client/customer focus with outstanding organization skills and attention to detail
Strong leadership with willingness and ability to directly contribute to the creation of client deliverables
Willingness to commute to client locations in and around the DC Metro area; occasional travel outside of the DC area


What We Look for in Future Team Members:
Active listening and critical thinking skills to make connections and extract key takeaways from a discussion
Strong verbal and written communications skills to organize information into well-written clear messages and compelling documents
Ability to collaboratively brainstorm and work with clients and Rockwood team while also having the ability to work independently from a home office, client site, and Rockwood office as required


What We Prefer in Principal Change Management Consultants:
Active DoD clearance
Master’s degree
Additional consulting-related education/certifications

Our Unique Benefits:
Competitive medical, dental, and vision insurance plans
401(k) plan with 3% employer contribution (regardless of whether employee contributes)
Three weeks of paid vacation (one week is during your choice of either Thanksgiving, Christmas, or New Year's)
Six federal holidays and one floating bank holiday
Spot cash bonuses and additional vacation days throughout the year to consultants who go above and beyond their job and bring exceptional value to the company, the team, and clients
Annual “Above and Beyond” bonus based on positive impact on Rockwood Company
Cell phone stipend
Laptop, printer, office supplies, and other equipment to maximize effectiveness when working from a home office (when necessary)

Description
SAIC has an opportunity for a Training Analyst Supervisor to support the US Army Corps of Engineers Revolutionary IT Services (USACE RITS) program.
NOTE: This is a 100% virtual / work from home / remote position located anywhere in the CONUS.
The USACE RITS contract will provide modern and secure enterprise-wide IT support services to approximately 37,000 USACE customers located throughout the CONUS and OCONUS. Services will support the mission needs of USACE’s Headquarters (HQs) located in Washington, D.C., nine Divisions and 43 Districts, to include over 1,500 field and area project offices and two data centers that are currently located in Vicksburg, Mississippi, and Hillsboro, Oregon.
SAIC will provide agile, innovative, customer focused and cost-effective integrated enterprise IT support services in support of USACE’s mission of engineering solutions for the nation’s toughest challenges and deliver secure, revolutionary, and modernized technological solutions to end users and customers.
Develops, directs, plans and evaluates training programs or activities to meet external customer or internal employee learning objectives. Assignments may include needs analysis, custom course development, development of criteria for evaluating the effectiveness of course objectives, and evaluation and learning assessments. Where instructing within a certified educational institution, responsible for determining the organization, communication and delivery of the course content and materials, and for developing learning activities and demonstrations. Collaborates with customer or internal functional organization to develop, enhance, and/or evaluate new or existing learning objectives and course content. May create course content, training materials, visual aids and documentation to support a variety of instructional formats such as lecture, lab exercises, field training, computer-based training (CBT), and/or web-based training (WBT). May develop exam materials and may be responsible for testing and qualitative evaluation of participant's attainment of learning objectives. Monitors and evaluates training programs, assesses results, and implements enhancements as needed. Trainers may also administer training programs to meet student needs, which may require post-training follow up to determine applicability of course material or training approaches. (It should be understood that this is not intended to be a detailed nor comprehensive description of any individual employee's job content. Managers set the specific duties and responsibilities for each employee). l files and logs. Additional responsibilities may include support and assistance in the identification, control, production, distribution, storage, and retrieval of all deliverable data.

Qualifications
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
Bachelors and six (6) years or more of related experience; Masters and four (4) years or more experience; PhD and 0 years related experience
IT Training experience is required
Knowledge of ITIL best practices is desired

CLEARANCE REQUIREMENT:
Must be able to obtain a Secret clearance. Can start work with an Interim Secret


Target salary range: $75,001 - $85,000. The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position based on experience and other factors.
SAIC is a premier technology integrator solving our nation's modernization and readiness challenges. Our offerings across defense, space, civilian, and intelligence markets include high-end solutions in engineering, IT, and mission outcomes. We integrate the best components from our portfolio with our partner's ecosystem to deliver innovative and effective solutions. We are 25,500 strong; driven by mission, united by purpose, and inspired by opportunities. Headquartered in Reston, VA, SAIC has annual revenues of nearly $7.1 billion. For information, visit saic.com or Working at SAIC for benefits details. SAIC is an Equal Opportunity Employer empowering people no matter their race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or veteran status. We strive to create a diverse, inclusive and respectful work culture that values all.

At Paradox, our mission is to share our passion for people, deliver magical talent experiences, and drive talent obsession in organizations around the world. Our flagship product, Olivia is the AI assistant helping companies to transform global talent acquisition and candidate experience.

Are you a client-centric sales professional who loves talent acquisition as much as we do? We’ve experienced triple-digit growth over the past year and we are looking for an Enterprise Account Executive to help expand our reach and impact on the Talent industry.

This sales professional will leverage their HR tech industry experience to build enterprise client relationships nationwide. They’ll work closely with our clients, business development, and solutions teams to understand client pain points and improvement opportunities, and to drive positive change in the TA/HR practices of these large, global enterprise organizations and Fortune500 companies.

Paradox's Enterprise Account Executives Love To:
Prioritize our clients' success over their own success - they know that when clients win we all win

Collaborate with the Paradox team to deliver scalable recruiting technology to our clients

7+ years experience in software sales

Track record of success selling in a remote environment

The opportunity to build the next big thing in recruiting technology
Internal and external professional development, coaching, and continuous education opportunities
Comprehensive benefits package

Class for Zoom is software developed by Class Technologies, a technology company co-founded by education software pioneer and Blackboard co-founder and CEO, Michael Chasen.
Class for Zoom feels like a real classroom built on Zoom. By making the virtual classroom feel like a real classroom, we bring happiness to teachers and students. Founded in 2020, Class is headquartered in Washington, D.C. with staff around the world.
Account Executive


Location - Anywhere in U.S.

Account Executives at Class are responsible for developing new client relationships and closing new revenue for the business. You'll work closely with a team of Sales Development Representatives and your sales manager to help grow and manage your own pipeline of corporate accounts. You're responsible for direct client contact in which you'll educate and credibly engage with C-Level executives on Class's flagship product, Class For Zoom. You'll achieve an assigned revenue quota and work towards a high volume of new transactions by demonstrating Class For Zoom's potential to dramatically improve the way in which instructors are currently teaching with their current suite of remote learning tools and resources.


About You

You're a confident communicator on the phone and in video conferences and you're able to convey passion and enthusiasm for the product you're selling
High volume and a large pipeline doesn't scare you. Being on the phone and video conferences for hours at at time is where you thrive
You're assertive, persistent, persuasive, and an excellent listener. You're comfortable taking control of a conversation and moving the ball forward each time you speak with someone
You're adaptive and receptive to all types of changes and challenges that come along with a fast-growing high-volume sales organization
You are adaptable and can think on your feet. When faced with new challenges, failure simply isn't an option
You're eager to learn and are always seeking opportunities to improve your skill-set on a daily basis


Responsibilities


Navigate sales cycles within the corporate vertical and acquire as many new logos through closing as many transactions as possible each month of ClassEDU's flagship product, Class For Zoom
Maintain and manage your own pipeline of Accounts and qualified Opportunities through Salesforce
Work closely with a team of Sales Development Representatives to better and more efficiently drive qualified opportunities into your pipeline
Consistently forecast monthly and quarterly performance with increasing accuracy
Work transparently to report on sales activities and forecasts to senior management
Learn and comprehensively understand all elements and features of our product, including integrations, security and privacy policies, and any other relevant elements of our company's value proposition


Skills & Requirements

3-5 years of relevant sales experience (Technology B2B sales/SaaS Sales as an added plus)
Confidence to credibly engage with the C-level (CIO, CTO, CFO, Provosts, Presidents)
Highly adept at Salesforce and Google productivity suite
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to manage the full-cycle of lead prospecting and generation to the closing of the deal
Proven track record of overperformance in a sales environment (percentage to quota, any other awards or recognitions)
A self-starter with a track record of successful and credible enterprise deal development, negotiations, and closing skill sets

About Class Technologies:


Class Technologies is a software organization dedicated to making online learning just like the classroom. Our employees enjoy a work culture that promotes quick thinking and fast-acting professionals.


Class benefits include health care, paid time off, equity, life insurance and ltd/std.

Overview:

Job Title: Cybersecurity Threat Intelligence Analyst
Location: Washington, DC
Clearance: Top Secret
Telework: TBD

This position is pending award.

As a Cyber Threat Intelligence Analyst, this position will review open source and classified government intelligence and cybersecurity reporting for key technical indicators of compromise, defensive technical countermeasures, attribution of attacks, and other defensive information to more completely protect Education information.
Job Description:
Monitor external, internal, and open-source feeds for relevant cyber threats, incidents, and/or cyber activity that may have an impact on multiple critical infrastructure sectors and their assets.
Monitor government sources for relevant cyber threats, incidents, and/or cyber activity that may have an impact on multiple critical infrastructure sectors and their assets.
Support gathering and utilization of Publicly Available Information (PAI) and Open Source Intelligence (OSINT) regarding current and future threat actors.
Stay up to date on commodity/opportunistic malware and threats and targeted malware variants and threats.
Analyze indicators, observables, and incidents that are submitted by clients to create actionable intelligence reports with mitigation recommendations and in-depth analysis.
Investigates evidence of threats against Windows, Linux, Database, Applications, web servers, firewalls or other relevant technologies using researched IOCs.
Conduct technical briefings and host meetings on threat actors, threats, malware variants, and TTPs to clients.
Produce predictive and reactive cyber threat intel reports on new or updated cyber threats, new TTPs, and campaigns.
Conduct analysis on files/binaries, packet captures, and supporting materials to extract relevant artifacts, observables, and IOCs.
Proactively look for cyber threats via open feeds, internal feeds, vendor feeds, US-CERT, or similar sources.
Minimum Requirements:
Bachelors Degree or 5 years of relevant experience in lieu of degree.
Minimum 3-4 years relevant experience in a SOC, cyber threat intelligence, or military or government intelligence preferred.
Ability to function in a fast-paced environment and effectively manage multiple tasks simultaneously; coordinating deliverables and ensuring scheduled goals are met.
Experience constructing and performing complex database search queries across multiple databases.
Cybersecurity Certifications (CISSP, CEH, Security+, GCIH, etc.)
Understanding technical network transmission concepts, such a TCP/IP, UDP, ICMP, DNS, HTTP(S), and other standards
Briefing to an audience of varying technical understanding
Desired Experience/Certifications:
Experience providing cybersecurity threat intelligence support to government agencies.
Experience with network security packet analysis
Experience with front line cybersecurity operations in a fast-paced, high op-tempo SOC environment.

Job Description:
Leidos is a Fortune 500™ company aimed at embracing and solving some of the world’s most pressing challenges. Through science and technology, Leidos makes the world safer, healthier and more efficient.
The Civil Group is seeking an experienced Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Analyst to support the FAA’s FOIA Office. The position is located in the Washington DC area, with possible travel to other locations in the National Capital Region (NCR). Additionally, the position may require up to 25% travel outside of the NCR.
In connection with the pandemic, the duties for the position may be performed remotely initially and until customer requirements change.
Responsibilities:
Using familiarity with FOIA to timely process FOIA requests, including understanding how to collect documents responsive to FOIA, determining the applicability of FOIA exemptions, determining claims of confidential business processes, preparing any necessary redactions, and supporting the FOIA appeals process.
Redacting any sensitive and confidential business or pricing information.
Using tools to collect Electronically Stored Information (ESI) and other data that may be subject to FOIA and organizing cases in SharePoint.
Evaluating and dispositioning FOIA exemption claims and preparing appropriate correspondence to requestors.
Ensuring the scopes of pending FOIA requests are properly defined.
Communicating effectively with legal counsel and management on program updates, both orally and in writing.
Demonstrating an ability to use eDiscovery to support the disposition of a federal agency’s FOIA requests.
Qualifications:
Typically requires a college degree and four plus years of prior relevant experience or Masters degree with two years of prior relevant experience. Or 8 years of experience in lieu of a degree.Ability to train small groups on how to use a customer facing tool.Proficient in documenting processes and policies.
 Proficient in Microsoft Office applications, including SharePoint.
Ability to obtain a Secret clearance

We believe in staying safe!Education:Bachelor's (Required)Work Location:Fully RemoteCompany's website:i3health.comBenefit Conditions:Only full-time employees eligible

JobTitle: Resource Planning (ERP) Interface Analyst- Navy Programs
Text:
Position Summary:
This position supports the Program Executive Office for Manpower, Logistics, and Business Solutions (PEO MLB) supporting PMW 220 located at the Washington Navy Yard. Remote or Telework is also available.
 Primary Responsibilities
Will Interface and support the Navy ERP Government Interface Lead in PMW 220 with the following:
Assist with Interface Control Agreements and interface standard operating procedures
Will assist with tracking of all agreements and changes to interfaces
Will ensure processes and procedures are followed in accordance with Federal Information System Controls Audit Manual (FISCAM) audits and Purchase Request Data Standard (PRDS), Procurement Data Standard (PDS), and Standard Financial Information Structure (SFIS) data standards.
Review, update, and maintain existing and new Interface Control Agreements
Prepare interface presentations, reports, plans and briefs (as needed)
Develop and maintain Interface Standard Operating Procedure documents
Monitor interfaces for data errors and make recommendations for error handling solutions
Review data against data standards (PRDS, PDS, and SFIS)
Assist in the identification and resolution of issues impacting program/project cost, schedule, and performance
Coordinate budget, cost, acquisition and contract input for program/project cost, schedule, and performance
Assist in preparation and coordination of internal and external Program Management Reviews (PMRs) and briefings
Desired Skill set:
Must have at least 7 years of progressive experience in IT technical analysis and support for DoD/DON acquisition programs with ACAT 1 or ACAT 2 programs preferred and experience to include one or more technology areas:
Engineering analyses and recommendations
IT system analysis
Strategic technical planning
Project problem resolution and improvement
Critical analysis of IT program options and variables
Risk analysis and mitigation planning
Technical interaction/coordination with multiple Government entities and vendors
Must have experience with SAP ERP and API knowledge, strong written and verbal communication skills, strong critical analysis skills, and fully capable of using the MS Office suite.
Must have a current Secret clearance at time of hire
Requires a Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited college/university. Master’s Degree is a plus

JobTitle: Tanzu Service Mesh DevOPS - Opportunity for Working Remotely Washington, D.C.
Text:
Tanzu Service Mesh:
Tanzu service mesh is a modern application networking platform deployed by our customers in on-premise and cloud infrastructure to connect, secure and manage modern and legacy apps. We are part of the broader Tanzu portfolio helping customers achieve their application modernization goals.
Responsibilities:
As DevOPS in Tanzu Service Mesh team you will be responsible for Deploying Microservices and Core Infrastructure to support the TSM SaaS platform. You will be working with developers, testers and management to ensure Tanzu Service Mesh is updated and all the pipelines are constantly green.
Responsibilities include:
Build, maintain and monitor automation systems to improve and maintain the availability of SaaS platform.
Champion processes as GitOPS and Infrastructure as Code
Deploy Observability and Tracing infrastructure
Build and Maintain System Testing environments.
Requirements:
Proficient in a common scripting languages: Bash, Python.
Prior SRE/Operations experience - Experience operating, troubleshooting production issues.
Prior experience using Terraform/CloudFormation/Pulumi in production and at scale.
Prior experience using GitLab CI, Argo/Flux in production and at scale.
Excellent knowledge of Kubernetes/Image Building
Experience working with AWS (or Azure/GCP)
Good understanding of micro-services architectures and deployment strategies
Hands on experience in deploying and maintaining observability tools and distributed tracing tools (Prometheus, Grafana, Jaegar, Fluent etc..)
Familiarity with CI/CD tools and practices
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Preferred Qualifications:
Familiarity with configuration and operation of VMware products a plus - VMware vSphere, VMWare NSX, Avi Load Balancer
Experience in configuration and operations of service mesh technologies is a plus (Istio, Kuma)
Experience working with other Tanzu products - Tanzu Mission Control, Tanzu Kubernetes Grid.

American Farmland Trust is the only national organization that takes a holistic approach to agriculture, focusing on the land itself, the agricultural practices used on that land, and the farmers and ranchers who do the work. Since our founding in 1980, AFT has helped permanently protect over 6.5 million acres of agricultural lands, advanced environmentally-sound farming practices on millions of additional acres and helped thousands of farm families make a go of it (primarily through programs that increase farm viability and/or enhance farmland access). Long a pioneering leader, AFT is now riding a new wave of growth, driven by agriculture's most pressing needs and opportunities.

We believe diversity drives innovation. We are inclusive. We embrace differences. We recognize and respect the fundamental value and dignity of all our employees. We celebrate the unique traditions, heritages, and experiences our employees bring to the workplace. We are committed to creating and sustaining an inclusive culture that promotes and values diversity, and where everyone feels empowered to bring their authentic selves to work every day.

We provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, expression or identity, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, American Farmland Trust complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which we have facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

Description

Working under the leadership of the Media Relations Director, the Media Relations Associate helps develop and implement a media relations and social media strategy for American Farmland Trust.

What You'll Be Working On

As an integral part of the AFT Communications team, the Media Relations Associate, works in close collaboration with the Media Relations Director, the Digital Communications Director, and other American Farmland Trust staffers to raise the profile of AFT's brand and deliverables across media relations and social media channels. Other duties include but are not limited to:

Aggressively pitching reporters about AFT's research and projects.
Cultivating and maintaining relationships with key members of the media, in consultation with Media Relations Director.
Serving as a point of contact for members of the media and a liaison between media and AFT's subject experts.
Writing press materials about AFT initiatives, research, events, and other newsworthy items.
Assisting with writing and placing op-eds and other opinion pieces in national and regional media outlets, in consultation with Media Relations Director.
Gathering daily news clips and sharing with AFT staff.
Sharing communications updates with AFT staff.
Writing talking points and FAQs as needed.
Tracking key communications metrics to measure impact of department's work.
Developing and implementing a social media strategy for AFT's main social media channels.
Coordinating social media efforts with regional communications and program staff.
Creating social media assets, including graphics and videos.
Tracking and reporting on social media metrics.

The ideal candidate has a collaborative working style, is proactive and self-directed, and possess:

Ability to write clearly and concisely, in different styles.
Familiarity with/Commitment to applying AP Style in writing and editing.
Creative approach to social media and willingness to try new things.
Proactive and self-directed.
Ability to manage multiple projects and will work with Communications team and supervisor to prioritize competing responsibilities.
Willingness and ability to troubleshoot and problem solve independently.
Meets deadlines.
Knowledge of/Ability to learn Meltwater, Canva, WordPress, and Microsoft programs, including Word, Excel, Outlook, and Planner.
Ability and commitment to following complex office procedures, including those relating to contracting and budgeting.
Actively committed to open communication and building relationships within the Communications department and with other departments.

Why you should apply

Be a part of a purpose-driven, committed, knowledgeable, high-performing, experienced, and fun team.
A diverse and inclusive work environment.
A cause and mission you can be proud of.
Competitive compensation & Benefits.
Remote work opportunities.
Flexible scheduling.

Ready to apply? If this job sounds like a fit for you, then click on the 'apply' button below.


PI129689603

Doximity is transforming the healthcare industry. Our mission is to help doctors save time so they can provide better care for patients.

We value diversity — in backgrounds and in experiences. Healthcare is a universal concern, and we need people from all backgrounds to help build the future of healthcare.

Doximity Hospital Solutions, the platform that helps hospitals build their digital footprint, is seeking a Client Success Manager to join its growing team.

Client Success Managers are dedicated to helping our clients achieve success and advising on best practices for defining, implementing, and realizing hospital marketing needs and goals. You will become an expert in the Doximity product suite and will partner with internal teams to promote client retention. It will take a strong communicator to be successful in this role.

Who You Are

The healthcare industry is nothing new to you and you're ready to join our rapidly growing Hospital Solutions team. You've managed client accounts before and are comfortable owning your own client relationships with a lot of autonomy. You're ready to embrace a fast-paced, tech savvy, non-corporate environment. You manage multiple project and priorities simultaneously. Your coworkers describe you as detail-oriented, self-motivated, the ultimate problem solver with a "can-do" personality.

How you'll make an impact:

Kickoff new hospital accounts, execute all aspects of hospital marketing campaigns on the platform
Share your expertise in hospital and healthcare marketing with our clients to drive their marketing campaigns
Responsible and accountable for the successful fulfillment and completion of all client contracts within original contract terms from program kickoff to renewal and expansion
Strategically partner with sales team for assigned accounts to position for upsell and renewal opportunities
Produce client reports and work with sales partners to present results to clients
Assist in maintaining and improving internal documents and communication processes

What we're looking for:

Prior experience in health care required
Prior experience working remotely required
Excellent written and verbal communication with amazing copywriting skills
Success working independently and being personally accountable for assigned client accounts
Highly organized, able to coordinate large amounts of information across multiple projects (and timezones!)
Enthusiasm to help grow our business and be an energetic team player

Nice to have:

2 – 5 years of work experience in client management preferred

Remote Benefits & Perks
Comprehensive benefits including: medical, vision, dental, Life/ADD, 401k with matching program, and flex spending accounts
Pre-IPO stock incentives
3+ weeks of DTO (discretionary time off)
8 company holidays, plus company shutdown last week of December
Team trips to fun places like Lake Tahoe, Sonoma, Seattle, and Park City
Sabbatical after 5 years

In your cover letter tell us about your experience working with clients and your experience working remotely!

About Doximity

We're thrilled to be named the Fastest Growing Company in the Bay Area, and one of Fast Company's Most Innovative Companies. Joining Doximity means being part of an incredibly talented and humble team. We work on amazing products that over 70% of US doctors (and over one million healthcare professionals) use to make their busy lives a little easier. We're driven by the goal of improving inefficiencies in our $3.5 trillion U.S. healthcare system and love creating technology that has a real, meaningful impact on people's lives. To learn more about our team, culture, and users, check out our careers page, company blog, and engineering blog. We're growing fast, and there's plenty of opportunity for you to make an impact—join us!

Doximity is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and committed to providing employment opportunities regardless of race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth and breastfeeding, age, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other protected classification. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

JobTitle: Technology Engagement and Transformation Manager (Job ID: 2021-2537)
Text:
Overview:

Join one of the most influential, most quoted and most trusted think tanks!
The Brookings Institution is a nonprofit public policy organization based in Washington, DC. Our mission is to conduct in-depth research that leads to new ideas for solving problems facing society at the local, national and global level.
We bring together leading experts in government and academia from all over the world, rooted in open-minded inquiry and representing diverse points of view, who provide the highest quality research, policy recommendations, and analysis. Research topics cover a full range of public policy issues in economics, foreign policy, development, governance and metropolitan policy.

With fair and transparent business practices, clear communication, mutual respect, and a collaborative atmosphere that offers both professional and personal development opportunities, Brookings offers an inclusive and welcoming workplace that values the efforts of all contributors.

Brookings Technology provides a variety of services and support to Brookings employees, whether resident or non-resident, including:
Providing support for Brookings-issued hardware, software, and phones
Managing a pool of loaner equipment including laptops, tablets, and mobile phones
Providing and supporting standard office and email software in addition to a variety of useful business tools and software
Setup of user accounts and providing access (in-house and remotely) to documents, software and email
Please note: This position is based in Brookings' Washington, DC office. In response to COVID-19, Brookings staff are temporarily teleworking. The person hired for this position must be willing to move to or currently reside in Washington DC, Maryland, or Northern Virginia by their date of hire.
Responsibilities:

Ready to contribute to Brookings success?

The Technology Engagement and Transformation Manager, Enterprise Program Management Office, is a member of Brookings Technology (BTech) and reports to the Chief Information Officer (CIO). This position will lead analysis, support, and implementation of technology across the Brookings organization. The resource will primarily be responsible for change management and user adoption, technology communication and outreach, system and data analysis, and leading technology projects.
This position will work closely with stakeholders and clients —including the CIO, BTech unit managers, and senior decision-makers from across Brookings—to ensure that selected projects align, with Brookings’s strategic mission, priorities, and business needs. Additionally, the position will collaborate with the research staff at Brookings to ensure Technology is aligned and supporting the needs of the Brookings research community.
The position will also research, incubate, and advance technology best practices, concepts, and solutions with Technology engineers to drive digital transformation across the institution and advance Brookings Technology capabilities.

Project Delivery (40%)
Lead or otherwise support projects—by directly providing project management, business analysis, and/or change management services that cover some or all phases of a project, including inception, planning, requirements gathering, design and development, testing, training, implementation, close-out, and user adoption;
Provide necessary support of implemented technology as directed by the office of the CIO.
Identify, manage, and resolve project issues and risks;
Liaise with project stakeholders and provide updates as needed;
Organize and maintain project-related documents and information;
Manage project budgets and variances to actuals and ensure projects are completed within budget and on time;
Manage external vendors to ensure project deliverables or contract requirements are fulfilled;
Technology Advocacy, Communication, Enablement (20%)
Manage and execute end user communications related to technology strategic decisions and guidance.
Manage and foster the Technology Liaison program, including engagement, training, and monthly cadence, conducting routine follow up on individual issues.
Advocates customer issues across Technology organization.
Represents Technology unit in institution-wide initiatives.
Research and apply technology management best practices.
Establish and foster technology enablement for Brookings research community, assisting researchers and technology engineers in enhancing data science capabilities.
Stay abreast of technology trends, especially as they relate to a “digital workplace.”
Change Management and User Adoption (20%)
Development and execute technology related change management including development and delivery of training plan and training materials
Using metrics and analysis drive user adoption and ROI for technology investments
 Business, Systems and Data Analysis (20%)
Develop and maintain a thorough understanding of Brookings’s goals, governance structures, rules, operations, and technology standards;
Execute in-depth analysis of technologies, systems, and processes to help achieve technology objectives and goals.
Perform enterprise business analysis, requirements planning and management; requirements elicitation, analysis and documentation; monitoring solution assessment and validation; and requirements communication.
Lead requirements elicitation workshops, user acceptance testing planning, test script development and end user test execution.
Provide metrics and analysis of service and adoption metrics on a regular basis to Technology management.
Manage external vendors to ensure deliverables or contract requirements are fulfilled
Liaise among stakeholders to understand the structure, policies, and operations
Ownership and management of assigned technology platforms and/or applications including analysis, enhancement, and incident management of such platform.
Qualifications:

Ready to make an impact? In this role, you will support Brookings values of collegiality, respect, inclusion, diversity and community, and bring the following qualifications:

Education/Experience Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience required. Minimum 5 years relevant professional work experience in positions of increasing complexity. Prior Technology project management, business analysis, and change management experience required. Can demonstrate previous success in leading projects across internal stakeholders. Experience in training, advocating, and enabling change through technology. Experience working in research-based organization and familiar with academic organizational structure. Experience communicating with C-level leaders. Must be authorized to work for any employer in the U.S.

Knowledge/Skills Requirements:

Must have a broad range of skills in areas including business analysis, project management, and change management. Must be able to plan, prioritize, and execute on both a strategic and tactical level. Must be extremely organized and adept at coordinating large groups of diverse stakeholders and multiple projects. Must be comfortable with new technology in general and expert at using the Office 365 platform (including administering collaboration apps like Teams and SharePoint) and the Microsoft Office Productivity Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).

Must be mature and able to work autonomously as well as make quick decisions and meet deadlines, with excellent communication, writing, and documentation skills. Must be able to gain the trust and respect of customers and establish and maintain effective relationships.

Must be able to delegate responsibilities in a meaningful way. Must possess working knowledge of the Business Analysis Body of Knowledge and the Project Management Body of Knowledge. Must be generally familiar with the opportunities and challenges of IT infrastructure, applications (including enterprise-wide business systems), and customer support. Must be willing to apply the principles of continuous improvement and innovation to their work and be able to develop many of the aforementioned skills, areas of knowledge, and mindsets in others.
Experience working in a research environment; familiarity with current data science methodologies, such as machine learning and natural language processing, and tools, such as R and Python. Demonstrates a drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques. Comfortable troubleshooting and/or advising on common workplace software and hardware issues.
Excellent communication, organizational, management and administrative skills; ability to effectively present arguments, ideas, and recommendations; shows initiative, dependability, and precision.
Able to juggle multiple projects with competing priorities simultaneously; Able to work independently, under short deadlines, and deliver in a rapidly changing, fast-paced media environment.

Additional Information:

What can we offer you? Brookings provides a generous benefit package that is comprehensive and includes both traditional benefits and unique offerings.

Brookings requires that all applicants submit a cover letter and resume. Please attach your cover letter and resume as one document when you apply.
Successful completion of a background investigation is required for employment at Brookings.

Brookings welcomes and celebrates diversity in all its forms. We welcome applications that reflect a variety of backgrounds based on ideology, race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, veteran status, first generation college goers, and other factors protected by law. Brookings is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer that is committed to promoting a diverse and inclusive workplace.

Jefferson Solutions, a well-respected government consulting company of the Jefferson Consulting Group, woman-owned small business, is seeking candidates for a Project Manager position to lead a mix of acquisition and management consulting projects. Efforts include a range of traditional management consulting efforts with a specific focus on the federal acquisition/procurement community. Knowledge of management consulting approaches, change management, and the federal acquisition/procurement process are ideal to be successful in the position. May be remote/virtual.
Responsibilities:
Lead client engagements in a combined role as the Project Manager and Subject Matter Expert. Project management duties include:
Prepare project management plans and manage the execution of the plan.
Manage day-to-day communication with clients.
Generate project reports or proposals.
Ensure compliance with Federal and contractual requirements.
Manage team members.
Subject Matter Expert duties include:
Apply management consulting techniques and technical expertise to develop strategies, recommend and implement approaches to improve processes, restructure organizations, facilitate meetings and build consensus, elicit requirements, develop communication products, and create implementation plans.
Will apply change management techniques, including facilitating team building.
Provide advanced acquisition expertise to assist agencies through the acquisition process. This may include developing performance-based acquisitions for program offices, guiding acquisition strategy development with the contracting office, drafting technical evaluation summaries, etc.
Participate in industry associations to demonstrate firm’s thought leadership.
Support proposal and new business efforts.
Supervise team members.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree
Seven or more years of relevant experience, ideally in management consulting with understanding of the federal acquisition support process – cradle to grave
Prior experience facilitating change management functions like, technical training, team building and related
Experience in working with multiple federal agencies, including Civilian and the Department of Defense (DoD); although DoD experience is desirable, it is not required
Advanced knowledge of the federal acquisition process
Experience managing teams to execute projects
Project Management Professional (PMP) certification and/or FAC/DAWIA certifications preferred
Additional Skills:
Ability to handle effectively and concurrently multiple tasks and projects
Excellent anticipatory skills and proactive approach to work
Strong oral, interpersonal, and written communication skills
Strong prioritization and organization skills to meet deadlines
Detail-oriented and interested in producing quality work product
Ability to maintain high level of confidentiality and to handle sensitive information discreetly
Some travel may be required, when conditions permit
 Jefferson Consulting Group is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, national origin, genetic data, veteran status or any category protected by law.

Description
SAIC is looking for a Logistics Analyst to provide logistical support for the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Countering Weapons of Mass Destruction (CWMD) Office.
Responsibilities:
Provide logistics and sustainment support pertaining to the implementation of the 12 elements of logistics throughout all phases of the system life cycle.
Works with Systems engineers, scientists, and program support personnel to support the PM in the execution and continuous improvement of standard logistics processes per the organizational logistics policy.
Improve organizational relationships with DHS components in order to better meet component logistics needs throughout the system life cycle.

Qualifications
Bachelors and three (3) years or more of related experience; Masters and one year of related experience (4 years experience in lieu of degree)
Active DoD Secret clearance
DOD or Department of Homeland Security experience preferred
Possession of excellent analytical, technical, and problem-solving skills
Possession of excellent oral and written communication skill
Must be eligible to obtain and maintain DHS Suitability
Ability to interface with team members, and among other organizational units and end users in support of logistics activities
Knowledge of MS Office applications including word-processing, presentation, and spreadsheet and integrated software applications is required


Target salary range: $55,001 - $65,000. The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position based on experience and other factors.
SAIC is a premier technology integrator solving our nation's modernization and readiness challenges. Our offerings across defense, space, civilian, and intelligence markets include high-end solutions in engineering, IT, and mission outcomes. We integrate the best components from our portfolio with our partner's ecosystem to deliver innovative and effective solutions. We are 25,500 strong; driven by mission, united by purpose, and inspired by opportunities. Headquartered in Reston, VA, SAIC has annual revenues of nearly $7.1 billion. For information, visit saic.com or Working at SAIC for benefits details. SAIC is an Equal Opportunity Employer empowering people no matter their race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or veteran status. We strive to create a diverse, inclusive and respectful work culture that values all.

JobTitle: Lead Communications Specialist (Community Resilience and Sustainability)
Text:
Lead Communications Specialist (Community Resilience and Sustainability)

Summary

The Wikimedia Foundation is seeking a Lead Communications Specialist (Community Resilience and Sustainability) to join the Legal department to advance the Wikimedia movement's vision of every human being able to freely share in the sum of all knowledge; as well as its strategic direction - that by 2030, Wikimedia will become the essential infrastructure of the ecosystem of free knowledge, and anyone who shares our vision will be able to join us.

The Lead Communications Specialist will report to the Senior Manager, Trust & Safety Operations. As part of its investment in the sustainability and well-being of its volunteer online communities, the Wikimedia Foundation is seeking a seasoned communications expert who is able to guide and support the department's communications, especially on sensitive, delicate, and attorney-client-privilege issues and cases. The Community Resilience and Sustainability (CR&S) teams place a strong focus on clear and empathetic communications, resilient operations capabilities, and continuous process improvement. The successful candidate for this position will be responsible for shaping and leading Community Resilience & Sustainability and Trust and Safety communications while working in partnership with departmental leadership and the wider team on strategic issues, including continuous work to identify and implement solutions improving our communications capabilities in collaboration with communities and appropriate staff, especially in relation to Trust & Safety work.

As the Lead Communications Specialist, you will need a good understanding of what shapes thriving online communities, T&S industry best practices, especially in delicate communications including with users in distress, and law enforcement relationships. To address these complex problems, you will have to understand the technical possibilities as well as social norms and how to work with volunteers from disparate backgrounds to encourage building a culture of high behavioral expectations and excellent peer enforcement thereof. You will be the primary point person for CR&S' and T&S' communications practices and needs. You are a seasoned communications professional and are able to design and deploy inclusive narratives that address diverse audiences.
You are responsible for:

Reviewing trust & safety communications processes as well as those of other groups within Community Resilience & Sustainability to ensure that we meet the team's goals of communicating quickly, clearly, and compassionately; work closely with the Vice President of Community Resilience & Sustainability to flag strategic improvements as necessary.
Drafting content for CR&S correspondence with vulnerable stakeholders, movement audiences (including the Wikimedia community of volunteer contributors), and Wikimedia Foundation staff.
Support the Communications department in building and advancing a coherent trust and safety narrative
Reviewing and advising on content drafted by other CR&S staff as necessary to ensure an aligned team approach.
Contributing to executive communications and reports
Managing the department's communications initiatives in support of departmental leadership.
Communicating with key stakeholders in a precise, detailed or high-level communication style, depending on the needs of the organization and community.

Skills and Experience:

Excellent writing skills (including familiarity with AP Style) in English, especially as applied to press communication, blog posts, and other short-form content.
Ability to navigate with empathy intercultural communication challenges to ensure communication has the best impact with diverse audiences.
Strong verbal communication skills in English, including the ability to synthesize complex topics and create compelling narratives for various audiences
Proficient proofreader.
Demonstrated talent in managing multiple projects simultaneously.
Experience working across digital platforms (websites, mobile, blogs, etc.)
Highly collaborative and supportive style. Capable of building strong relationships within the organization and within Wikimedia communities.
Experience working in a global organization that has a distributed workforce
Ability to effectively partner with multiple levels
Ability to function well in ambiguity
Qualities that are important to us:

Experience with, or understanding of, free knowledge, open source, free culture, or other online communities and operates with high sensitivity around culture with the goal to respect, preserve and enhance
Professional or educational background in journalism, communications, psychology or social work preferred.
Command of other languages (especially German, Hindi, Japanese, or Spanish) is seen as a plus

The Wikimedia Foundation is...

...the nonprofit organization that hosts and operates Wikipedia and the other Wikimedia free knowledge projects. Our vision is a world in which every single human can freely share in the sum of all knowledge. We believe that everyone has the potential to contribute something to our shared knowledge, and that everyone should be able to access that knowledge, free of interference. We host the Wikimedia projects, build software experiences for reading, contributing, and sharing Wikimedia content, support the volunteer communities and partners who make Wikimedia possible, and advocate for policies that enable Wikimedia and free knowledge to thrive. The Wikimedia Foundation is a charitable, not-for-profit organization that relies on donations. We receive financial support from millions of individuals around the world, with an average donation of about $15. We also receive donations through institutional grants and gifts. The Wikimedia Foundation is a United States 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization with offices in San Francisco, California, USA.

As an equal opportunity employer, the Wikimedia Foundation values having a diverse workforce and continuously strives to maintain an inclusive and equitable workplace. We encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply. We do not discriminate against any person based upon their race, traits historically associated with race, religion, color, national origin, sex, pregnancy or related medical conditions, parental status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristics.

If you are a qualified applicant requiring assistance or an accommodation to complete any step of the application process due to a disability, you may contact us at recruiting@wikimedia.org or (415) 839-6885.

U.S. Benefits & Perks*

Fully paid medical, dental and vision coverage for employees and their eligible families (yes, fully paid premiums!)
The Wellness Program provides reimbursement for mind, body and soul activities such as fitness memberships, baby sitting, continuing education and much more
The 401(k) retirement plan offers matched contributions at 4% of annual salary
Flexible and generous time off - vacation, sick and volunteer days, plus 22 paid holidays - including the last week of the year.
Family friendly! 100% paid new parent leave for seven weeks plus an additional five weeks for pregnancy, flexible options to phase back in after leave, fully equipped lactation room.
For those emergency moments - long and short term disability, life insurance (2x salary) and an employee assistance program
Pre-tax savings plans for health care, child care, elder care, public transportation and parking expenses
Telecommuting and flexible work schedules available
Appropriate fuel for thinking and coding (aka, a pantry full of treats) and monthly massages to help staff relax
Paid travel to Wikimedia Foundation events all around the world!
Equipment including a laptop, monitor, plus a one-time stipend to cover any additional needs to make sure you have the best work experience
Great colleagues - diverse staff and contractors speaking dozens of languages from around the world, fantastic intellectual discourse, mission-driven and intensely passionate people

Please note that for remote roles located outside of the U.S., we defer to our PEO to ensure alignment with local labor laws.

Overview:

GovernmentCIO is looking for Jira/Confluence Administrator to support our growing HHS team. Along with Jira expertise, a strong candidate will also be able to work with cybersecurity project teams to learn their business challenges and be able to make recommendations to solve these challenges. The individual must possess exceptional communication skills and be able to explain or demonstrate functions as necessary.
GovernmentCIO aims to transform government IT by delivering the technology-related innovation necessary to improve governmental operations every day. Come transform government IT with us.
Responsibilities:

The Jira Administrator will act as part of a PMO to help the project team and Division staff use Jira in support of Agile transition. He or she will work with a team to develop sustainable Jira skills across a broad user base.

Applicant shall:
Advise/Propose custom workflows, fields, permission schemes, post functions, etc.
Serve as internal SME for the PMO on the JIRA tool
Consult on ways to optimize and improve Jira setup and process workflows and identify where functionality can or cannot meet user requests
Collaborate with a team to deliver complex project management support
Work in an Agile role supporting PMO team in a high-visibility client environment
Partner with Agile Coaches to help personnel understand how to use Jira in Agile manner
Provide recommendations to end users and leaders on best practices and standardization in implementing and leveraging processes within Jira
Migrate existing waterfall dashboards and reports to the Agile framework
Build collaboration spaces in Confluence
Other duties as assigned
Qualifications:

Required Skills and Experience:
3-5 years as a Jira administrator with configuration experience
At least 3 years of experience managing Jira configuration
Ability to make recommendations to solve business challenges
Experience configuring Jira for non-software and non-Scrum teams
Experience building out filters and views, customizing fields and creating custom workflows
Familiarity with Scrum, Kanban, and the difference between the two
Understanding of integration of Atlassian tools with other products (e.g. ServiceNow, Trello, etc.)
Experience with maintaining a knowledge base in Confluence
Experience with Agile IT delivery
Demonstrated experience successfully working in a disparately located team
Ability to work independently with minimal guidance and supervision
Must be able to make and maintain effective relationships in a remote work environment
Desired Skills and Experience:
Experience actively using Jira to support Agile projects
Familiarity with Jira automation preferred
Experience developing and delivering individual and group confluence and Jira training content
Business analyst experience
Agile certificate and or experience with Scaled Agile (preferably SAFe)
Cybersecurity experience a plus
CMS experience preferred
Education Requirements:
Bachelor's Degree in engineering, or a related scientific or technical discipline is required
Four (4) years of additional experience may be substituted in lieu of Bachelor’s Degree

Account Executive, Business Development - Federal Sales
(Remote)
Do you thrive in a complex, highly collaborative technology sales environment? Do you strive to sell for a consistent industry leader? If this is you, then “Think Dell!”
Are you an Account Executive who has experience in solutions that span the full IT ecosystem— we want to talk to you about joining our Federal Business Development Team and experience what it feels like to be a leader in the industry. Sales Professionals on our Federal Commercial team have a passion for helping customers achieve transformational business outcomes using disruptive technologies and solutions. Being part of Dell Technologies Sales means you will find stability, collaboration, and most importantly, a long-term, positive financial future with an amazing company culture.
What makes this exciting:
(Responsibilities)
Penetrates target agencies/organizations as assigned and other supporting agencies/organizations to uncover longer term opportunities. Broadens and deepens existing customer relationships to gain strategic positioning, retain existing revenue, and attain additional business
Works collaboratively with multiple stakeholder groups (sales, product design, and marketing across multiple BUs) to develop solutions, strategies and marketing materials based on customer/field experiences.
Active participate in industry associations, facilitates agency/industry meetings for awareness of best practice solutions, and demonstrates value to Dell through increased awareness, bid opportunities, and win effectiveness.
Develop and communicate prioritized list of strategic opportunities for target government organizations and briefs senior management on high dollar opportunities.
Develops and maintains milestones and metrics for presentation to management that measure the progress of strategic plans, projects, and programs against organizational goals and objectives. Identifies, qualifies and develops a pipeline of strategic opportunities and growth strategy to achieve annual new business objectives
How your experience will help you hit the ground running:
(Requirements)
10+ years’ experience in Federal Section sales, technical background, complex selling campaigns in the support of mission program business opportunities (multi-year with partnership requirements)
The individual should have strong communication skills with the ability to consult effectively with public sector clients and contractor community executives.
Ability to work collaboratively in a large matrix team environment.
Exceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills
Here’s our story; now tell us yours
Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.
What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life - while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more. We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today. You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here.
Application closing date: March 1 2021
Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.
