Duties
Summary
This position is located in the Office of Intelligence and Counterintelligence (IN) is responsible for timely, direct intelligence analysis to support policy; technical expertise in support of nonproliferation and national security intelligence; the effective use of intelligence information on nuclear weapons, foreign nuclear programs, nuclear materials, terrorist-related activities, and potential threats to the Department of Energy (DOE) complex.

Responsibilities
As a GS-14 full performance, Intelligence Research Specialist, you will:

Lead intelligence analysis on foreign nuclear proliferation, nuclear energy programs, nuclear fuel cycle, nuclear material security, nuclear terrorism, and/or nuclear weapons development.
Plan, direct, and evaluate intelligence and collection related to foreign nuclear issues within the assigned portfolio at both Headquarters and at the
national laboratories.
Work closely with IN management and other members of the Foreign Nuclear Programs Division (FNPD) to formulate and execute appropriate actions required to provide reportable and actionable intelligence.
Provide quality customer support to DOE and National Nuclear Security Administration (NNSA) managers and other senior officials.

Travel Required
Occasional travel - Travel may be required 25% of the time.
Supervisory status
No
Promotion Potential
14 - There is no promotion potential beyond the GS-14 grade level for this position.
Job family (Series)
0132 Intelligence
Requirements

Requirements
Conditions of Employment
You must be a United States Citizen.
This employer participates in the e-Verify program.
See "Other Information" section regarding Selective Service requirements.
Resume and question responses must be submitted online.
Subject to satisfactory security and suitability determinations.
You may be required to complete a one (1) year trial period.
OTHER REQUIREMENTS:

This is an Excepted Service position. This appointment will not confer Competitive Service career-conditional or career tenure status. This means that if you are selected, you would have to compete with other applicants in open competition to meet requirements for another Federal position, unless you meet the requirements for reinstatement. Applicants who voluntarily convert from the competitive service, Senior Executive Service, or other pay systems to a non-time limited appointment under this excepted service authority are not afforded “fallback rights” to the pay system previously assigned prior to conversion.

Conditions of Employment
Must be able to obtain and maintain a "Q" security clearance.
Eligible candidates for this position must be able to obtain and maintain a DOE Sensitive Compartmented Information (SCI) clearance.
Must successfully complete a CI Evaluation, which may also include a CI-scope polygraph examination.
You will be subject to pre-employment/pre-appointment testing for illegal drug use under the U.S. Department of Energy Employee Drug Plan. If you are selected you will be provided information regarding drug testing. Failure to undergo testing or positive findings resulting from the test will eliminate you from further consideration for this position. If selected for and appointed to this position you will be subject to random drug testing while employed.
Employee may be required to work extended hours above the normal 8-hour workday on special occasions. In off-duty hours, the incumbent may be required to return to assigned duty station to provide support to DOE policymakers, particularly during crisis periods.

Qualifications
SPECIALIZED EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

A qualified candidate's online application and resume must demonstrate at least one year of specialized experience equivalent to the next lower grade level in the Federal service. Specialized experience for this position is defined as:

For the GS-14 position, experience must be at least equivalent to the GS-13 level:

Evaluating intelligence reports and raw data to develop informed conclusions based upon advanced knowledge of foreign nuclear technologies, weapons, security, and/or arms control issues.
Presenting briefings to senior policy makers or providing support to projects related to nuclear non-proliferation, counter-proliferation, and nuclear weapons-related issues.
Managing a research portfolio to include timely and periodic maintenance and reporting of tasks and projects to management.
Working with the national laboratories on projects or assessments that involve data science or machine learning.

For the GS-13 position, experience must be at least equivalent to the GS-12 level:

Contributing to the review and evaluation of intelligence reports and raw data to develop informed conclusions based upon applying data science and/or machine learning tools in the areas of nuclear proliferation, foreign nuclear weapons programs, nuclear fuel cycle issues, and nuclear security vulnerabilities.
Preparing briefings to senior policy makers or support to projects related to applying data science or machine learning tools to hard target intelligence problems, with an emphasis on the areas of nuclear proliferation, foreign nuclear weapon programs, nuclear fuel cycle issues, or nuclear security vulnerabilities.
Assisting with the management of a research portfolio to include timely and periodic maintenance and reporting of tasks and projects to management.

Your application and resume should demonstrate that you possess the following knowledge, skills and abilities (KSAs). Do not provide a separate narrative written statement. Rather, you must describe in your application how your past work experience demonstrates that you possess the KSAs identified below. Cite specific examples of employment or experience contained in your resume and describe how this experience has prepared you to successfully perform the duties of this position. DO NOT write "see resume" in your application!

Knowledge of the operations of the Department of Energy/National Nuclear Security Administration National Laboratories and have experience working with the national laboratories on nuclear-related projects or assessments.
Knowledge of the US Intelligence Community, its component agencies, and related intelligence disciplines. Experience with multi-discipline and multi-agency intelligence teams focused on hard target collection and analysis issues is desired.
Knowledge through education, experience, or a combination thereof in the engineering, scientific, or other technical subjects that can be related to
foreign nuclear capabilities and intentions is essential.
Ability to brief policymakers and/or senior members of the Intelligence Community (IC) on issues and analyses related to foreign nuclear capabilities and intentions. Expert oral and written communication skills are imperative, and the incumbent should have the ability to make clear and convincing presentations and arguments concerning complex analytic and management issues, and to advocate, defend, negotiate, and fully justify positions and
recommendations.
Knowledge of key concepts and levels of effort within the overall strategic context and priorities. Experience must demonstrate an ability to prioritize and provide balance in meeting the national needs with timely and relevant intelligence analysis.

"Experience" refers to paid and unpaid experience. Examples of qualifying unpaid experience may include: volunteer work done through National Service programs (such as Peace Corps and AmeriCorps); as well as work for other community-based philanthropic and social organizations. Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills; and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.

CTAP/ICTAP candidates: To be considered "well qualified" you must meet all of the requirements as described in this section.

You must meet all qualifications and eligibility requirements by the closing date of this announcement.
Education
There is no education requirement for the GS-13 and 14 level, and education cannot be substituted for experience.

WHO WE ARE

FWD.us is a bipartisan political organization that believes America's families, communities, and economy thrive when everyone has the opportunity to achieve their full potential. For too long, our broken immigration and criminal justice systems have locked too many people out from the American dream. Founded by leaders in the technology and business communities, we seek to grow and galvanize political support to break through partisan gridlock and achieve meaningful reforms. Together, we can move America forward.

The Creative Intern will be part of the Creative team housed within the Community Department, whose mission is to build and engage the supporter base needed to effect policy change.

We are seeking a highly-motivated individual who is excited by both multimedia and storytelling. We're looking for someone who is eager to learn about and participate in the generation of creative products from conceptualization to launch. The ideal candidate will have an aptitude for multimedia: for web, video (especially editing and crafting a story), motion graphics and more—as well as an interest in advocacy, and a passion for moving the dialogue forward on immigration reform and criminal justice reform.

FWD.us will be hiring for Spring 2021 remotely. Candidates should be available to work full time on weekdays from 9:30am to 5:30pm PST. Internships will last 4-6 months. Interns are paid $15/hour plus benefits. This will be a remote position for now and potentially move to an onsite position.

For consideration, please submit a resume, cover letter, contact information for two references by February 21st, 2021.

WHO YOU ARE

Flexible and adaptive in a fast-paced team environment
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
Multi-tasker who can manage high workflow and multiple projects without sacrificing quality
Creative and persistent "can-do" attitude
Problem-solver, motivated to create
Passionate about joining a team dedicated to achieving policy wins at the state and national levels
Proficiency in Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign), motion graphic and video editing software (Final Cut X, Motion, Premier, and/or After Effects)

WHAT YOU WILL DO

Learn from and support our multimedia/video and design teams in creating products to bolster FWD.us' two issues
Participate in creative ideation
Source content
Draft content to support multimedia and design
Prepare video and images for social media
Pitch your creative ideas!
Work on multimedia projects from start to finish
Work closely with multiple teams and departments and gain first-hand experience across multiple verticals and issue-areas

Kit Check is looking for an energetic and highly motivated Technical Recruiter to join the HR team. You will own the full life cycle recruitment process and will partner with hiring managers to find people that will thrive in our environment. You’ll mainly focus on recruiting for technical roles, but will at times manage other open roles within Kit Check. This is a high impact role that will challenge you to think creatively about how to drive hiring results.
Responsibilities
Manage the entire recruiting life-cycle, including partnering with hiring managers to create job description, source candidates, extend offers, and close candidates
Source and engage candidates through technology, referrals, social media, recruitment events, and networking
Ensure our candidates have an amazing experience regardless of outcome
Analyze and review our hiring practices to ensure we’re attracting and landing the best candidates
Qualifications and Skills
3+ years of demonstrated success filling technical roles
Experience creating a more diverse and equitable work environment through recruiting, reaching, and sourcing diverse candidates from different backgrounds
Knowledge of technical concepts and skills needed to screen candidates effectively for roles
Data-driven approach to managing candidate pipelines and hiring managers
Experience using Lever or other comparable applicant tracking systems
Willing to travel up to 10%
This position is a remote position and open to applicants in the continental United States.
Why Kit Check?

WHAT WE DO MATTERS:

Here at The Knot Worldwide, we believe in doing work that matters. In 16 countries around the world, our leading family of brands (The Knot, WeddingWire, Bodas, Hitched, The Bash, The Bump, and more) inspire, inform, and celebrate our communities as they move through life's milestones. Our couples and business partners depend on us. They're all in. So are we.

ABOUT THE ROLE AND OUR TEAM:

We are looking for an energetic and eager Legal Intern to join the Company's global legal team for The Knot Worldwide's Summer 2021 Internship Program. The Legal Intern (you!) will gain exposure to the various aspects of a global corporate legal department, including contract review and negotiation, legal research, intellectual property, data privacy, employment, compliance, and more. We are a highly collaborative team, so you will have the opportunity to work on a variety of projects with the entire US Legal Team. The role would be for 40 hours per week (based approximately on East Coast hours) for a 9 week period.

This position is open to candidates who would like to work fully remote and may be performed anywhere in the United States, except for in the state of Colorado.

Applications will be accepted for this role through March 8, 2021.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Working with our attorneys and paralegal on domestic and international legal matters such as corporate law, data privacy, employment law, compliance, and disputes
Working with our business groups to understand and find efficient, practical solutions to their legal requirements
Reviewing and helping to negotiate client, partner and vendor agreements and developing and maintaining legal agreement templates
Assisting with ad-hoc projects by researching legal issues and regulatory developments and preparing summaries of research
Participating as team members in large projects such as corporate transactions and financings, litigation, or other large projects as those events occur
Performing other appropriate duties and special projects as needed

SUCCESSFUL LEGAL INTERN CANDIDATES HAVE:

Bachelor's degree and at least 1 year of experience at an ABA accredited U.S. law school
Ability to manage, organize, and prioritize workload and multiple deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Have strong analytical and organizational skills and be detailed-oriented
Be self-motivated and have the ability to work with varying levels of supervision
Fluency in a foreign language, particularly Spanish, a plus!

At The Knot Worldwide, we believe you are more than a resume and invite you to go for it, take the leap of faith, and apply for this job if it sparks your passion to join TKWW and make a difference!

WHAT WE LOVE ABOUT YOU:

You Dream Big. You iterate and experiment to drive innovation.
You Love Our Users. You keep our global community at the center of everything you do.
You Do the Right Thing. You strengthen your team through respect, fairness, and inclusion.
You Hustle Every Day. You favor urgency and own your outcomes.
You Win Together. People are at the heart of our success and you play as a team.

INTERNSHIP PROGRAM OVERVIEW:
The TKWW Summer Internship Program offers students the exciting opportunity to explore the fast paced tech industry, working for a global leader in weddings. During the program, interns will gain hands-on experience working alongside our teams, while experiencing cross functional programming, speaker series, intern events, and so much more. The TKWW Internship program is paid, full time, and runs for 9 weeks.

Highlights:

Case Study Competition
Weekly Speaker
Series Networking Day
Partnership and Mentorship Opportunities with Business Leaders
End of Summer Celebration

VetsEZ (Veterans EZ Info, Inc.), a verified Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB), is a leading provider of information technology services to commercial and government markets. VetsEZ is a company of Subject Matter Experts with deep expertise in Healthcare IT and Benefits Delivery. VetsEZ strongly believes in making complexity EZ by providing tangible solutions that improve day-to-day business transactions, maximize efficiencies, eliminate risks, and reduce costs for our clients. For more information, visit us at www.vetsez.com (http://www.vetsez.com).
VetsEZ is seeking a dynamic, energetic individual for the position of Proposal Pricing Analyst. This is a full-time remote position supporting our capture management team. The candidate must function in a fast-paced proposal environment and collaborate to develop pricing and win strategies while ensuring compliance and schedule adherence.
Responsibilities:
Develop pricing for proposal submissions by working closely with the capture manager, solutions architect, and the proposal manager.
Utilize quantitative and mathematical skills to provide effective financial modeling
Develop and communicate potential pricing scenarios for consideration directly impacting company win rate
Perform reviews of proposals priced by other pricing analysts for quality assurance purposes
Utilize Microsoft excel for developing price volumes
Prepare Schedule B tables and/or required customer templates for submission.
Maintain complete files to include required supporting documentation
Manage the distribution of pricing data calls to subcontractors and respond to pricing data calls by prime contractors
Requirements:
Bachelor's Degree in accounting, mathematical or related business field
At least 2 years of pricing experience in pricing federal proposals
A proven history working in a financial and/or accounting position

Expert at using Microsoft Excel and Excel advanced features (Pivot Table, Functions, Vlookups, etc.)
Experience and knowledge in developing pricing for CPFF, Fixed Price, T&M opportunities
Familiarity with government contracting to include pricing, financial analysis, and contracts federal agencies such as VA, NIH, HHS, FDA, and DOD
Detail-oriented, highly organized, with the ability to handle pricing for multiple proposals simultaneously
Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment handing multiple proposals simultaneously.
Knowledge and deep understanding of Indirect rates
Experienced in creating price to win strategies and competitor analysis
Experienced in the government contracting FAR clauses and regulations
Experienced in creating both small and large contract business proposals for federal government RFPs
Experience with VA's T4NG pricing volumes is a huge plus.
Benefits:
Medical/Dental/Vision
401k with Employer Match
PTO + Federal Holidays
Corporate Laptop
Training opportunities

GuidePoint Security provides trusted cybersecurity expertise, solutions and services that help organizations make better decisions and minimize risk. By taking a three-tiered, holistic approach for evaluating security posture and ecosystems, GuidePoint enables some of the nation’s top organizations, such as Fortune 500 companies and U.S. government agencies, to identify threats, optimize resources and integrate best-fit solutions that mitigate risk.

As a member of the Proposal Support Group (PSG), the Proposal Manager will be an integral part of our growing team and organization. This highly-visible position will be involved in all phases of the proposal development process, with critical responsibility for assisting in the production of high-quality proposals, while ensuring on-schedule proposal production and submission.

The Proposal Manager will work collaboratively with the proposal team members to produce large volumes of work with consistent quality. The Proposal Manager will assist the team by evaluating government and commercial solicitations; conducting bid/no-bid meetings; developing compliance matrices and proposal schedules; monitoring RFx amendments and conveying changes to response team; gathering vendor questions and distributing client responses; revising schedules, outlines, and matrices, as necessary; creating RFx response shells; customizing boilerplate verbiage; working with Subject Matter Experts to create custom content; editing and formatting responses; coordinating proposal reviews; communicating response statuses; and working closely with the team to produce compelling, compliant proposals.

Required Skills
Extreme attention to detail and dedication to producing high-quality proposals
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience

Minimum of five (5) years of experience in all phases of the proposal development lifecycle
Minimum of five (5) years of experience in professional writing, editing, and proofreading, with proven ability to write with clarity and conciseness, using proper grammar, word usage, and sentence structure. Successful candidates will be required to pass a writing test.
Technical aptitude and familiarity with IT terminology and basic concepts
Flexibility and aptitude to work in a fast-paced, demanding, deadline-driven environment

Ability to communicate effectively with geographically dispersed teams and executive and senior-level personnel
Strong organizational skills with the ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage multiple projects simultaneously
Self-motivated with the ability to work both alone and in a team environment
Ability to thrive in stressful conditions and handle challenging situations, such as unpredictable, last-minute changes and stringent deadlines
Positive attitude with a great sense of humor
Advanced Microsoft Word skills and experience using Excel, Visio, and Adobe Acrobat Professional
Ability to read carefully and comprehensively and follow instructions closely

Preferred Skills
Bachelor's degree with concentration in English or in technical or business writing

Proficiency in cybersecurity and/or information technology
Extensive experience in responding to federal RFPs
Experience working in a remote environment
Entrepreneurial mindset with experience working for small, fast-growing companies
Experience using RFPio (or similar proposal management software), ServiceNow, Salesforce, and/or OpenAir
Fan of the Oxford comma

Firmly-defined core values drive all aspects of the business, which have been paramount to the company’s success and establishment of an enjoyable workplace atmosphere. The Vaccine Program Coordinator is accountable directly to the Senior Director of Health Operations. This position is responsible for supervision of a Medical Receptionist, COVID-19 Vaccination Support. The Vaccine Program Coordinator ensures that in scheduling COVID-19 vaccinations for patients and community members, all COH sites follow approved policies, procedures, and processes to ensure a high-quality, timely, and patient-centered experience. This position is required to work 100% on site. Please note that the remote work agreement is subject to change at any time, and the supervisor may require in-person learning for a specific amount of time after hire.
Highlighted Duties and Responsibilities:
Oversees the scheduling operations of COVID-19 vaccination initiatives at Community of Hope health center sites and any other vaccination locations sponsored by COH
Oversees all COVID-19 vaccine schedules to ensure appropriate appointment allotment and timing to minimize waste
Oversees patient and staff vaccine standby list
Schedules staff to ensure sufficient coverage
Schedules patients for vaccination appointments in electronic medical record
Communicates regularly with health operations and clinical team to ensure vaccine scheduling is connected to center operations and workflows
Tracks and reports vaccination volume and metrics as assigned.
Works with communications team on development of marketing materials
Ensures educational material is available in multiple languages
Completes other duties as assigned.*
Meets with supervisees regularly and provides ongoing feedback and support, including opportunities for professional development
Complies with and helps to enforce standard organizational policies and procedures as described in the COH toolbox including but not limited to the employee handbook, the Accounting Manual, and other COH policies and procedures
Promotes the “One Community, One Hope” culture through participating in quarterly culture initiatives and implementing teambuilding activities or creating other opportunities that promote a positive workplace culture.
Handles sensitive information with care and discretion to ensure confidentiality
Minimum Qualifications:
High School Diploma/GED required; B.A. preferred
Experience with starting up new programs preferred.
Strong organizational and problem-solving skills required
Experience in medical setting required
Bilingual preferred in English and Spanish/Amharic
Ability to work on site and to travel between sites required
Minimum one year supervisory experience preferred
Ability to work some evening and weekends required
Experience with electronic health records preferred.

About Us:
Community of Hope is a mission-driven, innovative, and rapidly growing nonprofit. For nearly 40 years, we have provided healthcare, housing, and supportive services for low-income, underserved, and homeless people in Washington DC. As a Federally Qualified Health Center, we provide medical, dental, behavioral health, and care coordination services for the whole family at three locations in DC. Community of Hope also has a strong emphasis on maternal and child health, with a midwifery practice and the only free-standing birth center in DC. In 2020, Community of Hope provided about 28,400 medical visits, 7,000 dental visits, and 10,000 behavioral health visits for about 11,000 patients. Community of Hope is also providing community walk-in COVID testing and COVID vaccines. Community of Hope is also one of the largest providers in DC of housing and support services for families experiencing homelessness. Through providing these programs, we live out our mission to improve health and end family homelessness to make Washington, DC more equitable.
At Community of Hope, we care for families by providing direct services with a focus on prevention, healing, and wellness. We improve lives by building on families’ strengths, honoring their choices, and taking a whole-family, multi-generational approach. We lead and advocate for system change to address the effects of historical and current racial inequities on health outcomes and housing opportunities. We embrace the diversity of our community, welcome all voices and perspectives, and treat everyone with respect, compassion, and integrity. We strive for excellence in all that we do, implement evidence-based practices, measure our outcomes, and use this knowledge to continuously strengthen our work. In 2020, and in 2014, 2016, 2017, 2018, we were selected as one of The Washington Post 150 Top Workplaces based on feedback from our staff.

Check out our website for more information here.

EMPLOYMENT ELIGIBILITY VERIFICATION PROGRAM (E-Verify) – U.S. law requires organizations to employ only individuals who may legally work in the United States - either U.S. citizens, or foreign citizens who have the necessary authorization. This agency utilizes E-Verify to compare information from the Form I-9, Employment Eligibility Verification, to data from U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS) and Social Security Administration (SSA) records to confirm employment eligibility. If the employee’s information does not match DHS and/or SSA records, the employee is given an opportunity to resolve the problem. If eligibility cannot be verified, employment will be terminated.

For reasonable accommodation at the U.S. Department of State, please contact the Office of Accessibility and Accommodations at (202) 663-3474 or ReasonableAccommodations@state.gov.

You will be evaluated for this job based on how well you meet the qualifications above.

Your application will be evaluated and rated under the Category Rating and Selection procedures. Based on your responses to the job-specific self-assessment questions, eligible candidates are placed for selection consideration into one of three pre-defined quality categories as described below:

Highly-qualified Category - In addition to meeting minimum qualifications for the position, candidates must fully demonstrate proficiency in all major aspects of the position.

Well Qualified Category - In addition to meeting minimum qualifications, candidates must demonstrate proficiency in some, but not all of the major aspects of the position.

Qualified Category - In addition to meeting minimum qualifications, applicants must demonstrate a basic level of knowledge, skill and ability of the position.

Your qualifications will be evaluated on the following knowledge, skills, abilities (KSAs) and other characteristics that are relevant to the duties of this position and must be fully supported by information in your resume:

Knowledge of laws, rules, policies, and regulations regarding contract administration
Knowledge of federal acquisition management policies and procedures
Knowledge of information technology specialty areas
Ability to apply knowledge to formulate, present and execute budgets
Knowledge of risk analysis & risk communication and the ability to analyze

Your resume serves as the basis for qualification determinations and must highlight your most relevant and significant work experience and education (if applicable) as it relates to this job opportunity. Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community, student, social). Your resume should include the dates of all qualifying experience (from month/year to month/year) and the number of hours worked/volunteered per week. Application of Veterans Preference: The Category Rating Method does not add veterans' preference points or apply the "rule of three," but protects the rights of veterans by placing them ahead of non-preference eligibles within each pre-defined quality category. Preference eligibles who meet minimum qualification requirements and who have a compensable service-connected disability of at least 10 percent (i.e., CPS and CP) must be listed in the highest quality category, except when the position being filled is scientific or professional at the GS-09 grade level or higher.

Agency Career Transition Assistance Program (CTAP) or Interagency Career Transition Assistance Program (ICTAP) candidates must be rated "Well Qualified" for the position to receive consideration for selection priority. Your application package must contain sufficient information to make a valid determination that you fully meet the basic/specialized experience requirements as stated in this job opportunity announcement for each grade level(s) for which you are applying. Eligibility for benefits depends on the type of position you hold and whether your position is full-time, part-time, or intermittent. Contact the hiring agency for more information on the specific benefits offered.

How to Apply

Prepare your application in USAJOBS To start your application, click Apply and we’ll walk you through the process where you’ll attach a resume and any required documents. During the application process you can review, edit, delete, and update your information. We’ll automatically save your progress as you go, so you won’t lose any changes. Please carefully read all the instructions before you apply. You have until 11:59 p.m. Eastern Time (ET) on the closing date of this announcement to complete the application process.

STEP 1: Select the "Apply On-line" button and follow the instructions to register or sign into USAJOBS.

STEP 2: Submit a detailed resume or any other written format you choose documenting your job-related qualifications, experience, and education (if applicable). Cover letter is optional. If you submit a cover letter, you must also submit a resume. Please see the How You Will Be Evaluated section for specific information that should be outlined in your resume.

STEP 3: Answer the job-specific self-assessment questions on-line through the U.S. Department of State’s Gateway to State automated application system. The questions will be used to evaluate your qualifications and experience for this position.

STEP 4: Submit all required documentation applicable to you, as listed in the Required Documents section of this announcement, to the Department’s Gateway to State automated application system prior to the closing date of this announcement.

For instructions on how to view the status of your supporting documentation, please click here.

Technical assistance with your on-line application is available through the Help Desk at mgshelp@monster.com or by calling (866) 656-6830 or (703) 269-4944 between the hours of 7:00 a.m. and 7:00 p.m. ET

ALTERNATE APPLICATION PROCEDURES

NOTE: If applying online poses an extreme hardship, you may request alternate application procedures to submit your application package by fax. Contact the Human Resources office listed on the announcement between the business hours of 8:15 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. ET at least 2 working days prior to the closing date of this announcement. The application package for alternate application procedures must be submitted and received in the Human Resources office no later than 11:59 p.m. ET on the closing date of this announcement. After all application packages have been received, we will review your resume to ensure you meet the basic qualification requirements. After we review and evaluate all applications, the most highly qualified candidates will be referred to the hiring manager for further consideration for possible interviews in approximately two weeks after the announcement closes. After a tentative job offer, we will conduct a suitability review and/or security background investigation, which generally takes an average of at least two to six months. You will be notified up to four times during the hiring process:

1. Upon receipt of your application.

3. After the certificate is issued.

Fair & Transparent

The Federal hiring process is setup to be fair and transparent. Please read the following guidance.

Equal Employment Opportunity Policy

The United States Government does not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, retaliation, parental status, military service, or other non-merit factor.

Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) for federal employees & job applicantsReasonable Accommodation Policy

Federal agencies must provide reasonable accommodation to applicants with disabilities where appropriate. Applicants requiring reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process should follow the instructions in the job opportunity announcement. For any part of the remaining hiring process, applicants should contact the hiring agency directly. Determinations on requests for reasonable accommodation will be made on a case-by-case basis.

A reasonable accommodation is any change to a job, the work environment, or the way things are usually done that enables an individual with a disability to apply for a job, perform job duties or receive equal access to job benefits.

Under the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, federal agencies must provide reasonable accommodations when:

An applicant with a disability needs an accommodation to have an equal opportunity to apply for a job.
An employee with a disability needs an accommodation to perform the essential job duties or to gain access to the workplace.
An employee with a disability needs an accommodation to receive equal access to benefits, such as details, training, and office-sponsored events.

You can request a reasonable accommodation at any time during the application or hiring process or while on the job. Requests are considered on a case-by-case basis.

Federal Cloud Account Executive
We are seeking an experienced and motivated Account Executive to support our growing Cloud Services division. This individual will be responsible for targeting new federal opportunities via our federal contract vehicles by leveraging our Cloud solution capabilities across the federal entities.
Strategic Communications is looking for an accomplished Federal focused Cloud Account Executive with strong communication skills, experience in Public Cloud Computing, and a passion for helping clients solve problems. Strategic currently holds multiple Federal contract vehicles such as NASA SEWP-V, NIH CIO-CS, ARMY CHESS, GSA, and NAVY SeaPort-NxG. Strategic also holds multiple SLED cooperative purchasing contracts including Texas DIR and NASPO Participating Addendums (PA) in the following states: California, Connecticut, Delaware, Hawaii, Illinois, Florida, Massachusetts, Mississippi, Missouri, Nebraska, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Utah, Vermont, and Virginia.
This position will work remotely from a home office with approximately 50-75% travel to prospect/customer sites.
Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Prospecting, qualifying, and closing new Cloud and Managed Services customer agreements for Federal market resulting in new and recurring revenue.
Assisting in the development of go-to-market plans for expansion and growth of Cloud and Managed Services revenues through channels, field sales and other partnerships.
Coordinating sales processes with technical engineers to capture business requirements.
Creating and delivering sales presentations, demonstrating ROI and value proposition to decision makers.
Generation of formal quotations and written responses to RFPs
Opportunity tracking via CRM tools.
Participating in sales meetings, networking and business development events and other duties as assigned


Education and Experience
Current or prior experience in selling and interacting with Federal government entities required, with business development and client relationship experience in DOD, DOJ, DHS, and/or the Intelligence Community required.
3+ years of business-to-business sales with history in Information Technology and a proven record of exceeding sales quota
Thorough understanding of IT terminology and ability to translate into non-technical terms.
Experience selling Infrastructure as a Service (Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, Google GCP, VMware VCloud), remote monitoring tools, backup and disaster recovery, communication, and collaboration (Cisco), and/or security (endpoint or datacenter) solutions; OEM sales certifications strongly preferred.
Experience selling software as a service (SaaS) solutions to state and local government entities and negotiating/sourcing vendors strongly preferred.
Proven success building new business relationships (interacting with C-level mgmt.), experienced in and comfortable with cold-calling.
General understanding of business operations and basic financial principles
Intermediate level of proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Outlook, PowerPoint)
CRM (relationship management software) experience required, Tigerpaw & Hubspot experience preferred.
Diploma required, Bachelor’s degree or higher preferred.
Experience working with multiple departments and managing multiple tasks concurrently.
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Capable of front-line interaction with customers and consultative selling

Key Competencies/Behaviors
Positive attitude, warm, and inviting personality
Team oriented, works well with others
Planning and organizational skills
Adaptability and stress tolerance
Self-starter, hunter's mentality - able to work effectively with minimal management oversight.

Screening Requirements: Background Check, Drug Testing

Benefits: Medical Insurance, Dental Insurance, Life Insurance, Vision Insurance, Long-term and Short-Term Disability Insurance, 401k Plan, Paid Vacation Days, Paid Sick Days, Paid Holidays

JobTitle: Dell Technologies National Security Group Business Development Professional
Text:
Account Executive, Business Development - Federal Sales – DOD ( Joint Domain Operations)
(Remote)
Do you thrive in a complex, highly collaborative technology sales environment? Do you strive to sell for a consistent industry leader? If this is you, then “Think Dell!” as the National Security Group (NSG) Program Management Office (PMO) team is looking for an exceptional individual to enable program business at the strategic level within the DoD and intelligence community (IC), and to support their missions with leading-edge IT solutions and services. With an intense mission focus, the Dell Federal sales team and PMO stand as the customers’ reliable wingman ensuring they achieve transformational business outcomes using disruptive technologies and solutions. What is our team’s secret to success? Apply today to learn more!
What makes this exciting:
(Responsibilities)
Enabling program business at a strategic level by leveraging your rich operational background and experience. This includes developing external relationships, partnerships, and business opportunities amongst the federal customer base.
Assisting government agencies & federal system integrators understand the inherent advantages of Dell Technologies and their program objectives.
Developing internal relationships and assisting the sales and leadership teams with anticipating customer needs beyond existing scope of enterprise/client products and services, especially from an operational and transformational perspective.
Preforming critical functions of assisting customers, sales teams, PMO, services, and support with the selling, deployment, and sustainment of Dell Technologies IT and services into its mission environment. This includes applied leadership and ensuring that optimal management and production activities are occurring.
How your experience will help you hit the ground running:
(Requirements)
Significant experience and connections within the DoD/IC mission space to include the leadership levels of the agencies and real-world operational experience in support of services, Combatant Commands or Joint Task Forces globally. Typically requires 20+ years of related experience with a Master’s degree.
Must have an active TS/SCI with FS poly.
Executive management/leadership training; business development experience desired
The individual should have strong communication skills with the ability to work collaboratively in a large matrix team environment.
Exceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills.
BENEFITS
We offer highly competitive salaries, bonus programs, world-class benefits, and unparalleled growth and development opportunities — all to create a compelling and rewarding work environment.
Here’s our story; now tell us yours
Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.

What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life - while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.

We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today.

You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here.

Application closing date: 1 March 2021

Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Dell encourages applicants of all ages. Read the full Equal Employment Opportunity Policy here.
Job ID: R083520

Thycotic, a global leader in IT security, is the fastest growing provider of Privileged Access Management solutions that protect an organization’s most valuable assets from cyber-attacks and insider threats. Our mission is to make self-sufficient security champions, by making security tools people love to use that make privilege management achievable for everyone.
The results show:-We have over 10,000 customers worldwide ranging from mid-sized organizations to Fortune 100 companies and are adding hundreds of new customers every quarter.-We are growing at twice the rate of the overall PAM market (50% vs 25%).
- We are among Inc. 5000 Fastest Growing Companies six years in a row.
Position Summary
Thycotic’s Professional Services (PS) department drives successful and secure customer implementations of Thycotic products and services, ensuring renewals by working with, training, and certifying customers to have fully empowered staff who can continue their successes post-services.
The PS Partner Associate will provide administrative and project coordination support for Thycotic’s PS Partner program, primarily, but not exclusively, in North America. The PS Partner Associate will report to the PS Partner Manager. Ideally, the candidate will be located in the DC metro area, however strong remote candidates will be considered.
The PS Partner Associate works closely with Thycotic’s PS Partners, Partner Technology Specialists, and PS Operations Managers. The PS Partner Associate will also work with internal and partner Solutions Architects, Project Managers, and Technical Consultants as well as staff from other departments within Thycotic including Channel, Finance, Sales and Technical Support.
Key Responsibilities
Assisting with onboarding and offboarding of PS Partners.
Providing access to tools, training, and communication relative to onboarding and offboarding
Monitoring and facilitating the progress of the PS Partners through the onboarding program.
Offboarding Partner consultants who leave their organizations.
Coordinating and scheduling appointments for technical working sessions between Thycotic consultants and Partner organizations.
Communicating news and information to our PS Partners and solution providers
Entering engagement revenue and purchase order data into Salesforce
Validating and approving invoices sent to Thycotic by our PS Partner companies.
Monitoring the status of PS engagements delivered by our PS.
Reporting and compiling data using software such as Salesforce and Excel.
Occasional event planning and organization.


Skills and Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree or higher in a communication, project management or technical field or equivalent experience.
1+ years of full-time work experience working for a provider of enterprise-class software products or solutions.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to effectively manage multiple tasks and competing priorities.
Proven ability to effectively engage and work with customers, sales, and technical roles such as technical consultants.
Solid experience with the Microsoft Office Suite, especially Microsoft Excel.
Salesforce experience is a plus.


Why Work at Thycotic?

We’re passionate problem-solvers doing our part to make the world a safer place. We invest in people who are smart, self-motivated and collaborative.

What we offer in return is meaningful work, a culture of innovation and great career progression!
Thycotic was named a “Best Places to Work” Award Winner in 2019 and 2020 in recognition of our positive work environment and culture, as reported by employees. A focus on employee advancement and our ethos of respect are just some of the reasons why people love working here!
Thycotic Software, LLC (Thycotic) is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.
Upon conditional offer of employment, candidates are required to complete a criminal background check and drug screen per Thycotic employment policy. In addition, all publicly posted social media sites may be reviewed.

We are looking for a responsible Marketing Data Analyst Enthusiast who is passionate about the intersection of Marketing, Technology, and Process Re-Engineering and looking to expand your understanding of these domains. You must have an intense curiosity about new systems and always look for how we can leverage technology to improve the marketing impact.

This is for the US region. This is for one of our premium clients and you can get a chance to work with the most brilliant and innovative teams from the comfort of your home office. This position is for a big sophisticated enterprise and we are looking to add A+ players to our team. If you think you love data and are able to provide meaningful insights, then this is the one for you. In this role, you will get a chance to work with the most brilliant and innovative teams.

Your key responsibility is to ensure that lead management and campaign reporting and operations within the Marketing team run smoothly in support of our wider demand generation goals. At a high level, this includes managing Marketing Database.

The right candidate for this role combines knowledge of marketing automation, lead management, attention to detail, numbers and marketing metrics, a passion for process improvement, and a commitment to completing projects on time.

What You'll Do:

Data Quality Management


Oversee day-to-day operations, maintenance, and support of Marketo and SFDC as the external marketing communications platform.
Manage distribution lists to ensure timely updates are made and the data entered into the system is correct and up to date.
Marketo and SFDC Field request management
Participate in data governance initiatives to drive consistent and proper handling of data inside the platform and across the business.
Provide thorough analysis of the lead database, lead routing, and flows with recommendations


Reporting & Data Analysis


Produce weekly, monthly & quarterly marketing campaigns reports and build models using tools and get insight into current data.
Manage analytics for client teams & stakeholder groups.
Track and manage any change requests for reporting requirements from teams.


Project Management:


Lead coordination of tracking efforts around all external campaigns.
Assist all stakeholders in the timing of campaigns; monitoring the timing of distribution going out to various groups and supporting campaign creation.
Be the initial point of contact to troubleshoot issues around campaign creation.

Great Minds, a rapidly growing challenger brand in the PK–12 instructional materials space, seeks an experienced Tier 2 Support Manager to join our dynamic, growing Technology team. In this role you will oversee the Tier 2 support team within the software engineering organization.
COMPANY PROFILE

Great Minds, a mission driven Public Benefit Corporation, brings teachers and scholars together to craft exemplary instructional materials that inspire joy in teaching and learning. Our English curriculum, Wit & Wisdom®, Eureka Math™ and PhD Science™, all support teachers as they take students beyond rote learning to provide a deeper, more complete understanding of the humanities, mathematics, and the sciences. Founded in 2007, Great Minds now employs more than 1,000 people.

For additional information please visit: www.greatminds.org

OUR MARKET POSITION

Great Minds’ Eureka Math is the most widely used curriculum in the history of American education. It enjoys an unrivaled 40+ net promoter score. Eureka and its sister products, Wit & Wisdom English and PhD Science, embrace much higher expectations for all students and all teachers. In a market dominated by scripted, procedural materials that drive expectations down, Great Minds produces curricula that celebrate knowledge, respect the craft of teaching, and acknowledge the true capabilities of students.

Job Purpose

The Tier 2 Support Manager leads the Tier 2 support team and processes. They ensure our customer satisfaction through timely response to issues, organized tracking of status, and effective communication with engineering teams and our customer success teams.
Responsibilities

Work with Tier 1 teams to be aware of incoming issue trends and watch list
Identify, create, and manage known issues lists (both internal and customer-facing)
Work with Product Managers to understand product roadmap
Communicate product issues and roadmap to customer-facing sales and support teams
Create, manage, and deliver communications to announce known issues, product updates and roadmap information
Assist in creating processes for customer education and issue resolution
Create and deliver training/onboarding program to new Tier 1 and 2 support members
Be knowledgeable of Great Minds Digital Products
Receive, prioritize, and manage ticket escalations from internal teams
Receive, prioritize, and manage customer escalations
Work with Tier 3 to oversee ticket queue and escalate as necessary

3-5 years of proven experience working in a Software-as-a-Service support environment
Strong project and task management skills and an ability to triage and prioritize incoming work items
Ability to solve problems in a collaborative environment, under pressure from customers
2+ years of experience managing teams (SaaS and support preferred)
Experience with Jira Service Desk or other service management solutions
Strong written communication and documentation skills
Experience working in EdTech industry preferred
Knowledge of AWS, postgres, git preferred

Required Education

Bachelor’s degree

Status
Full-time

Location

Remote, but prefer local to office
Prefer ability to work in D.C.
A cover letter and resume are required to be considered for this position.

If selected for an interview, background check will be required.

Great Minds is an equal opportunity employer. We will extend equal opportunity to all individuals without regard to race, religion, color, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity), national origin, disability, age, genetic information, or any other status protected under applicable federal, state, or local laws. Our policy reflects and affirms the organization’s commitment to the principles of fair employment and the elimination of all discriminatory practices.

Technical Writer
The Position:
We are looking for passionate, driven candidates to help solve our client’s complex problems and guide them towards operational success. The Technical Writer role at Censeo will be responsible for designing, reviewing, revising, publishing and maintaining professional-quality training materials for federal clients. Such materials may come in the form of user guides, integration guides, API developer guides, in-platform instructions, installation/configuration instructions and system operations. Censeo’s Technical Writer will be instrumental in gathering and analyzing technical information from various sources including software and systems engineering, system operations, testing, and user documentation. This role is integral in continuously documenting and editing new or changing product functionality in support of acquisition services, vehicles and other goods and services to Federal agency customers.
Some of your key responsibilities as a Technical Writer will include:
Planning, developing, organizing, and writing operational procedures and manuals
Researching, developing and documenting technical design specifications and test scripts
Continuously editing and revising content to ensure users have the best possible experience
Maintaining a comprehensive library of technical terminology and documentation
Analyzing documents to maintain continuity of style of content
Managing updates and revisions to technical literature
The Ideal Candidate:
At Censeo, we are looking for unique candidates whose passion and enthusiasm will help shape Censeo’s client insights and workplace culture. Our staff have a wide range of backgrounds, areas of expertise, personality types, and favorite breakfast foods. Our client and cultural successes are rooted in our team’s innovation, creative problem solving, and collaboration. The unique perspective that you bring and the way you tackle problems are much more important to us than what’s printed on your diploma. We believe a successful Technical Writer will have:
BA/BS required with a strong academic background
3+ years of proven experience working in a technical writing position
2+ years working in Federal consulting supporting Government Agencies preferred
Experience working with the General Services Administration (GSA) preferred
Superior writing skills: able to write in explanatory and procedural styles for multiple audiences
Superior creative problem-solving, analytical, and quantitative skills
Ability to work effectively on projects with demanding deadlines in a team environment
Effective verbal communication skills with an ability to share and synthesize knowledge
Ability and desire to take initiative and ownership over project work and professional development and growth
Strong attention to detail
Skilled at prioritization and multi-tasking
Knowledge and appreciation of business concepts
Understanding of spreadsheet and presentation software
Interest in working with public sector clients
Experience with coding and scripting languages preferred
Experience in graphic design preferred
The Company:
Censeo Consulting Group is a top Washington D.C. based management consulting firm dedicated to helping public sector and non-profit clients build operational excellence, deliver better outcomes, and lower cost. We take a personalized approach to strategic consulting to solve our clients’ most complex problems and build operational excellence that transforms their organizations, allowing them to better deliver on their public and social missions.
At Censeo, our award-winning culture means you’ll join a tight-knit community of 50 brilliant and passionate colleagues. We are advocates for a better functioning public sector, and we’re also good friends who know the names of each other’s dogs. Our philosophy is horizontal, not hierarchical, and our open-door policy encourages a culture of entrepreneurship at all levels. We share successes, make decisions together, and foster an environment for those with passion and initiative (Business Analysts especially!) to lead. Our colleagues bring their own unique personalities to work every day and use them to help shape our growing firm in ways that reach far beyond client projects.
The Location:
Censeo Consulting Group is based in Washington D.C. For now, we’re all working from home. But normally, we work at an office conveniently located in the heart of downtown D.C., just a few blocks away from the White House. And with many of our clients also based in D.C., we have the luxury of leaving for a meeting and being back in the office in time for post-work happy hours, team dinners, and game nights.
The Fine Print:
Expected travel 0-10%; may increase based on business needs
This is an exempt, full-time position
Expected start: TBD
Censeo offers a competitive compensation and benefits package, including paid vacation and sick leave, flexible and remote work opportunities, and tuition and training reimbursement. More information on our benefits and perks can be found at: https://www.censeoconsulting.com/about/join-us/.
Censeo is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal opportunity to all applicants and employees in full compliance with all applicable state and federal laws prohibiting discrimination on the basis of race, color, age, gender, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other class protected by applicable state or federal law.

We are ideally looking for someone who has experience engaging and selling over the phone, via emails, via FB groups and DMs and handling general customer support. We’re looking for the best of the best. We serve military customers and federal employees here in Washington DC, VA, and MD. We also work with very busy professionals here in DC. Our goal is to stand out and provide these people with the best services all of the time."Customer Champion" is the term we have chosen to adopt and use, and the reason is we want our business to stand out. We need someone who does not get angry easily, is patient, and is willing to go the extra mile to make our customers happy. We believe when we’re able to make our customers happy, everything else will fall into place.IMPORTANT DESCRIPTIONS & DETAILSAs a Customer Champion handling customer support and sales, you will proudly represent our brand, uphold our company values, provide a positive customer experience, and have an amazing follow through, which means being able to actually close the sales.You will be responsible for effectively and enthusiastically engaging with our online community, following up with potential clients, nurturing cold leads into warmer ones for our services, and keeping a close track record of all prospects that come to us directly, through our sales / marketing venues and pipelines.You will also be communicating with leads and our online community members by direct message through our Instagram and Facebook Business Page, acting on behalf of and as the Business Face or First Line of Representation.We have systems in place and use modern day technology that allow us to run our business efficiently. At Compass, we envision a world where the experience of selling or buying a home is simple and pleasant for everyone. Founded in 2012, Compass provides an end-to-end platform that empowers residential real estate agents to deliver exceptional service to their seller and buyer clients, all in service of our mission to help everyone find their place in the world.
Team Overview:

The Compass Agent Experience Manager (AEM) supports agents across multiple disciplines: product, operations and enterprise systems. The AEM serves as an intermediary and collaborator between agents and other specialty teams. You will partner with specialty functions to leverage expertise across the organization all focused on growing your agent's business. This individual's performance is based on specific metrics associated with agent onboarding, product and program adoption, and agent retention.

As a Compass Agent Experience Manager, you help Compass agents leverage industry-leading solutions, comprising technology, programs, and specialists, to grow their business. You are an ambassador, relationship manager, primary point of contact, and expert for a roster of Compass real estate agents. You will spend the majority of your time (80%+) in an agent-facing capacity building relationships, and providing real time, best-in-class support that ensures their success. In addition, you will partner with our Workplace team to provide operational office support for the Chevy Chase space.

What You Will Do:

Proactively serve a portfolio of assigned agents so that they may achieve positive business outcomes via Compass software and services
Drive agent software and program engagement to help agents become power users
Master Compass technology and educate agents on Compass products and programs to enable best business practices in a competitive landscape
Partner closely with Real Estate Sales Managers and other cross-functional teams to build and execute agent success strategies, including business growth plans
Welcome new agents by conducting onboarding sessions for individual agents and agent teams
Conduct in-person Compass product and program trainings and meetings with agents as needed
Work proactively to identify agent needs and develop solutions
Document and continuously improve best practices, resources, and SOPs
Work with local regional leadership on local best practices and regional priority projects
Troubleshoot issues related to marketing, Compass tools, technology/devices, enterprise systems, etc.
Work collaboratively with specialty roles to champion non-AEM questions on behalf of the agent

Who You Are:

You have a Bachelor's degree in a relevant field
You have 2-4 years previous experience in agent service, client success, client relationship management or hospitality
You possess a real passion for serving agents trying to grow their businesses
You have the ability to establish credibility with key agent decision makers and influencers, and strong customer service skills
You have strong written and verbal communication and presentation skills; extraordinary listening skills
You have strong problem solving and analytical skills; quickly formulates solutions that deliver real business value
You have the ability to recognize and maximize new business opportunities
You have multi-tasking down to a science; handling multiple accounts and assignments simultaneously
You have an interest in new software and cutting edge programs in the larger real estate landscape
You have a commitment to exceed goals that is internal, constant, and self imposed
Previous experience in real estate and technology a plus
Previous experience with live or remote training a plus
Previous experience working with enterprise technology (Zendesk, Salesforce, Confluence, Gsuite) a plus

At Compass, our mission is to help everyone find their place in the world. This means we continually celebrate the diverse community different individuals cultivate. As an equal opportunity employer, we stay true to our mission by ensuring that our place can be anyone's place.

Notice for California Applicants

Manager, Global Marketing
Company Overview:
Palladium is a global leader in the design, development and delivery of Positive Impact - the intentional creation of enduring social and economic value. We work with foundations, investors, governments, corporations, communities and civil society to formulate strategies and implement solutions that generate lasting social, environmental and financial benefits.
For the past 50 years, we have been making Positive Impact possible. With a team of more than 2,500 employees operating in 90 plus countries and a global network of more than 35,000 technical experts, Palladium has improved - and is committed to continuing to improve - economies, societies and most importantly, people's lives.
Palladium is a child-safe organisation, and screens applicants for suitability to work with children. We also provide equal employment to all participants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, veteran or marital status.
Overview:
Palladium’s Manager, Global Marketing is a senior role on the Global Communications team, building awareness of our brand in target markets and generating priority leads through the use of our digital channels. It’s a highly creative, global role for a deeply driven and relentlessly organized marketing professional.
 Primary Duties and Responsibilities:
Plans and executes Palladium’s digital marketing strategy in alignment with company goals, including web, SEO/SEM, marketing database, email, social media, and display advertising

Maintains Palladium’s social media presence across all digital channels

Contributes to a consistent corporate brand message and suite of tools to align with the global organization

Equips and supports stakeholders to advocate for Palladium across digital channels

Monitors and analyzes industry trends and competitive landscape to adjust / enhance company positioning and messaging as required

Measures and reports on the performance of all digital marketing campaigns and assesses return on investment and progress against KPIs

Manages agency and other vendor partners as needed

Reporting requirements
The Manager, Global Marketing reports to the Director of Communications, and will liaise with and support stakeholders across the business

Reporting requirements include:

Attendance at all weekly and/or management team meetings

Regular updates with your line manager

Monthly metrics report on individual and relevant group KPIs
Relationships
This role forms part of the Global Communications team, and supports leaders across the business.
 Authority levels
A high degree of autonomy with appropriate consultation where applicable

Relating to the assigned workload, the role will be required to make sound recommendations to Global Communications

The role will also be expected to contribute to process improvement through innovative and cost-effective proposals, ideas, and suggestions
Key competencies and professional expertise required
Knowledgeable in current and possible future practices, trends, and technologies in marketing

Comfort taking initiative when met with new challenges; curiosity and creative problem-solving skills

Demonstrated ability to work comfortably with concepts and complexity

Ability to grasp new concepts and situations quickly and effectively

Thrives in times of change

Strong business acumen, with the ability to recognise trends, anticipate consequences, and create competitive strategies and plans that deliver results

Demonstrated ability to deliver the highest-quality digital marketing products and services which meet the needs and requirements of internal and external stakeholders

Outstanding verbal and written communication skills

Comfort working on a remote team in a fast-paced, global environment

Compassionate and collaborative interpersonal skills

Willingness to travel to various company locations (up to 20%)

Latham & Watkins, a global law firm consistently ranked among the top firms in the world, is currently seeking an Internal Communications Lead to join our talented and dynamic team. The success of our firm is largely determined by our commitment to hire and develop the very best and brightest, creating a team that provides our colleagues with the highest quality of work and service. We are driven by our core values: respect, innovation, and collaboration.

As the global outbreak of COVID-19 continues to unfold, Latham has taken precautions to help protect our people, clients, and the communities where we live and work. This includes a temporary shift to remote working for the majority of our lawyers and staff. This role will likely start remotely while the firm continues to evaluate the situation.

As an integral member of the Internal Communications team within the Brand & Communications Department, the Internal Communications Lead will support the development and implementation of engaging internal communications and targeted/firmwide campaigns. In particular, the Lead will be a communications business partner to our Global Human Resources teams, continually seeking ways to elevate our employer brand and serving as communications project lead for a variety of staff recruiting and onboarding, staff diversity and inclusion, and staff engagement/culture initiatives.

The Internal Communications Lead will also proactively contribute to daily internal communications functions, working as part of a close-knit team, and on a regular basis, will wear many hats — serving as strategist, project lead, editor, copywriter, proofreader, creative consultant, and multimedia specialist.

The Lead will use their internal communications expertise to accomplish these and other critical functions:

Take the lead on assigned internal communications projects and campaigns, collaborating closely with stakeholders to understand goals and needs, offer communications counsel, proactively identify communications opportunities, and recommend appropriate branding, messaging, and solutions.
Provide both strategic and tactical communications support. Specifically, the work of the Internal Communications Lead may include but is not limited to developing communications project plans for the rollout of change initiatives; developing leadership messaging and talking points; reviewing and refining the messaging strategy for the firm’s recruiting-related platforms; developing communications best practices, tools, and templates for staff affinity groups and HR teams; delivering end-to-end communications for new programs and initiatives, from naming and branding to the launch strategy; and providing counsel on intranet site information architecture and design.
Create original and memorable written and multimedia content across a diverse range of initiatives, appropriately leveraging internal (and sometimes external) channels; Use audio, visual, video, and other media to tell a compelling story, with an eye toward making communications succinct and accessible to global audiences; See potential to create enthusiasm about topics others may see as routine.
Develop familiarity with relevant subject areas in order to advance the goals of internal stakeholders, including Human Resources functions such as Staff Recruiting, Staff Diversity & Inclusion, Staff Learning & Development, and HR Operations.
Collaborate with Brand & Communications peers who support Attorney Recruiting, Attorney Development, and Attorney Diversity & Inclusion to share best practices and key project updates, as well as ensure message alignment when appropriate.
Measure and report on the effectiveness of campaigns, including proactively seeking utilization and engagement data; develop best practices.
Explore internal communications trends and best practices, multimedia tools, and technologies in order to enhance communication tactics and make recommendations for new tools and initiatives.

As the Internal Communications Lead, you should:

Be a strong and dexterous writer with the ability to simplify complex information and effectively target/adapt messages to a variety of audiences.
Have strong project and time management skills, including organizing, planning, problem-solving, and decision-making; display the ability to flex to changing demands and manage multiple priorities.
Have a customer-focused mindset, well-developed interpersonal skills, and the ability to build relationships with stakeholders and interact effectively with colleagues at all organizational levels in the firm.
Have the ability to use independent judgment and discretion when making decisions; be confident and comfortable providing specific recommendations to stakeholders.
Have strong analytical skills and technical acumen, including the ability to gather, organize, develop, and present data and metrics to help us measure the effectiveness of our work.

A Bachelor’s degree is required, preferably in Communications, Marketing, Management, or a related field.

A minimum of seven (7) years of experience working with diverse employee groups, writing/editing, and developing internal campaigns for a range of different audiences is required. Experience providing communications support for Human Resources-related functions is desired. The Lead should have advanced skills with PC applications, including MS Office, along with basic photo editing skills; SharePoint experience preferred; Adobe Creative Suite and other design experience is a plus.

The Internal Communications Lead will receive a generous total compensation package. Discretionary bonuses, as well as profit-sharing partnership contributions to 401(k) accounts, may be awarded in recognition of individual and firm performance. Eligible employees can participate in Latham's comprehensive support offerings including healthcare, well-being programs, 401k Plan, firm-paid basic life and disability insurance, resources for parents and caregivers, family building support, and more! In addition, employees receive: 10 paid holidays per year and a PTO program that accrues 23 days during the first year of employment and grows with tenure; ongoing professional development opportunities, including firm-paid access to thousands of LinkedIn Learning courses online; and peer networking, mentoring, and professional support through staff affinity groups.

Qualified candidates are encouraged to apply by clicking the ‘Apply Now’ link. Completion of a writing exercise will be required during the candidate review process.

Latham & Watkins is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our commitment to diversity, equal opportunity and sustainability enables Latham & Watkins to draw from a remarkable wealth of talent to create one of the world's leading law firms.
