Job Description for Sidehill ConsultingOpportunity and ImpactSidehill Consulting is looking for a valuable 100% commission sales representative to join our team! We are looking to expand exponentially this year with an outside sales team who share our drive and motivation as well as our desire to serve our customers with the highest level of service.We are creating our 100% commission outside sales team who can work from anywhere in the world...We invite you to apply.We're growing like crazy and we need motivated and driven, take-charge salespeople to expand on this success.Our 100% commission-based team has a very clear and realistic path to make $100K+ per year ($80K+ in your first year); with a product that almost sells itself. This salesperson model has been created by life-long salespeople, not a CPA or CFO. Together, our team carefully crafted this role and designed it based on creating “the dream” sales role that you’d want to stay in forever.Our #1 goal for you as a salesperson is to help you live your ideal life, including:Uncapped Earning Potential- We want you to make so much money you don’t know what to do with it.Time Freedom- You need to have time to enjoy your financial freedom. What good does it do to make a bunch of money but have no time to enjoy life?Flexibility- We don’t believe in sales managers… We believe in mentors!!! You will have your own performance coach, accountability coach and onboarding specialist who will be there to support you as you grow. Get things done on your schedule… no more punching a clock.Industry and CompanyMany companies struggle with consistency in their revenue & sales. We uncover what’s broken and fix the infrastructure issues so your sales systems work and your revenue grows reliably. Each member of our fulfillment team has at least 25 years of successful sales experience (15+ years of C level leadership).We guide organizations to more rapid growth, breaking stagnant or erratic sales cycles, and achieving more consistency in new revenue.We have a ridiculous amount of support for our sales team including:Personal and group coaching… designed to take your skills and abilities to the next level.Technology tools and automation created to allow you to get rid of the mundane, repetitive tasks that bog down most salespeople.The time to dominate this market segment is now, and it’s time for you to come and show off what you can accomplish!Key ResponsibilitiesRespond in a timely manner to all leads.Initiate outbound efforts (call, text, email) each day to prospects.Qualify prospects, gauge interest, and schedule sales calls.Collaborate with the team on improving prospecting strategies.Ability to identify & source information on prospective clients.QualificationsStrong company culture fitAbility to receive inbound and make outbound phone calls via cell or internet (wired ethernet) in a quiet environment without interruptions.Strong listening skills and excellent phone demeanor.Technologically proficient; not necessarily an expert, but knowledgeableExcellent written and verbal communicationCRM experience a HUGE plusOther InformationCompensation: 100% commission - High Six Figures is achievable ($160K+), anything less than Six Figures would be considered a failure. (There is no ceiling to your compensation plan)Bonus opportunitiesWorking from anywhere in the worldJob Type: Full-timeWe appreciate your interest in joining our team!Job Types: Full-time, CommissionPay: $38,318.00 - $146,703.00 per yearCOVID-19 considerations:Position is 100% RemoteExperience:Sales: 2 years (Preferred)Outside Sales: 1 year (Preferred)Application Question:Can you please provide your Linkedin URL?Work Location:Fully RemoteWork Remotely:Yes

JobTitle: Document Management Analyst II - Expert Contracting Unit
Text:
Description
Job Description:
Leidos is looking for a highly-motivated, first-class Document Management Analyst II with document management experience who is well-organized, proficient with Excel, able to work under tight deadlines, and has a good understanding of maintaining financial and contract documents coupled with good customer service skills. This position is in the Expert Contracting Unit within the Finance Department of our client, the Environment and Natural Resources Division (ENRD) of the U.S. Department of Justice at 150 M Street NE, Washington, DC. Join our team and be a valued part of ENRD's mission to enforce civil and criminal environmental laws and programs protecting the health and environment of the United States, and to defend suits challenging those laws and programs.
In this role, you will gain many intangible skills, such as time and task management, critical thinking and problem solving, the ability to communicate complicated problems in a concise manner with internal and external colleagues of all levels, as well as solve complex problems using your accounting skills and available technological tools. If you are well-organized, proficient with Excel, able to work under tight deadlines, have a good understanding of financial, accounting, and/or banking principles coupled with good customer service skills, and thrive in a fast-paced and diverse environment, this job is for you!
Primary Responsibilities:
Maintain expert contract file storage.
Print contract award distribution packages.
Monitor Expert Info mailbox.
Update information in Federal Procurement Data System.
Perform moderately complex tasks including, for example, detailed review and analysis of case materials such as financial records and contract documents.
Compile documents for requests on cases.
Respond to emails and perform customer service functions.
Please Note: Must be able to work onsite 5 days a week in Washington, DC (once temporary Pandemic Remote work is over OR when asked to return in the office).
Basic Qualifications:
Three years of document management experience on major projects OR an undergraduate degree.
Should be a knowledgeable user of computer network environments, including but not limited to data processing, office automation networks, PC-based databases, internet server-based databases and other applications such as word processing, spreadsheet, imaging, and hardware systems.
Excellent oral and written communications skills.
Must be a U.S. citizen.
Must be able to obtain a Public Trust clearance.
Preferred Qualifications:
Suggested skills that would be helpful for this position:
Contract and audit experience, helpful.
Proficiency in Excel, highly preferred.
Current or active clearance, preferred.

JobTitle: Document Management Analyst II - Quality Assurance
Text:
Description
Job Description:
Leidos is looking for a highly-motivated, first-class Document Management Analyst II to lead efforts to implement the required actions to resolve expert contract audit findings in support the Finance Department of our client, the Environment and Natural Resources Division (ENRD) of the U.S. Department of Justice at 150 M Street NE, Washington, DC. Join our team and be a valued part of ENRD's mission to enforce civil and criminal environmental laws and programs protecting the health and environment of the United States, and to defend suits challenging those laws and programs.
In this role, you will gain many intangible skills, such as time and task management, critical thinking and problem solving, the ability to communicate complicated problems in a concise manner with internal and external colleagues of all levels, as well as solve complex problems using your accounting skills and available technological tools. If you are well-organized, proficient with Excel, able to work under tight deadlines, have a good understanding of financial, accounting, and/or banking principles coupled with good customer service skills, and thrive in a fast-paced and diverse environment, this job is for you!
Primary Responsibilities:
Lead efforts to implement the required actions to resolve expert contract audit findings.
Perform moderately complex tasks including, for example, detailed review and analysis of case materials such as financial records, contract documents, and audit findings.
Compile documents for requests on cases.
Respond to emails and perform customer service functions.
 Please Note: Must be able to work onsite 5 days a week in Washington, DC (once temporary Pandemic Remote work is over OR when asked to return in the office).
Basic Qualifications:
Three years of document management experience on major projects OR an undergraduate degree.
Should be a knowledgeable user of computer network environments, including but not limited to data processing, office automation networks, PC-based databases, internet server-based. databases and other applications such as word processing, spreadsheet, imaging, and hardware systems.
Keen attention to detail and problem-solving skills.
Excellent oral and written communications skills.
Must be a U.S. citizen.
Must be able to obtain a Public Trust clearance.
Preferred Qualifications:
Suggested skills that would be helpful for this position:
Contract and audit experience, helpful.
Proficiency in Excel, highly preferred.
Current or active clearance, preferred.

The Christian Post is looking for a full-time and experienced Section Editor who is able to oversee weekend news coverage on Saturday and Sunday, and manage the Church & Ministry section. The Weekend Editor/Church & Ministry Editor should be able to write articles, conduct interviews, solicit opinion pieces from thought leaders and experts, and handle line and copy edits, including breaking church & ministry news and features.

Responsibilities


Distribute assignments to Reporters in collaboration with Managing Editors

Run weekend coverage on Saturday and Sunday, and 3 days of weekday coverage.
Review all Church & Ministry content, reviewing text, images, videos and embedded content
Edit stories for content, accuracy, story flow and continuity; as well as for style, grammar, spelling and punctuation
Update the Christianpost.com homepage
Manage The Christian Post’s weekend social presence, posting new stories to Twitter and Facebook
Work with staff and freelance writers to sharpen leads, as well as fact-checking
Write compelling, SEO-friendly headlines; crafting concise, accurate captions
Recruit Opinion writers/contributors who are thought leaders and respected practitioners in churches & ministries
Interview key church & ministry leaders
Network with Christian churches, ministries and leaders
Ensure content is written and presented with clarity and a biblical worldview
Able and willing to write articles and breaking news stories
Other duties as assigned


Requirements


Bachelor’s or equivalent degree
At least three years' proven experience working as a news editor online, post-baccalaureate degree.
Proven experience in both line editing and copy editing, working revisions and rewriting of stories
Ability to work under deadlines without compromising editorial standards
Expert with AP style
Agree with The Christian Post’s statement of faith
Based in Washington, D.C., Dallas, TX or remote.


Please include 3 writing samples, a cover letter, and resume.

Role: Security RSM
Are you a highly successful Enterprise Security Sales Professional, passionate about security, and a domain expert? Excited about joining a Gartner Magic Quadrant leader with double-digit growth? If you answered yes, you should definitely read more!
We are experiencing a time of high growth where our customers are turning to us for guidance as they look for solutions to solve critical security & business problems. Therefore, we are aggressively hiring a brand-new Security Sales team within our Americas team. This team will be instrumental in positioning Splunk’s security solutions, improving customer’s security postures, and making our digital world a safer place. In addition, you will be responsible for assisting in closing security sales opportunities across the region.
In addition to requisite passion, skills, and experience, you will have a measurable track record in building and managing effective and meaningful relationships with our customers at the Executive level. You will play a critical role in driving a significant share of revenue for Splunk. This role will exclusively partner with our Enterprise sales team for the Northeast and drive security opportunities within this territory.
Responsibilities:
Drive qualified pipeline and forecast accurately to achieve monthly, quarterly and annual targets
Apply security and cloud expertise in building and maintaining relationships with customer CISO/SecOps/Security Leaders
Collaborate in partnership with the sales team, cross-functional teams, and external partners
Work jointly on all aspects of the sales cycle to secure new Splunk Security customers.
Intimately skilled in account planning, strategy and sales calls and has a strong understanding of how to "land and expand" within an existing customer base
Design and execute sales campaigns with sales teams & partner with Splunk's ecosystem/channel to run programs
Act as the Security Advisor to the district and collaborate with the team to drive outcomes with the account team and customer
Lead security engagements with customers to evaluate their various compliance needs, SOC maturity, or efficiency in using our products.
Requirements:
Minimum of 5 years experience with software security and SaaS/Cloud
Strong executive presence, communication, interpersonal, written, and presentation skills
You have sold in a team environment, collaborating with multiple internal teams to drive successful outcomes
Excel in a fast-growing organization, dedicated to disrupting the industry
Significant experience in Territory mapping, account planning, and opportunity management
Successful in negotiating favorable pricing and business terms with large commercial enterprises by selling value and return on investment
Up-to-date understanding of current market, customer, competitive trends & anomalies in the security market.
Experience with common security frameworks and models such as: MITRE ATT&CK, ISO27001/2, CSA Cloud Control Matrix. Comfortable leading strategic customer workshops in these areas.
You are familiar with security data sources and their use for basic and advanced detection methods, including Cloud-based data sources
Experience selling similar complex security solutions in any of the following: SOC security-based products (such as Malware/Exploit Prevention, Anti-Virus, White Listing, SIEM, and other techniques) or SAS, Behavior Analytic or Logging tools in the Commercial and Enterprise markets
Familiarity with other SIEM, UEBA and SOAR technologies, and with complementary technologies to Splunk
Experience with target account selling, solution selling, and/or consultative sales techniques; knowledge of MEDDPICC and Challenger methodologies is a plus
Thrives in a transparent, dynamic, and disruptive team environment
Able to work independently and remotely from other members of your expansive team and corporate
We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which you are applying.

Reporting to the Head of Customer Success and working with our Technical Account Managers, you will onboard our new customers - building the foundation for the customer relationship - and teach new teams about increasing fairness and clarity in their recruiting processes. Our customer success team works with an exciting array of global customers, from startups to Fortune 500 companies, and the insights you gain while working with our new customers will have an impact on the evolution of our onboarding and retention strategies. This role could be perfect for someone in recruiting or Human Resources / L&D looking to transition to a more product and customer focused opportunity.

You will:
Project manage a new customer's onboarding process from project kick-off through user training
Set partnership goals with information handed off from the sales process and learned in kick-off conversations
Work with technical account managers on the onboarding implementation plan
Understand a customer's workflow and speak with authority on best practices in the recruiting workflow
Schedule and lead remote trainings for new teams of 10 to 100+ users
Create custom training materials (videos, presentations, how-to guides, and support articles)
Learn new product offerings and introduce them in a way that is relevant to current customer workflows
Hand off important customer information to ongoing relationship managers after the onboarding process concludes

TapRecruit is a small but mighty team with a big mission of democratizing opportunity for all qualified candidates. Our founders are located in New York but we're building a team of experienced engineers, linguists and scientists from across the USA.

We care deeply about fairness (it's our mission) so you can be ensured that your application will never be judged based on your religious belief, age, color, race, creed, marital status, gender, sexual orientation, political affiliation, ethnic origin, family status or disability.

What we do

At Civis, we take a science-first approach to solving business problems using person-level data. With a blend of proprietary technology and statistical advisory services, we help public and private sector organizations find, understand and connect with the people they care about, so they can stop guessing and start using mathematical proof to guide decisions. We know others use "data science" and "analytics" as buzzwords, but at Civis we don't stand for fluff, and we will always deliver scalable products and technologies — not PowerPoints — to drive your business forward. Learn more about Civis at www.civisanalytics.com.

Our mission

Our mission is to bring objective, data-driven truth to organizational decision-making – all the way from the boardroom to the world's largest social causes.

About the Role

We are looking for people who are excited about helping governments become more analytically mature, innovative and efficient. Civis has significantly expanded our public sector industry vertical in the past year, with clients across the country at all levels of government, from small cities all the way to the federal government. To build on that success and scale our business, we are looking for an experienced public sector salesperson with a passion for bringing value to federal government, an understanding of selling to federal civilian agencies, and an understanding of the emerging technology needs of government.

Due to the uncertainty of COVID-19, all Civis offices are closed and all employees are remote for the foreseeable future. This is being closely monitored as things change and it's likely our offices will reopen. However, when offices reopen, this role will be based in our DC office.

Responsibilities

Expand our small but growing federal government software and solutions practice into new civilian agencies
Work with management to define, and then execute on sales strategies by product and/or agency
Understand target customer buying cycles in-depth, influence those cycles where possible, and accurately forecast sales to Civis management
Work closely with technical teams to scope solutions to customer needs, to include developing presentations, white papers, and RFP responses
Develop and maintain a strong understanding of the procurement structures, key contract vehicles, potential partners, and major competitors in target markets
Meet and exceed quarterly and annual sales targets and assist the organization in growing existing business
Maintain a deep understanding of the civic technology space, and how Civis solutions meet the unique needs of federal government customers
Identify market changes or new opportunities to and present these opportunities to the Civis executive and product teams
Represent Civis at industry events and conferences

Minimum Qualifications

BA/BS degree
5+ years of relevant experience
Strong understanding of and interest in the use of data analytics to improve citizen-facing services
Demonstrated understanding of priorities, strategic direction, and organization of one or more civilian agencies
Proven record of selling software solutions and/or services to federal clients at civilian agencies
Ability to make strategic decisions about procurement avenues and bidding strategies, including full and open market competition, GWAC vehicles, software resellers, and teaming
Effective account / territory planning and time management skills
Strong presentation and communication skills
Ability to self-manage and deal with the ambiguity that comes with a successful, growth-stage company
Strong relationship-building, interpersonal, and organizational skills

Why join our team?

The opportunity to be part of a growing tech startup focused on solving interesting and meaningful problems, invested in internal promotion, and committed to fostering a diverse, equal and inclusive workplace.
Competitive benefits, including unlimited PTO, 401K match with immediate vesting, health, dental, and vision benefits, fully paid parental leave, breastfeeding support including breastmilk shipping services for traveling moms, commuter benefits, wellness initiatives including weekly group meditations, monthly on-site massage therapy, and pet insurance.
To support employees in our now fully remote work environment, we also have expanded our virtual journal and book clubs, Donut Pals (organized virtual coffee meet-ups), Lightning Talks (5-minute presentations on anything you'd like), Lunch-and-Learns, and HR Open Discussions (bi-weekly meet-up where we discuss ideas and topics of the day in a casual format). We are also able to support and accommodate flexible work from home schedules to help employees juggle responsibilities at home.

Civis Analytics embraces the individuality of our employees and we celebrate each other's differences. Our products, services, and culture benefit from and thrive on the unique perspectives brought by each person in our community. We're proud to be an equal opportunity workplace, and we are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, age, sex, color, ancestry, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact internalrecruiting@civisanalytics.com

Only applications on our website will be reviewed:https://americares.csod.com/ux/ats/careersite/1/home/requisition/924?c=americaresTITLE: Analyst, Financial Planning and AnalysisDEPARTMENT: FinanceLOCATION: Stamford area preferred (can be remote)REPORTS TO: Senior Director, Financial Planning and AnalysisASSIGNMENT TYPE: Full-timeABOUT AMERICARES:Americares is a health-focused relief and development organization that saves lives and improves health for people affected by poverty or disaster. Each year, Americares reaches more than 90 countries, including the United States, with life-changing health programs, medicine and medical supplies. Americares is the world’s leading nonprofit provider of donated medicine and medical supplies. For more information, visit americares.org.POSITION SUMMARY:We are seeking an Analyst of Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) to join our Finance team. The focus of FP&A is to (1) provide support for strategic planning, annual budget and forecast processes, (2) analyze and report our financial results internally and to our Board of Directors, and (3) partner with the organization’s budget holders worldwide in order to assist in the achievement of organizational goals. This role will provide support in budget development, monitoring, grant proposal review and financial forecasting. Further assignments will include various organization-wide initiatives. The Analyst of Financial Planning & Analysis will perform duties under the guidance and instruction of the Senior Director of Financial Planning & Analysis.DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Assist in the management of the Annual Budget process, including:· Prepare budget worksheets with comparative prior year information· Work with budget holders to facilitate their completion of submissions· Assist in the analysis and production of the budget package for management review· Assist in monthly spread of budget worksheets and upload into systemMonthly and Yearend close responsibilities, including:· Perform analytics of restricted time allocation and associated entries· Track and analyze the monthly actual reports for assigned departments and large multi-department organizational projects to identify issues and opportunities versus budget and to assist in preparation of any needed adjustment entries· Assist in review of Federal grant budget proposals and final budgets for system upload· Assist in analysis for our annual financial audit, as needed· Assist in the completion of other finance tasks, as assignedCORE AMERICARES RESPONSIBILITIES:· Foster AmeriCares values of responsiveness, results orientation, collaboration, efficiency and integrity· Train, support and develop department staff in the use of financial systems, policies and procedures to increase individual and team effectivenessQUALIFICATIONS:-Bachelor’s Degree, preferably in Business Administration, Finance or Data Analytics-Minimum of 2-3 years budgeting/finance or data analytics experience-Non-profit finance experience preferred-Basic knowledge of accounting and financial statements preferred-Experience with large financial software system required; budget software preferred-Attention to detail and ability to work to defined specifications-Ability to manage, analyze and communicate insights from large data sets-Inquisitive with strong analytic and observation skills-Strong problem-solving skills, including ability to propose new solutions-Excellent written and oral communication, time management and personnel skills-Strong Excel and PowerPoint skills, proficiency in Microsoft Word and Outlook required-Must have unrestricted authorization to work in the United StatesPERSONAL SUCCESS FACTORS:-Passion for our mission and the desire to work within the global health/international development sector-Ability to work in a remote team environment-Able to successfully handle multiple projects concurrently, work effectively in highly fluid and stressful circumstances and flexibility to pivot quickly if required-Ability to be able to understand the “Big Picture” and how it ties to our daily operational efforts-Energized by learning new processes and a willingness to both accept and drive change and innovationJob Type: Full-timeWork Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processPersonal protective equipment provided or requiredSocial distancing guidelines in placeVirtual meetingsSanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

JobTitle: Managing Editor I /Curriculum Developer (Trauma/Mental Health Focus)
Text:
EDC is one of the world’s leading nonprofit research and development firms. EDC designs, implements, and evaluates programs to improve education, health, and economic opportunity worldwide. Collaborating with both public and private partners, we strive for a world where all people are empowered to live healthy, productive lives.
EDC is committed to diversity in the workplace.
Job Description
The Trauma Recovery, Mental Health Promotion, and Violence Prevention Team has an opening for a full-time Managing Editor I / Curriculum Developer (Trauma/Mental Health Focus) who will report to the Associate Team Director. The position is to be located in either Waltham, MA; Washington, DC; or via remote home office. EDC Is currently remote through at least June 2021. A part-time position of 50-75% is an option for the right candidate.
Funded through federal and foundation grants, the Trauma Recovery, Mental Health Promotion, and Violence Prevention Team works to develop new evidence-based training programs (face-to-face and virtual), train a variety of professionals and lay audiences in clinical and public health-focused interventions, consult to various audiences on issues of mental health, trauma, and violence prevention, and work at the school, community, state, and national levels to advance and promote initiatives and add to thought leadership that promotes mental wellness, trauma-informed approaches, suicide prevention, and violence prevention on individual and systemic levels.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
The person in this position is expected to communicate clearly and courteously; to develop and maintain positive relationships with clients, consultants, consultants, collaborators, co-workers, field sites, and funders; and to work respectfully with EDC colleagues. The job requires adherence to EDC policies & procedures.
The Managing Editor (I) / Curriculum Developer (Trauma/Mental Health Focus) is responsible for directing the development and execution of a variety of complex, high impact writing and editorial projects for internal and/or external audiences. The person in this position is expected to:
Manage publication, communication, or production projects
Work in multiple content areas on diverse tasks requiring broad experience and technical exposure
Work on complex problems, where analysis requires in-depth evaluation of intangible variables
Define objectives and guides products through multiple revisions to achieve them
Determine methods and procedures; recommend policies
Recommend new concepts, designs, and layouts
Manage usage of style & editorial rules; keep abreast of changes in tools, methods, and techniques
Draft and organize manuscripts, edit, and review final drafts for typesetting or publication; may rewrite or modify copy to conform to publication’s style and editorial policy; oversee authentication and correction of data
Discuss copy with client for approval and to incorporate changes
Oversee database management and procedures for recordkeeping and updating & maintenance of documentation
Recommend & conduct improvements in technical or administrative policies & procedures
Write and edit a broad variety of articles, papers, publications, and marketing or promotional pieces
May select or recommend graphics to illustrate documents
Implement policies & procedures related to service agreements and contractual obligations
May specialize in one or more fields, or in a particular type of publication, such as manuals, handbooks, articles, or proposals
Write and design curricula, training manuals, and written resources developed across projects, working closing with subject matter experts to solidify the learning objectives, content, and then serving as main writer of the materials (an example can be found here)
Strategically design curricula including learning objectives and delivery method according to adult learning principles
Serve as main writer for new federal proposals for new business development opportunities (an example can be found here)
Serve as main writer for peer-reviewed publications to highlight team’s project work (an example can be found here)
Develop formal and informal pieces such as white papers and blogs on issues related to mental health, trauma, and/or violence prevention (examples of blogs can be found here and here)
Research and collect necessary information from the literature to inform publications, resources, subject matter experts, and training curricula
Identify gaps in knowledge and understanding
Revise and edit materials in response to feedback and/or external review
Work with instructional designers to finalize training curricula and materials for external use
The Managing Editor (I) / Curriculum Developer (Trauma/Mental Health Focus):
Coordinates project publications from initiation to completion
Confers with center or project staff to establish project goals and technical specifications, determine specific or general subject material to be developed for publication, or to resolve development or publishing problems
Collaborates with senior staff/management on complex questions; exercises tact and discretion in raising and resolving issues
Keeps management informed of status of issues and projects
Interviews individuals or attends meetings to obtain items or clarify information for inclusion, and verify facts; researches or seeks technical advice and refers complex problems to senior management
Facilitates teamwork and feedback exchanges
Provides technical guidance and may train or supervise regular or contract staff, lead projects and schedule work, and assigns research and other editorial duties, to less experienced staff or assistants, advising them as needed
May coordinate products with freelance writers or editors, graphic artists, multimedia specialists, publishers, and printers; supervising quality
May work with internal clients on preformatted periodic publications such as quarterly reports or periodicals
Additionally, the Managing Editor (I) / Curriculum Developer (Trauma/Mental Health Focus):
Works largely independently on problems or assignments, determining methods and procedures for accomplishing tasks while also being able to work in a group and with team members to solidify needs for each task
Manages overall product development process
Selects or recommends graphics to illustrate documents
Troubleshoots problems
Keeps management informed of status of issues and projects
Applies style and editorial rules and uses electronic editing tools expertly
Implements record-keeping procedures and maintains their documentation
Appropriately utilizes experience, awareness, and sensitivity to develop resources for a variety of cultural audiences
May travel
Qualifications
This unique opportunity provides the excitement of working for a successful, high-growth, mission-driven organization, continuing to grow as a trusted, objective leader in the field of mental health, trauma, and violence prevention. Candidates should have a high knowledge in the areas below as well as the following skills, abilities, and personal characteristics.
Communication: Ability to convey complex ideas through brief, simple materials, and conversations. Experience and credibility when presenting materials to external audiences.
Collaboration: Ability to work both independently without close oversight, but also a team player who will productively engage with others at varying levels of seniority within and outside EDC.
Personal Qualities: A professional who excels in a mission-driven, resource-limited environment. Someone who exhibits flexibility, enthusiasm, responsiveness, aptitude for details, a positive attitude, creativity, strategic and analytical thinking, responds well to feedback, nurtures and exhibits appreciation for a culture of quality improvement, self-motivation, and problem-solving skills, as well as the ability to be proactive, and to produce quality work under tight deadlines in an ever- changing environment.
This position requires educational achievement; excellent writing skills; demonstrable initiative, creativity, and flexibility; ability to work independently and effectively in groups; and strong interpersonal and organizational skills. Specific requirements include:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of training & experience
Master’s degree in public health, mental health, communications, education, or related field preferred
7+ years related writing/editorial management experience, including prior supervisory/project management
Ability to attend to details and adhere to deadlines
Knowledge of word-processing, internet, and database software
Strong creative, interpersonal, networking, and analytical skills
Preferred Experience:
Experience which includes substantial curricula development and writing on public health issues (background in mental health, behavioral health, or trauma issues) preferred
Experience in developing adult learning materials for face-to-face and virtual interactive learning
Experience in developing practical, applicable learning materials (examples will be requested)
Experience in writing peer-reviewed publications (examples will be requested)
Experience in writing grant proposals (examples will be requested)
Excellent writing, editing, and organizational skills
Experience developing learning objectives and paired learning activities for variety of training topics and audiences
Additional Information
Please submit a thoughtful cover letter, resume, and a 5–10-page curricula you developed primarily on your own. The cover letter should be a succinct statement of interest to include highlights of relevant qualifications and experience for the role desired. Candidates selected for an interview may be asked to provide additional writing samples and/or participate in exercises to demonstrate skills and experience. Note: applications without requested items will not be considered.
EDC is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer committed to enhancing the diversity of its workforce and ensuring an equitable and highly inclusive work environment. EDC is a smoke-free workplace, and offers a supportive work environment, competitive salary, and excellent benefits. Women, minorities, individuals with disabilities and veterans are encouraged to apply.

JobTitle: Entry Level Advertising Account Manager Trainee
Text: Paid training, company car, home office, medical, dental, vision, 6% 401K matching, promotion from within...what a great way to start a career in sales!Naked Lime Marketing, a division of Reynolds and Reynolds, is seeking motivated and hard-working Entry Level Advertising Account Manager Trainees to join our growing team. The goal of this position is to prepare you for your own territory as a Sales Professional. Our sales team has been an essential part of Reynolds’ success over the last 150 years. If you are ready to join the exciting and rewarding career path of outside sales, with opportunities for travel, training, unlimited earning potential and growth, this is the ideal opportunity for you!Training: As an Entry Level Advertising Account Manager Trainee, you will enroll in our strategically designed training program that will consist of on-the-job and classroom style training. Throughout our 12 month training program you will shadow seasoned sales representatives as they visit clients and sell our marketing, advertising and digital media solutions. The travel will vary based on your training territory. This field based training will assist in your education of our industry and solutions as well as allow you to observe the sales skills taught in the classroom training. You will also receive world class training on sales techniques, negotiations, dealership operations, and in-depth product training at our Headquarters in Dayton, OH. Throughout the training program, you will complete progress checkpoint assessments to help you identify areas for improvement and to ensure that you are on the right track.Once you complete the training program, you will be relocated to your assigned territory and become a Sales Specialist. Relocation assistance to this new territory will be provided by the company. In this role you will be responsible for achieving designated monthly and annual quotas by selling Naked Lime Marketing solutions and services to new and existing customers. You will perform lead generation, gather competitive intelligence, complete product demonstrations, operation analysis and proposals to customers. You will also participate in team sales presentations, as well as plan and implement sales strategies and programs within your region. As a Sales Professional (and Trainee) you will have a home office and will be provided a company car, laptop, iPhone, and other office equipment.Requirements: Bachelor's degreeAbility to build strong customer relationshipsExcellent oral and written communication skillsSelf-starter with good time management skillsAbility to relocate after training (relocation assistance provided by the company)Benefits: We strive to offer an environment that provides our associates with the right balance between work and family. We offer a comprehensive benefits package including:Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance401(k) with up to 6% matchingCompany car for business and personal useWorking remotely with an iPhone, laptop, and other provided home office equipmentProfessional development and trainingPromotion from withinReferral bonusesAssociate discounts for cell phones, cars, computers, entertainment, and much moreReynolds and Reynolds promotes a healthy lifestyle by providing a non-smoking environment. Reynolds and Reynolds encourages applicants of all ages and experience to apply, as we do not discriminate on the basis of age.Job Type: Full-timePay: $50,000.00 per year

JobTitle: Temporary Research and Public Affairs Associate
Text:
Company Description

Crowell & Moring International LLC (C&M International or CMI) is a global government relations, public policy, and public affairs consulting firm that helps clients shape the international regulatory landscape to support innovation, sustainable growth, and commercial competitiveness. For more than thirty years, C&M International’s team of public policy experts, former trade negotiators, economists, and bio-medical scientists has worked with clients to resolve commercial and trade challenges, clear political hurdles, and shape policies and regulations in key international markets.

Job Description

Job Summary:
C&M International seeks motivated candidates to join as a paid, temporary research and public affairs associate to assist with C&M International’s work on global trade, health, digital transformation and regulatory policy. All work will be remote at this time due to national and regional health considerations, with the potential opportunity to become in-person in the future if and when conditions allow. The position is open to candidates who can work remotely from locations across the U.S. with the ability to work such hours as align with projects and work with East Coast-based colleagues.
Job Responsibilities:
The candidate hired into this position will assume several responsibilities that include:Conducting research on trade, health and other international policies and writing memoranda for clients, internal and external useClosely monitoring developments on international trade, health, digital transformation and other major economic policiesAttending think tank events, Congressional hearings, and industry meetings and producing summary reports for external and internal useTracking key developments and activities among industry, civil society partners and associated firms to assess potential opportunities for public engagementPreparing for and supporting engagements between business executives, top government officials, and civil society leaders in the United States and around the worldDrafting and creating well-written and compelling content for the company’s public engagements, including the company’s social media accounts, newsletters, client alerts and media activity.
Research associates will have opportunities to contribute strategic ideas to global policy and public affairs work at C&M International and are considered an integral part of the C&M International team.

Qualifications

The ideal candidate is ambitious, organized, resourceful, and tenacious in their research and public affairs engagements. The position requires excellent written and oral communication skills, with an understanding of how this is communicated to internal and external audiences.
Candidates must have a track record of strong academic achievement and a demonstrated interest in international trade, health policy, digital, economic policy, public affairs and/or global affairs. Graduate students in related fields are preferred, but applications from accomplished junior and senior undergraduates are also welcomed.
Fluency in written and spoken English is required. Proficiency in additional language(s), such as Mandarin Chinese or Spanish, is a plus.
Instructions for Interested Candidates:
Interested candidates should submit a one-page cover letter, one-page resume, and a 1-2 page writing sample. This position will be filled on a rolling basis.
Additional Information

Crowell & Moring LLP and C&M International offer a competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package which includes progressive options such as back up child care, wellness programs, cultural events and social activities. We take great pride in our positive, friendly culture that rewards hard work and success, at the same time recognizing the importance of family and community service.
EOE m/f/d/v
Crowell & Moring LLP and C&M International participates in the E-Verify program.

JobTitle: Legal Counsel for the Elderly Intern (Summer)
Text:
Business Unit Description

Founded in 1975, Legal Counsel for the Elderly champions the dignity and rights of Washington, D.C. elderly by providing free legal and limited social services to those in need — empowering, defending, and protecting vulnerable seniors. Our interns work directly with clients assisting to resolve their legal issues by helping to ensure they receive benefits to which they are entitled, can age in place in their homes and communities, receive the appropriate level of home health care, receive fair treatment by their landlords, and more. Our interns also work with residents who receive services in long-term care facilities to ensure they receive the highest quality of care.
Summary

Under the supervision of an experienced and licensed attorney, the LCE intern will be exposed to and participate in a variety of legal functions related to the practice of law in an elder law setting for low income older persons.
Interns will complete the internship gaining client interaction skills, subject area knowledge, and a supervised experience in individual client representation and systemic advocacy.
Students interested in issues related to landlord-tenant, economic security, healthcare benefits, long-term care services, homeownership preservation, combatting fraud and financial abuse, and identifying solutions to systemic problems, should apply.
Responsibilities

The intern will engage in a variety of functions, typically including but not limited to the following:
Interviewing current and prospective clients
Meeting clients in the community (at home or in various facilities)
Conducting fact-finding investigations
Drafting correspondence
Performing legal research and writing
Preparing discovery requests
Drafting motions
Aiding in the preparation of court cases
Observing the formulation and implementation of legal strategies
Observing attorneys in court or in administrative proceedings
Following settlement negotiations
Documenting in computerized case management database
Requirements

Prospective intern must be currently enrolled in an accredited law school, classified as a rising 2L, 2L, rising 3L, or 3L; have demonstrated interest in serving the needs of low income 60+ individuals and have a sensitivity to the needs of the elderly.
The ability to speak languages in addition to English is a plus but is not required.
At AARP, the health and well-being of our candidates, employees, and members is a top priority. As a result of the COVID pandemic, all non-essential employees will continue to work remotely through the end of 2020. AARP has established social distancing policies to ensure the safety of our essential employees.
Benefits Offered

Internships are non-exempt positions and are not eligible for employee benefits.
Equal Employment Opportunity

AARP is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. AARP does not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, sex, color, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, mental or physical disability, genetic information, veteran status, or on any other basis prohibited by applicable law.

Are you a member-focused, highly-motivated, proactive individual? Do you enjoy finding solutions to problems and helping others to be successful? Do you thrive in a fast-paced, team-oriented work environment where you can make an impact? Then we want to talk to you!
BIPAC is a membership organization providing technology tools and strategic services to America’s business community to increase their effectiveness in the political arena. We work closely with our corporate and trade association members to assist with their PAC, grassroots advocacy, and voter education programs, providing them with websites and web tools, graphic design, political analysis, best practice information, and strategy to make their programs successful.
We are looking for a self-directed team player to deliver outstanding strategic support and guidance to our member organizations with a primary focus on their Political Action Committee efforts. You will collaborate with a portfolio of company and association members while providing consulting services and technical support to help them leverage their BIPAC membership benefits and create or maintain successful programs. You must have excellent communication, time and project management skills plus the passion to proactively help make our members successful.
The Member Services Manager, PAC uses in-depth knowledge of each member combined with a deep knowledge of the platform and a specific focus on PAC services and strategy in order to increase the success of our members’ PACs. They are also able to discuss and advise on core functionality and features beyond PACs, to help the member organization achieve specific business results and maximum value. This position manages a portfolio of assigned members in addition to serving as the internal PAC resource to all Members and working with Senior staff on assigned projects.
If you excel as a team player, have PAC experience, can strategically identify and implement solutions, have member service experience, an interest in the political process, plus a winning combination of drive, initiative, and desire to impact our corporate mission, we would like to meet you.
This position is eligible for remote work and candidate can be based anywhere in United States. This position reports to the Vice President.
QUALIFICATIONS
2+ years of professional experience required.
PAC experience required.
Excellent communication (written and verbal) skills.
Attention to detail, ability to multi-task and perform under pressure in a fast-paced environment.
Capable of picking up new technical skills quickly and willing to learn new things.
Background or interest in government affairs, national policy issues, and political advocacy desired.
Ability to be proactive and efficiently understand members’ needs.
Proficiency in MS Office Suite.
Organized, self-starter who can work independently as well as interact well in a team environment.
Demonstrated analysis, problem solving, and troubleshooting skills.
Ability to effectively prioritize and escalate member issues as required.
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent.
WE OFFER
BIPAC’s mission sits squarely at the intersection of business and politics. In this role, the Member Services Manager, PAC will have the unique opportunity to advance the mission while building relationships with some of the country’s most prestigious companies and trade associations. We offer a competitive base salary in addition to company benefits such as medical and dental insurance, a day off to volunteer, vacation time, sick leave, 401K matching, and more. We have an excellent team environment with a real opportunity to make a difference within the organization and impact the programs of many business organizations across the country.

Position Title: Commission-Only Sales RepresentativePosition Location: This is a remote position. However the salesperson should reside and make sales inside the United States of America.Position Description & Overview: Chista Systems Corporation is looking for commission-only Sales Representatives to sell its new subscription-based online product called Chister. Chister is a platform that provides Interactive Voice Responsive (IVR) services to medical offices. Sales Representative plays a key role in helping Chista achieve its growth and customer acquisition objectives. This is an opportunity to get started from ground up in a new and growing team.Start Date: Immediately.Compensation: For each new client, the responsible sales representative will receive commission compensation equal to “100% of the sold monthly subscription amount” for the first two months. Sales reps will be compensated upon submission of the new client's payment each month. No other benefit is offered. Sales reps will receive 1099 tax forms at the end of the year.Responsibilities: Qualify new business opportunities via in-person office visit, telephone, email, video call and other possible networking methods.Walk customers through the system, give them full demos as scheduled and help them register.Uncover prospect’s business challenges and relevant Information to improve sales and growth processes at Chista.Qualifications & Requirements: Applicants should reside in the USA.Fluency in English.Great communication skills: verbal and written.Sales experience preferred but not required.Work experience specifically relevant to medical offices preferred.Application Process: Please apply online on this website or submit your resume/CV to contact [at] chistasystems [dot] com. We will contact you within a week or two. Thank you.Job Types: Part-time, ContractPay: $250.00 - $5,000.00 per monthBenefits:Flexible scheduleSupplemental Pay:Commission payContract Length:VariesContract Renewal:LikelyWork Location:Fully RemotePaid Training:NoManagement:Team LeadCompany's website:https://www.chistasystems.com/Benefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview process

Ghost Note Agency is looking for a creative and versatile Graphic Designer to add to our ranks in a full-time capacity. This designer would be immersed into a fun and fast-paced small agency environment and would be asked to perform a wide variety of tasks in service of digital, print, social, interactive and motion projects. This designer would possess the ability to work independently and as part of a team through every step of the creative process from preparation through production. Specifically, this individual would be responsible for creating corporate branding and collateral, data visualization, print and digital publications, social media graphics, marketing materials, experiential and event branding, motion and interactive media, and various other forms of visual storytelling.

If this is you, and you are looking for an openly collaborative environment where you’ll work with talented teammates, inspiring clients, and grow as a creative professional, then join our team!

Responsibilities
Our creative department is responsible for developing client communications and marketing materials to support multi-disciplinary project teams addressing challenges facing tech, public health, non-profits, local government, consumer brands and inclusion-focused projects and initiatives. Creative support will also be needed for internal brand events and initiatives. Our ideal candidate would be asked to:
Execute high quality and timely deliverables, working closely with other graphic designers, digital marketers, project managers and clients
Create and interpret project briefs, conduct client surveys, interviews and research, work on multiple projects concurrently
Add strategic value, thought leadership and insight on matters related to design, visual communications, and digital strategies and solutions for both external clients as well as in-house creative assignments
Requirements

5+ years of graphic design experience
Strong and varied portfolio of proven graphic designing experience, relevant examples would demonstrate strong understanding and experience in:
Commercial advertising materials
Branding development and collateral
Creative optimized for print production
Creative optimized for digital production
Creative optimized for social media production
Ability to interpret and translate marketing and brand messaging into unique creative deliverables
Strong understanding of current industry trends and techniques
Proficiency in core Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Photoshop, and Illustrator)
Proficiency with Microsoft (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) and Mac (Pages and Keynote) Suites
Highly organized in regards to both technical process and practice, as well as project planning

Other Highly Valued Skills & Experience
Strong internal and client-facing presentation skills
Agency experience in a related industry (Advertising, Creative, Marketing, PR, IMC, etc)
Proficiency in extended Adobe Creative Suite (XD, After Effects, Premiere Pro, etc.)
Experience in motion-based graphics, custom animation, illustration, or 3D rendering
Experience in photography and/or videography (shooting as well as editing)
Base knowledge in web development languages such as HTML, CSS, XHTML, Wordpress, and Javascript
Experience with digital marketing platforms, such as Constant Contact, MailChimp and social media
Relevant skillset certificates or credentials
Benefits
Gold level healthcare including dental and vision
Fully-remote work environment for the foreseeable future until resolution of COVID-19 Pandemic
A fast-paced, creative and collaborative environment with supportive leadership
A culture that values inclusion, ideas and innovation from everyone at every level
On-going professional development and training opportunities

About Ghost Note
Ghost Note's vibrant studio space is the historic Capitol Hill corridor area of Washington, D.C. We have been in business since 2011. Over that time, we have grown into one of the Region's fastest emerging agencies and currently boasts a client portfolio including Google, Nissan, American Cancer Society, The Robert Wood Johnson Foundation, and South By Southwest. We are a team of dynamic strategists, creatives and developers. Our culture is multicultural, fast-paced, inspired and fun. We’re seeking people more interested in joining a fast growing team than a holding company. People who have a voice and want to be a part of building a great agency. If that’s you, we hope to hear from you.

Duties
Summary
This position will report to the Case Management/Electronic Case Files (CM/ECF) Division Chief under the Case Management Systems Office (CMSO) and provide architectural support for all assigned Division applications.
Responsibilities
The CM/ECF Solutions Architect supports the CM/ECF Division in CMSO by providing leadership and architectural direction to a Division's portfolio of products supported within the office. This position will focus on the required architecture and technical roadmap to help the Division's suite of products. The Architect will be responsible for establishing and implementing the architectural standards, policies, and procedures for all the Division's applications and will work with other Architects and stakeholders. This position is also responsible for researching new technologies, products, and standards incorporated into the CM/ECF suite of applications. The current technical environment includes Informix, Microsoft SQL, .Net, Java, Perl, cloud infrastructure, and mobile and web technologies. This is a hands-on position and may require interactions with courts, court support teams, development and internal teams, and administrative staff from both a technical and business perspective.

The duties of the position may include, but are not limited to:

Determining the system architecture to be used for each application with consideration given to such things as centralized versus decentralized servers, use of service-oriented architecture (SOA), designing nonfunctional elements of each system, e.g., response time, system availability, backup requirements, and interface needs; and performing research into new technologies, products, and standards which can be incorporated into CMSO applications.
Assessing and meeting the security standards of each application as defined by the IT Security Office.
Defining, implementing, documenting, and maintaining the solutions architecture roadmap, designs, procedures, standards, and metrics; and ensuring compliance and conformity of software architecture and technology standards.
Defining, implementing, documenting, and maintaining the framework for system architecture design, software design and development, IT security, and performance testing platforms.
Improving, continually, the solutions architecture process or code development efficiency through effective leadership, individual and group training, and process improvement.
Working closely with other architects to ensure system design follows the industry best practices and standards that align with the Judiciary framework.
Providing regular status updates to senior management and in related status meetings through reports, dashboards, and presentations.

00

All information is subject to verification. Applicants are advised that false answers or omissions of information on application materials or inability to meet the following conditions may be grounds for non-selection, withdrawal of an offer of employment, or dismissal after being employed.
Selection for this position is contingent upon completion of OF-306, Declaration of Federal Employment during the pre-employment process and proof of U.S. citizenship for competitive status positions or conversion to a competitive status position with the Administrative Office of the US Courts. In instances where non-citizens are considered for hire into temporary or any other position with non competitive status or when it is confirmed by the AO's Human Resources Office that there are no qualified U.S. citizens for a competitive status position (unless prohibited by a law or statue), non-citizens must provide proof of authorization to work in the United States and proof of entitlement to receive compensation. Additional information on the employment of non-citizens can be found at http://ww.usajobs.gov/Help/working-in-government/non-citizens. For a list of documents that may be used to provide proof of citizenship or authorization to work in the United States, please refer to Form I-9, Employment Eligibility Verification.
All new AO employees will be required to complete a FBI fingerprint-based national criminal database and records check and pass a public trust suitability check.
All new AO employees must identify a financial institution for direct deposit of pay before appointment.
You will be required to serve a trial period if selected for a first-time appointment to the Federal government, transferring from another Federal agency, or serving as a first-time supervisor. Failure to successfully complete the trial period may result in termination of employment.
If appointed to a temporary position, management may have the discretion of converting the position to permanent depending upon funding and staffing allocation.
Relocation expenses may be provided, but only if authorized by the Director of the AO.

Qualifications
Applicants must have demonstrated experience as listed below. This requirement is according to the AO Classification, Compensation, and Recruitment Systems which include interpretive guidance and reference to the OPM Operating Manual for Qualification Standards for General Schedule Positions.

Specialized Experience: Applicants must have at least one year (52 weeks) of specialized experience which is in or directly related to the line of work of this position. Specialized experience is demonstrated expert level experience implementing software application architecture; leveraging cloud services; and defining and enforcing architecture and best practices for large scale, high volume web-based, and mobile applications.

Education

The AO is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

You will be evaluated for this job based on how well you meet the qualifications above.
We will review your resume and supporting documentation and compare this information to your responses on the occupational questionnaire to determine if you meet the minimum qualifications for this job. If you meet the minimum qualifications for this job, we will evaluate your application package, to assess the quality, depth, and complexity of your accomplishments, experience, and education as they relate to the requirements listed in this vacancy announcement.

You should be aware that your ratings are subject to evaluation and verification. If a determination is made that you have rated yourself higher than is supported by your resume and/or narrative responses, you will be assigned a rating commensurate to your described experience. Failure to submit the mandatory narrative responses will result in not receiving full consideration and/or rating credit. Deliberate attempts to falsify information may be grounds for not selecting you, withdrawing an offer of employment, or dismissal after being employed.

Position Description:

Acquisition Management Specialist
Serco has a great opportunity for you to begin or advance a career supporting U.S. Navy acquisition programs for cutting edge systems and sensors for our ships and sailors! Join an integrated government-industry team in and around the historic Washington Navy Yard right by Nationals Stadium, but primarily remote during this time of max telework. Become a part of U.S. Navy acquisition while building your professional background and expertise in support of the world’s greatest Navy.
Serco will provide technical support to its customer, a defense acquisition program management office which is responsible for the development, acquisition, production, fielding, and lifetime support of critical Navy systems. This entry-to-associate-level position will help you hone your skills in program, contract, and financial management, and other related defense acquisition skills in a professional office environment.
Responsibilities
In this role you will:
Develop an understanding of the principles of defense acquisition program management and work in a team in applying your energy and enthusiasm to assigned programs throughout their life cycles.
Research written defense acquisition instructions and processes and apply what you've learned to solve problems and complete tasking.
Work in a collaborative, professional environment together with staff from the program office, other contractors, system developer/manufacturer, and the government/industry technical team. Work under the guidance and mentorship of an experienced supervisor.
Support program office tasking related to acquiring Naval systems.
Assist with the management of plans and schedules related to system acquisition. Support the government and contractor team in performing tasks such as arranging and participating in meetings or program reviews including preparing meeting agendas/minutes/actions, preparing presentations, developing spreadsheets, tracking action items, and assisting with collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
Assist in collecting, displaying, and interpreting program-related data/metrics.
Gain additional responsibility and independent tasking as you grow in knowledge and experience.
Perform additional duties and responsibilities as assigned.
Qualifications:

Qualifications, Education and Experience
To be successful in this role, you will have:
Bachelor's Degree or Associates Degree plus 2 years' experience.
Well-developed team communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite programs, MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Must be a U.S. Citizen
A security clearance or the ability to obtain a security clearance.
Additional desired experience and skills:
Previous government program office or a strong internship is desired but no previous experience with Navy systems is required.
Degree requirements may be adjusted based on additional related experience, highly specialized knowledge, or uniquely applicable experience.
Experience in collaboration tools such as SharePoint is desired.
Enthusiasm and a willingness to learn and take on responsibility
Secret Security Clearance at time of application is preferred but not required.
Take this opportunity to join a high-performing team, get your career off to a great start, and make a real difference supporting America’s Navy. Join the Serco team today!
Company Overview: Serco Inc. (Serco) is the Americas division of Serco Group, plc. Serco serves every branch of the U.S. military, numerous U.S. Federal civilian agencies, the Intelligence Community, the Canadian government, state and local governments, and commercial clients. We help our clients deliver vital services more efficiently while increasing the satisfaction of their end customers. Headquartered in Herndon, Virginia, Serco Americas has approximately 8,000 employees and is part of a $4 billion global business that helps transform government and public services around the world. At Serco, our employees are our most valuable asset - we listen, respect and support them throughout their career at Serco. We invite you to become part of our dynamic team. Serco is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversifying our workforce (Race/ Color/ Sex/ Sexual Orientation/ Gender Identity/ Religion/ National Origin/ Disability/ Vets).

JobTitle: Accounts Payable Accounting Technician – Non-Expert Invoices
Text:
Description
Job Description:
Leidos is a Fortune 500™ company aimed at embracing and solving some of the world’s most pressing challenges. Through science and technology, Leidos makes the world safer, healthier and more efficient.
Leidos is looking for a highly-motivated, first-class Accounts Payable Accounting Technician to process non-expert invoices in support the Finance Department of our client, the Environment and Natural Resources Division (ENRD) of the U.S. Department of Justice at 150 M Street NE, Washington, DC. Join our team and be a valued part of ENRD's mission to enforce civil and criminal environmental laws and programs protecting the health and environment of the United States, and to defend suits challenging those laws and programs.
In this role, you will gain many intangible skills, such as time and task management, critical thinking and problem solving, the ability to communicate complicated problems in a concise manner with internal and external colleagues of all levels, as well as solve complex problems using your accounting skills and available technological tools. If you are well-organized, proficient with Excel, able to work under tight deadlines, have a good understanding of financial, accounting, and/or banking principles coupled with good customer service skills, and thrive in a fast-paced and diverse environment, this job is for you!
Primary Responsibilities:
In general, the Accounting Technician reviews and analyzes financial data, documents and manual or automated accounting systems relating to employee travel reimbursements, including the following duties:
Review and analyze reimbursable documents.
Process accounts payable invoices.
Prepare and review daily verification reports.
Process receipts checks.
Process debt collection checks.
Scanning and uploading documents.
Maintaining and inputting data into excel spreadsheets.
Answer invoice inquiries.
Compile documents for requests from auditors or on cases.
Respond to emails and performing customer service functions.
Troubleshoot and correct system errors relating to reimbursable documents.
Please Note: Must be able to work onsite 5 days a week in Washington, DC (once temporary Pandemic Remote work is over OR when asked to return in the office).
Basic Qualifications:
Two-year degree in accounting or four-year degree in a related field (finance, business, banking, or economics) with 30 credit hours in accounting. (With the COR’s approval, relevant financial and accounting experience performing technical level duties in accounting, banking, or finance for corporations or non-profit organizations may be substituted for the education and credit requirements.)
Knowledge of manual and automated accounting systems used by banking, financial and other institutions.
Proficiency in Excel.
Excellent oral and written communications skills.
Must be a U.S. citizen.
Must be able to obtain a Public Trust clearance.
Preferred Qualifications:
Suggested skills that would be helpful for this position:UFMS experience, highly preferred.Experience in banks and banking, highly preferred.Excel proficiency with skills to include various formatting, sorting, and correction of data, and table manipulations, such as:
Table array
Sum function
Max min function
Vlookup
Trim
Pivot table
Arithmetical formulasCurrent or active clearance, preferred
Leidos is growing! Connect with us on LinkedIn and Facebook.
We value and support the well-being and mobility of our employees with competitive benefit packages, complementary e-learning training, work-life flexibility, an exciting External Referral Program, and a diverse, inclusive and ethical work place. In fact, in 2020, Leidos was ranked as one of the “World's Most Ethical Companies” by the Ethisphere Institute for the third consecutive year.

Ineligible

No

Leidos is a Fortune 500® information technology, engineering, and science solutions and services leader working to solve the world’s toughest challenges in the defense, intelligence, homeland security, civil, and health markets. The company’s 38,000 employees support vital missions for government and commercial customers. Headquartered in Reston, Va., Leidos reported annual revenues of approximately $11.09 billion for the fiscal year ended January 3, 2020. For more information, visit www.Leidos.com.
Pay and benefits are fundamental to any career decision. That's why we craft compensation packages that reflect the importance of the work we do for our customers. Employment benefits include competitive compensation, Health and Wellness programs, Income Protection, Paid Leave and Retirement. More details are available here.
Leidos will never ask you to provide payment-related information at any part of the employment application process. And Leidos will communicate with you only through emails that are sent from a Leidos.com email address. If you receive an email purporting to be from Leidos that asks for payment-related information or any other personal information, please report the email to spam.leidos@leidos.com.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, ethnicity, age, national origin, citizenship, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy, family structure, marital status, ancestry, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law. Leidos will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with relevant laws.

Text: Our 5 doctor small animal clinic located in the beautiful Dupont Circle neighborhood of Washington, DC is looking for a full-time receptionist. You would join a team of 25 full-time employees, many who have been with our company for over 10 years. Our front desk team, support staff, and doctors work closely together and enjoy a fun, respectful working environment where every voice is valued. All of our employees are integral to the growth and success of our business. We are looking for candidates who are creative, independent, big picture thinkers.Duties include scheduling appointments, answering phones, processing invoices, maintaining patient records, and general office work. Ideal candidates will have experience working in a fast-paced environment and will be able to provide excellent customer service. You must be able to work as part of a team. We prefer candidates with a love of animals or an interest in the veterinary field.Schedule would vary based on availability. Weekday hours many vary based on candidates availability. AM shift is typically 7am-3pm. Evening shift is Noon-8pm (10am-6pm on Friday) Every Saturday 9am-4pm would be required.Benefits include medical, dental and vision insurance, paid vacation and holidays, monthly metro benefit and discount on veterinary services and pet products.We are looking for a candidate who either has 1 years of veterinary reception experience or whose education include courses in veterinary medicine (animal science major). Experience with Cornerstone is preferred. Some remote work is possible, but candidate must live within driving distance of our clinic.All employees will be required to have the covid-19 vaccine administered within 90 days of their employment date.Please reply to this listing with your resume and cover letter.
