Overview:

GovernmentCIO is looking for an experienced Agile/SAFe Coach and SAFe Program Consultant to join our Agile Transformation team at the Department of Veteran Affairs. This is a highly challenging role focused on business process reengineering, gap analysis, process improvement, and most importantly, defining SOPs that work for our clients and their partners. The individual must have a proven track record of training and transforming teams and programs to fully implement Agile (Scrum or SAFe).
The day to day role will be dynamic, addressing multiple customer priorities. The overall focus will be on leading transformation of software product delivery practices by coaching Program teams in Agile methods. This candidate will work as a lead coach and in a supervisory role, so experience managing teams of professionals is a plus.
The ideal candidate will have experience at the Department of Veterans Affairs as well as experience leading Agile Transformation at a large enterprise. Experience delivering Scrum Master and Leading SAFe courses is also desirable.
Responsibilities:
Work with GCIO team, Federal Client and partner contractors to develop plan to implement Agile practices at the Portfolio, Program and Team levels.
Assess Programs and Projects to determine their level of Agile maturity and use the data to tailor a training plan.
Provide mentoring and training for GCIO team members and Federal customers.
Oversee one or more teams of coaches to ensure they are effectively mentoring their assigned teams.
Interact directly with mid-and senior-level Federal executives to gain understanding of their needs and develop service delivery plans.
Coach Scrum and Agile Release Train teams on Agile fundamentals. Help them implement Agile ceremonies, identify the roles, manage the respective artifacts and realize the potential of Agile Delivery. Coach teams in practices that deliver value through increased speed, better quality, and greater team engagement.
Facilitate Sprint Planning, Backlog Grooming, Sprint Reviews, Sprint Retrospectives and other Scrum ceremonies; Create and manage artifacts; and identify, implement, and track metrics.
Identify stakeholders and change agents and get their buy-in for recommended changes.
Communicate projects’ transformation progress via weekly updates to management highlighting successes, risks, areas of improvement, and suggested resolutions
Act as a thought leader in the Agile space and contribute to whitepapers, magazine articles, proposal writing, and authoring any similar literature that further our mission
Prepare and deliver presentations and training materials for Federal, contractor, and company teams.
Qualifications:
At least 4 years of experience working in a software development shop as either a PM, BA, Developer, Tester, DBA, or System Administrator
Minimum 4 years working in a pure Agile environment (Scrum, Kanban, SAFe, DevOps), with at least 2 years of actively coaching and transitioning teams, programs, and portfolios
The individual must hold at least one Agile certification. This includes PMI Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP), Certified Scrum Master (CSM), Certified Scrum Professional (CSP), SAFe Agilist (SA), or SAFe Program Consultant.
Experience working with at least one the following Agile tools: IBM Rational (RM, CM, QM), ServiceNow Agile, CA Rally, JIRA or TFS, ALM, or VerionOne
Experience with providing presentations to virtual and in person teams with an emphasis on remotely-delivered presentations
Proven leadership experience in IT delivery, building and sustaining high performing teams
An effective communicator skilled in conflict resolution - exceptional soft skills are essential
Bachelor’s degree required
Preferred:
Experience working for the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA)
SAFe Program Consultant (SPC) certified
Experience in management consulting at a large firm
DevOps certified with at least 2 years of experience implementing the methodology
Master’s Degree (MIS or MBA)
#LI- Remote

JobTitle: Managing Editor, Implementation Success (IS) Content, Humanities
Text:
Managing Editor, Implementation Success (IS) Content, Humanities Job description
Great Minds, a mission driven Public Benefit Corporation, brings teachers and scholars together to craft exemplary instructional materials that inspire joy in teaching and learning. Our English curriculum, Wit & Wisdom; Eureka Math; and PhD Science all support teachers as they take students beyond rote learning to provide a deeper, more complete understanding of the humanities, mathematics, and the sciences. Founded in 2007, Great Minds now employs more than 1000 people.
For additional information please visit: www.greatminds.org

Our Market Position
Great Minds' Eureka Math is the most widely used curriculum in the history of American education. It enjoys an unrivaled 40+ net promoter score. Eureka and its sister products, Wit & Wisdom and PhD Science, embrace much higher expectations for all students and all teachers. In a market dominated by scripted, procedural materials that drive expectations down, Great Minds produces curricula that celebrate knowledge, respect the craft of teaching, and acknowledge the true capabilities of students.

Position Summary
The Managing Editor, Implementation Success (IS) Content, plays a critical role in creating excellent content and providing proactive and effective management for the Humanities IS content development team.
Through exceptional professionalism and communication, the Managing Editor will support the National Director, IS Content, in guiding products through the Great Minds product life cycle and driving work forward. The Managing Editor will also contribute to the creation and maintenance of team guidelines and resources, coordinate team scheduling and meetings, and facilitate cross-team communications and collaboration.

This is a unique opportunity for a skilled manager and writer to implement and contribute to Great Minds' organizational mission to create resources that ensure all students have access to a quality education in the full range of liberal arts and sciences.

This role is a remote position. Future travel may be required to participate in team meetings, to lead or observe professional development in the field, and to visit schools implementing Wit & Wisdom and Geodes.
Reports To: National Director, Implementation Success Content, Humanities

Core Responsibilities
The duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:
Team Management
Collaborate with the National Director, IS Content, on the development of team communications, resources, schedules, and work plans with a proactive, problem-solving approach
Work in partnership with project management team on the execution of solutions-oriented internal team and cross-team systems
Provide support and feedback to content developers that exemplifies Great Minds high expectations for quality
Maintain ongoing communication with Wit & Wisdom curriculum developers, project managers, and other Humanities team leaders to facilitate product development, identify and address issues, and provide support and guidance
Exemplify Great Minds culture in all work environments, with an emphasis on trust, collegiality, continuous improvement, and quality
Project Execution
Develop and maintain processes, tools, and strategies for the development and execution of content projects
Ensure and adhere to a task- and deadline-driven work-flow by completing the appropriate scope and sequence of work within the timeline required at each phase
Conduct research in support of professional learning content development
Problem solve to create high-quality products by established deadlines
Represent the IS content development team in communications with internal and external stakeholders with professionalism and proficiency
Content Development
Create and update relevant IS collateral used by various internal and external stakeholders
Embrace and exemplify a mindset that values an iterative cycle of ideation, thought partnering, prototyping, drafting, development, review, and revision
Execute the vision of Great Minds' content development strategic plan by contributing to conceptualizing, writing, and editing coherent, knowledge-rich professional learning content
Collaborate with National Director, IS Content and other team leaders to align vision and expectations for projects
Collaborate within and across teams to develop, launch, and implement professional learning and curriculum-support resources
Relevant Experience
Minimum of 3-5 years of experience as a classroom teacher or educator
Demonstrated experience managing and/or leading teams
Experience implementing a high-quality, knowledge building ELA curriculum like Wit & Wisdom
Substantial understanding of and experience with the implementation of the Common Core State Standards
Experience developing or implementing professional learning at the school, district, network, or national level
Experience leading professional development utilizing a knowledge-rich curriculum at the district, network, or national level
Requirements
Strong organizational habits necessary for successful goal setting, project management, collective decision making, deadline execution, and record keeping
Demonstrated aptitude in preparing agendas that advance the appropriate priorities, serve the needs of various stakeholders, adhere to established meeting norms, orient the group toward decision making, and clearly record next steps
Clear and succinct writing and editing skills, with the ability to produce content aligned to the organizational and product vision
Capacity to balance a variety of tasks, responsibilities, and projects with multiple deadlines
Facility working with tools required within digital spaces (e.g. Google Suite)
Proficiency with or alignment to Wit & Wisdom's instructional design and pedagogy
Ability to make solutions-oriented decisions through flexible thinking in an ambiguous, fast-paced entrepreneurial environment
Proficiency at both working independently and collaborating as part of a team
Ideal Attributes
Deep content knowledge in English Language Arts, Literature, or associated content area
Familiarity with a mindset that values an iterative cycle of ideation, including thought partnering, prototyping, drafting, development, review, and revision
Passion for and commitment to the importance of high-quality, knowledge-rich curriculum
Commitment to high standards, instructional quality, and continuous improvement
Self-starter and quick learner who is comfortable and productive when working remotely
Appreciation for the challenges and victories faced everyday by classroom teachers
Empathy, curiosity, and the desire to continually grow as a learner
Positivity in all situations, bringing proactive problem-solving orientation to every task
Receptivity to multiple viewpoints and feedback with a focus on reflective practice
Commitment to collective authorship
Deep belief that every child is capable of greatness
A cover letter and resume are required to be considered for this position.
If selected for an interview, a salary history and background check will be required.

Great Minds is an equal opportunity employer. We will extend equal opportunity to all individuals without regard to race, religion, color, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity), national origin, disability, age, genetic information, or any other status protected under applicable federal, state, or local laws. Our policy reflects and affirms the organization's commitment to the principles of fair employment and the elimination of all discriminatory practices.
Apply for this Job

XJ6

OPPORTUNITY OVERVIEW
ZeroFOX seeks a Strategic Account Manager to create long-term, trusting relationships with our customers in the United States Federal government, predominantly in the Civilian Sector Sector. The Strategic Account Manager’s role is to oversee a portfolio of assigned customers and develop new business from existing clients. The Strategic Account Manager will work collaboratively with new sales to meet revenue goals and report directly to the Vice President, North America Sales. Travel in the National Capital region may be required 20-30% of the time and the Strategic Account Manager will work out of a home office with support centers in Baltimore, MD and Reston, VA.
Role & Responsibilities
Responsible for renewals and upsales of ZeroFOX solutions to achieve target revenue.
Develop a solid and trusting relationship between clients and company
Coordinate the resolution of key client issues and complaints by leveraging the correct internal resources
Develop a complete understanding of account needs
Anticipate account changes and improvements
Manage communications between clients and internal teams
Strategically plan to improve client results
Collaborate with sales team to maximize profit by up-selling existing solutions and cross-selling new ones to solve customer business problems
Plan and present reports on account progress, goals, and monthly and quarterly initiatives to share with team members, stakeholders, and use in future case studies or company training
Meet all client needs and deliverables according to proposed timelines
Analyze client data to provide customer relationship management
Expand relationships and collaborating with sales representative to evangelize ZeroFOX within account
Act as a liaison between customer and internal business units to manage customer needs
Requirements and Qualifications
Technology sales/account management experience (cyber security preferred), typically obtained in 5+ years
Experience managing and/or selling to enterprise-level United States Government clients, typically obtained in 10+ years
Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time efficiently
Goal-orientation, organization, and collaboration with cross-functional teams
Self-motivation and self-direction
Excellent interpersonal relationship skills
In-depth understanding of clients and their position in the industry
Eagerness to work with new sales to expand company, clients, and territories
Excellent verbal and written communication skills; must be a listener, a presenter, and a people-person
Basic computer skills, and experience with CRM software (Salesforce.com preferred) and the Microsoft Office Suite
Do you want to love where you work?
Amazing Product: ZeroFOX is creating paradigm shifting cyber security product
Recently raised a $74 million Series D led by Intel Capital, and joined by some of the most respected VCs in the country, like NEA and Redline Capital.
Bragging Rights: Named the #1 startup in Baltimore and #2 startup in Maryland by the Tech Tribune
Awesome Culture: ZeroFOX is a community – most describe our team as a group of close-knit, incredibly talented, and highly caffeinated people. Behind ZeroFOX’s numerous accolades lies a vibrant ecosystem where team members have fun and are rewarded for continual innovation, disruption, and taking ownership in their work.
Get Things Done: Innovation is woven into the fabric of our organization. Every aspect of our operations is purposeful; enabling us to research, develop and innovate faster than the competition.
Benefits: In addition to competitive compensation, full-time employees can participate in our health insurance plans, retirement, and more.
Interested?
Ready to apply? Visit us at https://www.zerofox.com/careers to find out more and join the best team in the security industry.
Not ready to apply? Email careers_at_zerofox_dot_com to speak with a member of the team!
ABOUT ZEROFOX
ZeroFOX, the market leader in digital visibility and protection, safeguards modern organizations from dynamic security, brand and physical risks across social, mobile, web and collaboration platforms. Using diverse data sources and artificial intelligence-based analysis, the ZeroFOX Platform identifies and remediates targeted phishing attacks, credential compromise, data exfiltration, brand hijacking, executive and location threats and more. The patented ZeroFOX SaaS technology processes and protects millions of posts, messages and accounts daily across the social and digital landscape, spanning LinkedIn, Facebook, Slack, Twitter, Instagram, Pastebin, YouTube, mobile app stores, the deep & dark web, domains and more.
**ZeroFOX is an Equal Opportunity Employer and participates in e-Verify**

SSI is providing relocation assistance for this position and a $1,000 Signing BonusSSI is seeking an Interface Analyst who will support the Navy ERP Government Interface Lead by assisting with Interface Control Agreements and Interface Standard Operating Procedures. The successful candidate will also assist with tracking of all agreements and changes to interfaces; and ensure processes/procedures are followed in accordance with Federal Information System Controls Audit Manual (FISCAM) audits and Purchase Request Data Standard (PRDS), Procurement Data Standard (PDS), and Standard Financial Information Structure (SFIS) data standards.DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: · Review, update, and maintain existing and new Interface Control Agreements· Prepare interface presentations, reports, plans and briefs (as needed)· Develop and maintain Interface Standard Operating Procedure documents· Monitor interfaces for data errors and make recommendations for error handling solutions· Review data against data standards (PRDS, PDS, and SFIS)REQUIRED SKILLS, QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE: · Bachelor’s degree in Engineering (Computer, Electrical, Mechanical, etc.), Physical Sciences, Computer Sciences, Information Systems, Information Technology, Operations Research, Mathematics, Physics· At least 7 years of progressive experience in IT technical analysis and support for DoD/DON acquisition programs. This experience must include one or more technology areas:o Engineering analyses and recommendationso IT system analysiso Strategic technical planningo Project problem resolution and improvemento Critical analysis of IT program options and variableso Risk analysis and mitigation planningo Technical interaction/coordination with multiple Government entities and vendors· SAP ERP and API knowledge.· Strong written and verbal communication skills· Strong critical analysis skills, and fully capable of using the MS Office suite· Must posses an active Secret Clearance.Job Type: Full-timePay: From $105,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceDisability insuranceHealth insuranceLife insurancePaid time offProfessional development assistanceReferral programRelocation assistanceRetirement planTuition reimbursementVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftSupplemental Pay:Signing bonusWork Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview process

Company: Gallaudet University Hearing and Speech Clinic
Text:
SUMMARY:

Reporting to the Director of Financial Aid, the Technical Operations Specialist takes the lead on technology-related operational projects within the Financial Aid Office including onboarding and maintaining internal and third-party software, managing financial aid student communication workflows, and creating content for the financial aid website and social media platforms; and responsible for counseling and advising students and families on all facets of financial aid and must exercise a high degree of responsibility and independence in accomplishing activities involving students, parents, and federal regulatory personnel.

The Technical Support Specialist will value collaboration and open communication, be a cooperative and supportive team member, have a student-centered approach to their work, and be able to work independently and remotely as necessary.
PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES:
Onboards, coordinates, and maintains internal and third party software systems including but not limited to scheduling software, scholarship leveraging software, document imaging software, workflow ticketing systems, content management system software, project management software, PeopleSoft Financial Aid module, etc.; and provides necessary training and support to the Financial Aid Office and other external and Gallaudet constituents as needed.
Sets up and manages student communication workflows in PeopleSoft including award letter notifications, missing information requests, and general financial aid related communications.
Updates and maintains Financial Aid website and social media platforms.
Provides financial aid counseling to students and families via multiple platforms such as video and/or voice phone, video conferencing, email, and third-party software platforms.
Monitors individual student awards and resolves data conflicts and over awards; assists with award packaging for undergraduate and graduate students as needed.
Collaborates with Director and fellow financial aid team members to develop educational materials related to financial aid programs for workshops, presentations, and other venues; maintains ongoing knowledge of changes in financial aid programs and processes for incorporation into presentations and related materials; and designs and implements assessment materials for use with presentations; and analyzes and reports on assessment outcomes.
Has primary responsibility for managing area(s) of financial aid specialty including, but not limited to: State Grants, Federal Workstudy, Federal Grant Administration and Reconciliation, Federal Direct Loan Administration and Reconciliation, Private Loan Administration and Reconciliation, Verification and Conflicting Information, Private Scholarships, Institutional Scholarships and Grants, Satisfactory Academic Progress, Veterans Benefits, or Vocational Rehabilitation; and trains Financial Aid Office members on area(s) of specialty (Area(s) of specialty will be determined by the Director based on the operational needs of the office.).
Provides assistance to the Director and Assistant Director, as needed and assigned.
Assists with the compliance of all federal mandates, regulations, and updates related to the particular functions of this position; and participates in on-line training opportunities, webinars, conferences, and other activities designed to provide continuing education in financial aid administration.

Serves as a mandatory Title IX reporter; and takes annual Title IX training as part of the compliance effort.
Shows a genuine commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace; and participates in activities and workshops to foster continuous learning.
Serves as a mandatory Title IX reporter; and takes annual Title IX training as part of the compliance effort.
Establishes and maintains a positive and supportive working relationship with co-workers and supervisor.
Performs other related duties, as assigned.
SPECIFICATIONS:
Required Minimum Qualifications (When the candidate’s resume meets these qualifications, it will be screened in.):
Bachelor's degree.
A minimum two years of experience in a student-centered office such as financial aid, billing/bursar/student accounts, registrar, academic advising, career services, residence life, veterans benefits administration, vocational rehabilitation, etc.
Paraprofessional experience and/or internship experience will be considered (pro-rated).
Fluency in American Sign Language.
Preferred Qualifications (While not required, it is an advantage for what the position needs.):
A minimum two years of recent professional experience in financial aid.
Previous experience using PeopleSoft Financial Aid module or other financial aid management systems
Previous experience with federal student aid databases such as COD, CPS, NSLDS, etc.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (Qualities that will help the incumbent be more successful in the position.):
Knowledge of federal regulations governing financial aid programs.
A thorough knowledge of financial aid principles, policies, and procedures will be expected through recent financial aid experience and /or successful completion of appropriate training.
Demonstrated proficiency using current technology including email, cloud-based software applications, and social media.
Excellent writing skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively as a part of a team and independently with minimal supervision.
Demonstrated proficiency using current technology and cloud-based software including, but not limited to, Google’s G Suite, video conferencing software, and social media platforms.
Commitment to ensuring and maintaining student data privacy.
A written assessment test will be conducted as a part of the interview process.

The incumbent will be required to successfully complete a comprehensive financial aid training program within the probationary period (6 months). Training program to be selected by the Director. Requirement may be waived or modified if the Director deems previous financial aid experience is equivalent to two recent years of professional financial aid experience.
COMPENSATION:

Level: 7
Salary: Commensurate with experience and qualifications.
FLSA: Exempt
The successful candidate will undergo a background check that must be cleared prior to working at Gallaudet University.

Gallaudet University is an equal opportunity employer/educational institution and does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, national origin, religion, age, hearing status, disability, genetic information, covered veteran status, marital status, personal appearance, sexual orientation, family responsibilities, matriculation, political affiliation, source of income, place of business or residence, pregnancy, childbirth, or any other unlawful basis. This policy is in compliance with Title VII of the Civil Rights Act, the Americans with Disabilities Act, the Rehabilitation Act, the Age Discrimination in Employment Act, the District of Columbia Human Rights Act, and other applicable laws and applies to all procedures affecting applicants and employees including, but not necessarily limited to: recruitment, hiring, placement, promotion, transfer, reassignment, reappointment, tenure, demotion, selection for training, layoff, furlough, and termination, compensation, and all other conditions or privileges of employment.

Reach Your Peak with ICMA-RC, a FINANCIAL SERVICES LEADER in public sector employee retirement products and services. Headquartered in Washington, DC, our Financial Services corporation administers over $50 billion in retirement plan assets for more than one million participant accounts. We are constantly looking for ways to create new opportunities to serve our participants. We have an extraordinary talent base and invite you to consider joining ICMA-RC's Institutional Sales Team.
The Internal Wholesaler is responsible for developing and maintaining existing relationships as well as identifying and acquiring new business within their territory to meet sales goals. The internal wholesaler will support an experienced field team of sales professionals with the institutional sales area and be a liaison to the field sales teams.
Please note: This is a full-time telecommuter (remote) position.
Essential functions for this role include:
Advisor/Consultant Relations
Partner with territory VPs to develop a business plan, manage a territory, and drive to regional goals and objectives. Follow-up after key meetings and events
Provide information and analysis for active prospect situations, help qualify leads and convert them to sales
Make proactive telephone calls to an assigned territory; Answer and convert inbound calls from the territory into additional opportunities to drive sales
Conduct relations-building and consultative sales calls through outreach to key advisors and consultants. Build and maintain relationships with internal and external business partners
Conduct competitive evaluation within product line-ups and maintain key competitive information
Analyze reports to increase understanding of DC business and identify sales trends; leverage the information to prepare for outbound sales calls. Research and communicate industry changes and trends that may impact company or product positioning, with both internal and external customers
Demonstrate an understanding of the product portfolio features and benefits; Sells solutions provided by the products
Develop and tailor sales concepts and presentations on basis of prospect/client needs and profile
Prioritize and manage daily, weekly, and monthly workload
Travel to territory to conduct one-on-one DC meetings and/or to deliver group presentations
Lead sales opportunities re-actively in the territory for $5m and below
Strategy and Prospecting
Work with externals to develop territory strategy and coverage plan
Work with externals to develop sales ideas and campaigns
Create data mining campaign to target key prospects
Be a leading user of salesforce in documenting and executing on activity and sales leads
Internal Relations and Effectiveness
Develop and maintain great internal relationships so that you can effectively leverage other departments to obtain data, material and resources as the sales team needs them
Build and maintain an exceptional working relationship with the external sales team
Proven ability to build strong relationships
If you have the following credentials, we encourage you to apply:
2-3 years of experience in financial services industry, financial sales or financial wholesaling
Knowledge of investment management or financial industry
Demonstrates high level of time management, organizational skills, and attention to detail with integrity and ownership of work
Team player with strong interpersonal communication and sales skills that can thrive in a collaborative sales environment
Ability to work independently and in a team environment
Proficient with Word, Excel and PowerPoint
Internal Wholesaler experience a plus
For your well-being, we offer a solid compensation and benefits package that features a competitive salary, a straight-forward incentive plan that rewards results, and a 401(k) Plan. For your career, we offer tuition reimbursement, professional development courses, seminars, career enrichment assignments, mentoring programs and a record of enterprise growth that creates continuing opportunities for career advancement. Consider ICMA-RC, and respond in strictest confidence. ICMA-RC is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values diversity in the workplace. Minorities and women are encouraged to apply. We look forward to hearing from you.
Education
Preferred
Bachelor of Science or better
Bachelor of Arts Degree or better
Licenses & Certifications
Required
FINRA Series 63

Environmental, Health and Safety AssociateThe Isosceles Group is looking for a full-time Environmental, Health and Safety (EHS) Associate to provide environmental, health and safety (EHS) support services for one of its clients’ corporate operations in the Washington DC metropolitan area and one or two other regional offices/smaller ops centers in the US. Some work will require onsite activity; however, a reasonable portion of the work can be performed remotely. The split between onsite and remote work will vary over time, but the selected candidate must be able to work onsite for extended periods if necessary. Travel is possible within the US but is expected to be minimal. Our client is a large, diversified management and facility support services firm providing operational services globally.EHS job duties will include, but are not limited to the following:Assist in the site-to-site implementation of the organization's health and safety policy and procedures so that all employees have a safe and healthy working environment.Assist in conducting EHS Audits to determine levels of compliance at sites with local regulations and company Standards.Work with site EHS teams to identify workplace hazards and unsafe equipment, working practices, or working conditions.Conducting Job Hazard Analyses and ergonomic assessments.As needed, lead or participate in incident investigations to determine root causes and corrective actions.Implementing Emergency Response Programs.Oversight of injury and illness tracking and reporting.Conducting safety housekeeping inspections and reviewing safe work practices.Oversight of waste management activities.Management of applicable permits, filings, submittals and registrations with applicable regulatory agencies.Reviewing and approving new chemicals.Organizing and participating in site safety meetings.Assist with developing new or updating existing EHS Standards as new activities and risks arise.Assist in developing training programs to be used at site levels.Provide assistance with management of implementation of ISO 14001/45001 certifications to a broader set of facilities globally and assist in tracking and reporting on annual performance and findings of annual ISO audits by 3rdparties.Assist with communication of EHS performance, issues, objectives, and accomplishments.Provide monthly updates as highlights for senior management.The EHS Associate in this position will work with and respond to requests from Isosceles’ client’s Corporate EHS Director.The applicants should have the following qualifications:Minimum Bachelor’s Degree in a related field, preferably with 2-5 years’ experience.Experience or demonstrated passion for environmental or health and safety work is required.Very detailed oriented.Great internet research skills.Work well under deadlines.Be able to multi-task.Be able to communicate well with high-level executives and management.Have high degree of experience with Microsoft Office and Excel among other software and computer operating systems.Have an understanding of how to analyze laws and explain their requirements.Working knowledge of OSHA and EPA laws and requirements.Experience with management systems such as ISO 14001 or 45001.The candidate must be capable of self-directed work, have excellent communication and negotiation skills, willingness to travel, and the ability to handle a diverse and varied set of job responsibilities. The candidate’s working hours must be able to match those of the operations where the work is to be performed and may include occasional weekends or evenings.The Isosceles Group is a Boston, MA based international consulting firm, providing domestic and international corporations with environmental, health and safety regulatory compliance support and sustainability services.Benefits will include major medical, vacation, holidays, sick time and participation in an IRA program.The selected candidate must be a US citizen and will be required to pass a background and medical check, as required by its client, as a condition of employment.The anticipated start date is immediate. Salary will depend on experience.Applicants must submit a resume (2 pages max) and cover letter. The deadline for submission of applications is February 8, 2021. Interviews and offers will take place on a rolling basis as qualified candidates are identified and an offer may be made before the final resume submittal date has been reached.Job Type: Full-timeBenefits:Disability insuranceHealth insuranceLife insurancePaid time offRetirement planWork Location:Multiple locationsCompany's website:www.theisogroup.comCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview process

About Equal Justice Works:
The mission of Equal Justice Works is to create opportunities for lawyers to transform their passion for equal justice into a lifelong commitment to public service. We believe that a community of lawyers committed to public service can fulfill our nation's promise of equal justice for all.
Position Overview
The Administrative Specialist is a generalist position that supports and backstops the functions of the administration unit and the finance team in service to the organization. The specialist is accountable for supporting physical space management, and the financial systems, policies, and processes of the organization. The specialist trains and supports staff on the organization’s financial systems and policies, and is a liaison with the finance team, providing internal administrative support to this outsourced function. The specialist is also the point of contact for all building-related services. This role reports to the Vice President of Administration and supports the Executive Vice President as required.
Responsibilities:
Office Support:
Provide general office support to staff and visitors, including space allocation, maintenance, and equipment requests
Point person for maintenance, storage, equipment, bills, and errands
Assists VP Admin in procurement of equipment, furniture, supplies, and other office needs
Liaise with building management on all facility-related issues
Coordinate organization electronic and paper records consistent with retention policies; identify and support improvements for systems and processes
Support VP Admin and EVP with project management and execution
Financial Support:
Responsible for supporting accounts payable system and organization credit card accounts, recording vendor agreements, making cash deposits, fulfilling check requests, and other administrative financial support as needed.
Provide training and support to staff as point-of-contact on accounting policies and related systems, such as Anybill (A/P) and Concur (company credit cards)
Liaise with Raffa/Marcum finance team and provide support as needed for ongoing financial management and accounting functions
Support VP Admin with departmental budget and expense tracking and management
Support EVP as needed with financial requests and reports
Excellent communication, organizational, and administrative skills, follow-through, and meticulous attention to detail
Ability to successfully manage multiple responsibilities and deadlines
Proactive problem solving and intuition to improve processes
Demonstrated proficiency with MS Office products (Excel, Word, Teams, OneDrive)
Demonstrated technical savvy, including experience using cloud-based systems for A/P, A/R, and budget management
Flexibility: ability to work with a fast-paced, dynamic organization – in-person and in a remote environment
Interest in social justice and nonprofit management
At least 3 years of successful, progressively complex professional experience and a college degree
Finance, accounting, project management, and/or nonprofit management education and experience preferred
EQUAL JUSTICE WORKS is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, gender identity, age, marital status, personal appearance, sexual orientation, family responsibilities, physical or mental handicap, matriculation, or political affiliation.

The STARs Pathways Collective accelerates innovation that unlocks STARs wage mobility through learn-by-doing projects that build collective workforce knowledge and action. The Sr Manager, STARs Design Programs is a leader with proven ability to lead both projects and partner relationships effectively in a fast-paced environment. This role will partner with international design firm IDEO to define, implement and expand on collective action design projects that catalyze employers and other regional workforce actors for STAR income mobility. In collaboration with Partner Development, this role will build trusted partner relationships that grow with the partner and Collective’s business goals by ensuring project readiness and representing partner priorities, ideas and needs in project designs and outcomes. This role will also lead efforts to assimilate cross-partner and cross-project learnings and outputs, providing a strategic POV and recommendations on the path towards replicable, scalable STAR solutions. This position can be based in Washington, D.C, the San Francisco/Bay Area or remote and will report directly to the Director of Strategic Initiatives.
Key Responsibilities
Co-develop STARs Innovation Studio (Studio) design projects with IDEO focused primarily on workforce tools and service solutions that support STARs career journeys
Support Partnership Development to identify prospects and close partner commitments to engage in Studio design projects
Build subject matter expertise in tool, services or job pathway barriers for STARs and Employers
Research and write Situation Analysis for Studio projects that summarize the problem, opportunity and resolution options, in partnership with the Insights team
Actively participate in Studio charrettes, design sprints and prototypes
Capture and package partner and Studio project learnings and outputs, with IDEO and the Mobilization and Marketing Communication teams
Lead partner follow up efforts to debrief and determine interest in related or new projects
Manage and grow partner relationships in collaboration with the Partnership team
Track partner status and opportunities in O@W’s CRM and project management systems
Partner with Resource Mobilization to define Studio program/project funding needs & pitch
Optimize Studio/Collective processes, tools and communications for efficiency and scale
Provide input on Collective strategy, roadmap and metrics
Lead or support other Collective projects as needed

Skills Knowledge and Expertise
3+ years workforce development experience, managing and growing partnerships within and/or across training providers, companies, talent financing or education software
Demonstrated ability to become a subject matter expert in new business domains
Highly organized with proven project management skills, able to define projects and drive to successful outcomes
Demonstrated ability to build trust, develop strong relationships and effectively grow business with partners or customers
Strong verbal and written communication able to make complex topics clear and produce briefs, reports and pitch decks equally well
Capable meeting facilitator and presenter who is comfortable giving presentations to varying levels
Energetic self-starter capable of identifying next steps and resolving problems proactively
Collaborative team player with excellent interpersonal skills
Agile and comfortable working in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment
Experience with sales, healthcare, technology or corporate HR a plus
15% travel potential (post-covid)

Benefits

Compensation: We believe in equal pay for equal work. Salary for our positions are based on market data and NOT what you’ve been paid before nor your negotiation skills.
Healthcare: We pay 100% of your medical, dental, and vision coverage and 50% of the premium for your spouse and/or dependents.
Retirement: We match 4% of your salary (up to a maximum of $5,000) annually, and will contribute an additional 1% of your salary, even if you don’t make a contribution.
Paid Time Off We value work/life balance and trust our team members to be productive. In service of this, our Responsible Paid Time Off policy does not limit time off. Additionally, we are closed for major holidays including the last week of the year.
Parental Leave: To help support new parents in the workplace, we offer 12 weeks of paid parental leave.
Flexible Work Schedules: We are 100% remote through Q1 2021 and afterward will continue to offer flexible schedules including partial work from home options.
Professional Development: We believe that developing our team members’ skills is a pathway to accomplishing our mission. To this end, we offer you $2,000 annually for the professional development opportunities of your choice.
AccommodationsAccommodations are available for applicants with disabilities in all phases of the application and employment process. Equal OpportunityOpportunity@Work is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce at all levels of the organization. We value and encourage the contributions of our employees and strive to create an environment where everyone can reach their full potential and drive outstanding results. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, age, sex, religion, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, gender identity or expression, or any other basis protected by local, state, or federal law. This policy applies with regard to all aspects of one’s employment, including hiring, transfer, promotion, compensation, eligibility for benefits, and termination.

Minor adjustments to the normal schedule will be considered. This will be a fully remote position with on-site need determined at the conclusion of the pandemic. About Us:


The KonTerra Group exists to support the health and effectiveness of organizations and their people. With a focus on supporting organizations working in challenging environments, we develop solutions that sharpen clarity, strengthen resilience, and incorporate learning in the workplace such as short-term counseling, critical incident management services, executive coaching, organizational resilience and more. Our government, NGO and private sector clients are diligently supported by a team of seasoned professionals who are passionate about the work we do.
The Opportunity:
The Account Management team at KonTerra is responsible for the overall satisfaction, retention and day-to-day support of our clients. The Account Specialist role within our Staff Care and Resilience (SCR) practice is critically important in supporting our clients and the Account Managers by providing high-touch, responsive support. Depending on the aspiration and performance of the incumbent, it is possible to grow into an Account Manager role over time.
This is a remote role that will operate during Eastern Standard business hours and perform these and other essential duties as required:

Serve as the lead point of contact for a set of accounts, managing matters specific to clients from contract execution, launch of services, ongoing service delivery, contract renewal and growth/expansion
Build and maintain strong, long-lasting client relationships
Updating CRM, Salesforce, regularly with information and tracking renewals
Collaborate closely and effectively with the SCR Operations team, subject matter experts and other internal KonTerra teams, as necessary, at all stages of client engagement
Coordinate and/or assist with critical incident response
Consult with and advise clients on any ongoing needs, including opportunities to expand services as appropriate
Partner with clients and manage regularly cadenced (monthly or quarterly) promotion of KonTerra’s services to support and maintain a high retention rate
Manage challenging client requests or issue escalations as needed
Collaborating with Account Managers in managing account activities and process
Professionally represent KonTerra at industry events
Work collaboratively, fostering relationships with subject matter experts and sales & account management teams within KonTerra
Provide input on new processes and workflows as needed
As this position is in development with respect to company growth, the position description may be modified as the overall operational aspects of the company change and evolve over time
Manage multiple client projects and tasks to successful completion
Work effectively in a diverse team environment and promote KonTerra’s mission, values, and objectives


The Qualified Candidate Will Possess:


Demonstrated, successful in a client management role/customer service role
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in a professional context
Superior organizational skills, proven problem-solving ability and strong attention to detail
Dependability, trustworthiness and resourcefulness skills
The ability to meet deadlines, multitask, and work well with others in a fast-paced environment
Competence in Microsoft Office, Google Workspace, and Salesforce platforms
Proven ability to work both independently and as an effective team member


Top Contenders Will Possess:


Study/living abroad or volunteer or professional experience within the international humanitarian aid industry
Previous experience working virtually/remotely
Relevant experience in the mental health or organizational development field
A Bachelor's degree or higher.


We offer competitive benefits including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401k, paid caregiving leave, generous holiday and paid time off and more.
The KonTerra Group provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Position Description:

Mid-Level Navy Acquisition Logistics Analyst
Serco has a great opportunity for you to take an advancing role in supporting U.S. Navy acquisition programs for highly technical systems for our ships and sailors. Join an integrated government-industry team in and around the historic Washington Navy Yard right by Nationals Stadium, but primarily remote during this time of max telework. Be instrumental to the support of U.S. Navy acquisition while building your background and expertise in support of the world’s greatest Navy.
Serco will provide support in the area of logistics management to its customer, a defense acquisition program management office which is responsible for the development, acquisition, production, fielding, and lifetime support of critical surface ship systems. This mid-level position will have aspects of defense acquisition logistics management, performance-based logistics, configuration management, government-furnished material management, training support, and related skills across all aspects of integrated logistics support.
Responsibilities
In this role you will:
Be experienced in principles of integrated logistics support (ILS) and work in a team in applying your knowledge and expertise supporting assigned programs throughout their life cycles.
Be knowledgeable in the defense acquisition process and areas related to integrated logistics support and best practices including Performance-Based Logistics and be able to apply that knowledge to real programs.
Be familiar with new acquisition practices such as rapid acquisition, DEV/SEC/OPS, and use of collaboration tools and how these advances impact integrated logistics support in a program management office.
Support program office tasking related to providing logistics support to Naval systems. Work will require collaboration with staff from the program office, other contractors, system developer/manufacturer, and government field activities.
Help to manage schedules and plans of action related to logistics support. Support the government and contractor team in the execution of program reviews, management of budgets, and coordination with logistics support organizations on behalf of the program office.
Support government managers in ILS and management activities related to development, production, and support of Navy systems. Assist in team management of projects, tracking progress against schedules, coordinating accomplishment of actions, coordinating the development of proposed solutions to issues, supporting meetings, and providing analysis of logistics support processes and progress on behalf of the government program management office.
Provide guidance to less experienced team members and work as a team to most-effectively accomplishing program office tasking.
Perform additional duties and responsibilities as assigned.
Qualifications:

Qualifications, Education and Experience
To be successful in this role, you will have:
Knowledge of integrated logistic support elements, principles, and practices in an acquisition program office context.
Bachelor's degree plus 5 years of related experience.
Well-developed team communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite programs, MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Must be a U.S. Citizen
Secret Security Clearance Required
Additional desired experience and skills:
It is not expected that you will have experience in all the responsibilities listed above at time of hire, but will have a background that supports quickly taking on some or all of these roles under the guidance of a more experienced team member.
Work experience may be adjusted based on an advanced degree. Degree requirements may be adjusted based on additional related experience, highly specialized knowledge, or uniquely applicable experience.
Experience in collaboration tools such as SharePoint or Teams is desired.
Experience in one or more logistics support areas such as configuration management, training support, manpower support, property/GFE management, Performance Based Logistics, supportability, maintenance management, technical data/documentation, supply support/supply chain management, transportation, etc. is desired.
Take this opportunity to join a high-performing team, advance your career, and make a real difference supporting America’s Navy. Join the Serco team today!
Company Overview: Serco Inc. (Serco) is the Americas division of Serco Group, plc. Serco serves every branch of the U.S. military, numerous U.S. Federal civilian agencies, the Intelligence Community, the Canadian government, state and local governments, and commercial clients. We help our clients deliver vital services more efficiently while increasing the satisfaction of their end customers. Headquartered in Herndon, Virginia, Serco Americas has approximately 8,000 employees and is part of a $4 billion global business that helps transform government and public services around the world. At Serco, our employees are our most valuable asset - we listen, respect and support them throughout their career at Serco. We invite you to become part of our dynamic team. Serco is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversifying our workforce (Race/ Color/ Sex/ Sexual Orientation/ Gender Identity/ Religion/ National Origin/ Disability/ Vets).

The Policy and Projects Manager will provide executive support, project management and policy support to the Global Policy Team. They will liaise between the Executive Director, Global Policy (EDGP) with other members of the ONE Senior Leadership Team, wider leadership and staff at ONE on projects initiated, led by, or requiring the input of the EDGP. They will manage the EGDP’s calendar and will be responsible for improving and maintaining systems for workflow and data management for the EDGP and Global Policy Team, and be responsible for developing initiatives into actionable plans. They will also provide policy analysis on a number of our key policy issues. As a member of the Policy Leadership Team, they will help build a culture of high performance and entrepreneurship in the global policy team, maintaining and continuously improving processes and helping deliver world class policy analysis to ONE and its partners.

The ideal candidate will be a standout colleague and self-starter with excellent project management and communications skills, who is able to handle a varied role, and has a range of experience within development policy. Demonstrable knowledge of African development issues essential.

This is a full-time opportunity reporting directly to the Executive Director for Global Policy. This position can be based in Washington D.C., London, Brussels, or Johannesburg. Candidates must have the eligibility to work in the country location for which they are applying.

IN THIS ROLE, YOU WILL

Support the Executive Director, Global Policy with scheduling, workflow management, team operations, and communications.
Manage workflows, track, monitor and follow projects, action items, and strategies for the wider Global Policy team.
Prepare documents on specific development issues for a range of stakeholders, lobby targets and audiences, and craft articles for blog posts, briefing documents and talking points.
Provide policy analysis and writing on key international development policy issues and provide perspectives to ongoing global policy discussions.
Identify trends and issues within the development sector and develop strategies, projects, and interventions around these as appropriate.
Maintain and build relationships with relevant external lobby and campaigning groups.
Help ensure access for ONE to relevant high-level meetings, gatherings, representing ONE at these meetings and deputising for senior staff as required.
Create processes for the efficient execution of research, briefings, and publications.
Help organise the team so that the advocacy goals and strategies of the organisation are informed and supported by the Policy Team.
Help manage and execute budgets and manage contracting and expense management.
Perform other relevant duties as assigned.

WHAT YOU BRING TO ONE

Bachelor’s degree preferred; 6+ years’ relevant experience within an international development capacity.
4 years of experience providing senior-level management support, project management, budget experience and advising the direction of work.
A commitment to ONE’s mission.
A demonstrated interest in, or experience with, international development issues; ability to quickly learn about new issue areas desired.
Ability to consistently apply good judgement and make responsible decisions without oversight.
Excellent research, writing, and analytical skills with the ability to synthesise complex policy documents and translate these into meaningful project plans, including some grasp of statistics.
Experience of managing projects, budgets and staff/external contractors.
Superb professionalism, diplomacy and discretion; ability to interact with high-level individuals internally and externally.
Entrepreneurial spirit; does not mind unstructured and sometimes unpredictable environments.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Excellent interpersonal skills
Exceptional organisational skills and attention to detail
Ability to multitask and prioritise several projects and advise senior colleagues on prioritisation.
Ability to work well in a fast-paced environment and take responsibility for delivering projects across time zones.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)
Comfortable using data and other information sources to inform critical thinking and guide decision-making.

OTHER ATTRIBUTES

Ability to navigate a global matrix organisation
Highly organised, analytical and self-motivated
Collaborative approach and strong interpersonal skills
Remain positive in high pressure and stressful situations
Critical thinking, communication, and relationship-building skills
Takes action and is results focused
Flexible and resourceful approach
Independent problem solver

LANGUAGE SKILLS

Fluency in English required. Proficiency in other languages highly preferred such as French and German.

TRAVEL

No travel expectations currently. Expected to resume some occasional travel when deemed safe and appropriate to do so.

WORK ENVIRONMENT

Remote work environment at the time of hire. In-office work options available and standard office work environment in the future when appropriate to accommodate.

APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS

Are you ready to join the fight against extreme poverty and preventable disease? Please submit a resume and cover letter to this opening at ONE jobs!

ONE is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants. When an applicant with a disability needs an accommodation to have an equal opportunity to compete for a job, they may request it orally or in writing (please visit the Contact Us page on the web; www.one.org/us/about/contact/). ONE will process requests for reasonable accommodation and will provide reasonable accommodations where appropriate, in a prompt and efficient manner.

ONE is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in its selection and employment practices. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, age, or other legally protected characteristics.

Due to the number of inquiries that ONE receives, we thank all candidates for their interest yet only those who are selected for an interview will be contacted.
